title: Delegation of International High School Students with Truman
Scopenote: Delegation of high school children from 17 nations, with Truman in the Oval Office.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Joseph O. Shelby Portrait
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an engraving of Joseph O. Shelby, by A. H. Ritchie. He became a brigadier general in the Confederate Army.   From: Milton Perry.

title: Special Order #64: Banishment
Scopenote: This picture shows Special Order #64 which banished residents from Independence, Missouri in August 1863. They were not allowed to go to the Counties of Platte, Clay, Ray, or Carroll, Missouri. Moreover, they were not allowed to return until the end of the rebellion. The order was signed by Brigadier General Ewing. From Milton Perry.

title: Cartoon by Summers "Harry Will be Sorry"
Scopenote: Political cartoon by Summers showing an angry cowboy labeled States Rights storming off to the Capitol with a lasso called Filibuster and a pantleg called Dixiecrats. From the White House there is a Special Session Call going out. This refers to President Harry S. Truman calling the Congress back into session in September, 1948.

title: Special Order #64: Banishment
Scopenote: This picture in negative shows Special Order #64 which banished residents from Independence, Missouri in August 1863. They were not allowed to go to the Counties of Platte, Clay, Ray, or Carroll, Missouri. Moreover, they were not allowed to return until the end of the rebellion. The order was signed by Brigadier General Ewing. From Milton Perry.

title: Faked Photograph of President Harry S. Truman in a Baseball Uniform
Scopenote: An unidentified man throws a baseball. Harry S. Truman's head has been cut out of a photograph and used to cover the face of the man pictured.

title: Abraham Lincoln Letter
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a letter of condolences from Abraham Lincoln to a mother whose children died in the Civil War, dated November 21, 1864. Donor: Philip C. Brooks.

title: Independence High School Senior Class Photo
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman, Bess Wallace, and Charles Ross, among others, posing for high school graduating class photo, Independence, Missouri, 1901. Back row: Henry Chiles; Elmer Twyman; William Lloyd Garrett; Harry Truman; Will Long; Myrtle Cronkhite; Laura Ford; Mary Anderson; Gertrude Dixon; Laura Kingsbury. Third row: Crawford Compton; Leura Walters; Katie Krey; Gertrude Reyner. Second row: Tasker P. Taylor; Louretta Meador; Minnie Carpenter; Grace Crandall; Mary Taylor; James T. Brown; Mary Chinn; Itaska Atkinson; Bertha Roberts; Bess Wallace. Front row: Charles Ross; Nellie Caldwell; Emily Witschie; Faith Slichter; Lizzie Gossett; Minnie Robinson; Ruth Knapp; Agnes Roberts; Mary Womack.

title: Independence High School Graduating Class of 1901
Scopenote: A list of the graduating class of 1901 from Independence High School. On this list is Charles Ross (President Harry S. Truman's Press Secretary), Harry S. Truman, and Bessie Wallace. This list appeared in the high school yearbook, The Gleam.

Scopenote: This photograph depicts a street scene of downtown Kansas City, Missouri. Horse-drawn vehicles and cars are on the street, and many people are milling around on the sidewalks. All people are unidentified.   From: George Fuller Green

Scopenote: Cook tent of the Battalion A of the Kansas National Guard, with ten unidentified men at Fort Riley, Kansas.

Scopenote: A section of the Kansas City Star's press room in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Harry Truman and Friends in the Haberdashery in Kansas City, Missouri
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman and friends are standing in the haberdashery at 104 W. 12th Street, Kansas City, Missouri. From left to right: Harry Truman, Francis Berry, Mike Flynn, and Kelsey Cravens. This is the clothing store that Truman and Eddie Jacobson owned. The name of the store was the Truman and Jacobson Haberdashery, located at 12th and Baltimore (104 West 12th) Kansas City, Missouri The store was opened in 1919 and it failed in 1921.

title: Reunion of Battery D in 1920
Scopenote: Old banquet photograph of the 1920 reunion of Battery D, with (1) Harry S. Truman; (2) Eugene Donnelly; (3) Morris Riley; (4) L. Curtis Tiernan.  This is from an album of photographs of the inauguration.

title: Harry S. Truman's Platform
Scopenote: This is a copy of a flier about Harry S. Truman's platform during his campaign for Eastern District judge.

title: Harry S. Truman Campaign Ad
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a newspaper advertisement for Harry S. Truman's 1924 campaign for Eastern District Jackson County Court Judge. The photo ran in the Independence Examiner.

Below the photo is inscribed: "To Ed McKim, With kindest regards from his good friend Harry S. Truman and from another long-time friend Dwight Griswold. July 1, 1946."

Scopenote: Captain Harry S. Truman (seated, right, with moustache) sits with two other unidentified officers at Army Reserve camp.

Scopenote: Major Harry S. Truman stands with a fellow soldier at Fort Riley, Kansas.

Scopenote: This photograph depicts Judge Harry S. Truman, Presiding Judge of the Jackson County Court. The original photograph has been retouched.

title: Truman, Snyder and Vaughan at Ft. Riley
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman, John W. Snyder, and Harry H. Vaughan at Ft. Riley, Kansas in Army Reserve Camp.  Same as photo 64-1339.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

Scopenote: From left to right, Harry S. Truman, John W. Snyder, and Harry Vaughan attend an Army Reserve camp at Fort Riley, Kansas. The original photo was autographed by Harry S. Truman over his picture, and by Harry Vaughan over his picture.

title: Session with County Court
Scopenote: The Jackson County, Missouri Court meets for it's first session since being elected. From left to right: County Clerk Edward Becker, Eastern District Judge Eugene Purcell, Presiding Judge Harry S. Truman, Western District Judge William Beeman, and Jackson County Sheriff Clark Johnson. This original photograph has been retouched.

title: Portrait of Bennett Champ Clark
Scopenote: Portrait of 35th Division President, Senator Bennett Champ Clark. Donor: Mrs. Ralph Truman.

title: Harry S. Truman with Others at Camp Ripley
Scopenote: From left to right, Harry S. Truman, John W. Snyder, Ted Marks, and Edward McKim stand outside a tent at Camp Ripley, Minnesota.

title: Political cartoon by S. J. Ray, referring to Harry S. Truman's 1934 Senatorial campaign
Scopenote: Political cartoon "Fishing Way Out in the Middle"  regarding Harry S. Truman's 1934 senatorial campaign.  The other two people depicted are John Cochran (right) and Jacob Milligan (center), who were two of Truman opponents in the Democratic primary in 1934.  Cartoon by S. J. Ray.

title: Portrait of Judge Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is a portrait of Jackson County, Missouri Presiding Judge Harry S. Truman. This photograph has been retouched.

title: Bess Truman Attends Tea
Scopenote: Miss Mary Jane Truman (center) and her sister-in-law, Mrs. Bess Truman (right), attend a tea to promote the Judge Harry S. Truman's candidacy for Senator. Mrs. Truman is shaking hands with Mrs. Walton (left).

title: Judge Harry S. Truman Votes
Scopenote: Judge Harry S. Truman (right) casts his vote in the Democratic primary early in the morning in Independence, Missouri. Judge H. W. Goode (right) watches.

title: The Truman Family, 1934
Scopenote: The Trumans, from left to right, Margaret Truman, Judge Harry S. Truman, and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman. They are in the backyard of their home at 219 N. Delaware in Independence, Missouri.

title: Portrait of Judge Harry S. Truman with his Family
Scopenote: Judge Harry S. Truman sits on a wooden chair with his daughter Margaret on his lap. His wife, Bess Truman, stands behind them with her hand behind the chair.

title: Judge Harry S. Truman Attends Barbecue with County Officials
Scopenote: Judge Harry S. Truman attends a barbecue with other county officials for the  completion of the new bridge across Dykes branch on Wornall Road and Ninety-Second Street. Featured in the picture, seated, are Judge Harry S. Truman (left) and Judge Battle McCardle (right). Standing, from left to right: J.E. Schnitter, Judge Eugene I. Purcell, and Alex F. Sachs.

title: Judge Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is photograph of Jackson County, Missouri Presiding Judge Harry S. Truman.

title: Judge Harry S. Truman Voting
Scopenote: Judge Harry S. Truman (left) votes in the election in Independence, Missouri. Judge of election, W.J. Betts, watches Judge Truman cast his vote.

title: Portrait of Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is a portrait of Senator Harry S. Truman. The original is inscribed: "To Mary - your husband was really out with me last night. Harry S. Truman U S Senator Elect from Missouri."

title: Judge Harry S. Truman Attends Unveiling of Andrew Jackson Statue
Scopenote: Judge Harry S. Truman attends the unveiling of the statue of Andrew Jackson, at the Jackson County Courthouse in Kansas City, Missouri From left to right are Brigadier General E. M. Stayton, Judge Truman, Margaret Truman, Mrs. Truman, and Major Thomas J. Strickler.

title: Mary Jane, Mrs. Martha, and John Vivian Truman at Home
Scopenote: Mary Jane Truman (left), sister of Senator Harry S. Truman, and John Vivian Truman (right), brother of Senator Truman, sit with their mother Mrs. Martha Truman (center) in a room at home. Mary Jane is reading a newspaper out loud. A portrait of Senator Truman is on the mantle of the fireplace.

title: Portrait of Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a portrait of Harry S. Truman with Inscription to Edward McKim. The inscription located in the lower right corner reads "Eddie McKim: to my good friend and pal who the war for me Best Wishes, Harry S. Truman"

title: Harry S. Truman with an Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (left) sits with an unidentified man on a couch and holds a drink in his hand.

title: Mrs. Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This photograph is of Bess Truman, wife of Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is an informal portrait of Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman is standing behind a table at an unknown event.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with Group of Men
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman and others await the arrival of the barge Franklin D. Roosevelt along the Missouri River. From left to right in the front row: A. E. Hutchings, Fred Canfil, Senator Truman, and Ted Marks. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Truman and Judge Albert Ridge
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) talks with Judge Albert Ridge (right).

title: Capitol Building
Scopenote: A view of United States Capitol Building during Harry S. Truman's time as a Senator.

title: Portrait of Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is a portrait of Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman stands on a chair and waves his hat while at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Eats Dinner with Two Men
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center) is eating dinner with Lieutenant Colonel Thomas Bourke and Colonel G. M. Peek. The dinner at the Hotel Baltimore honored Senator Truman for taking command to the 379th Field Artillery Reserve.

title: Lieutenant Colonel Edmund J. McMahon
Scopenote: A portrait of 35th Division Association President Edmund J. McMahon. Donor: Mrs. Ralph Truman.

title: Portrait of  M. Sullivan
Scopenote: Portrait of 35th Division Association President M. Sullivan. Donor: Mrs. Ralph Truman.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Visits Wentworth Military Academy
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman visits Wentworth Military Academy in Lexington, Missouri. Featured in the photograph, from left to right, are Major Ollie W. Reed; Cadet Captain Taylor; Colonel Sandford B. Sellers, president of the academy; Senator Truman, Colonel J. M. Sellers; and Major Wikoff. Moments after this picture was taken, Senator Truman entered the gymnasium to deliver a chapel address.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman With Group
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman speaks with a group of men in Washington, D.C. From left to right: Colonel Grover James, Senator Truman, Mayor Bernard Dickmann of St. Louis, Missouri, and Edgar H. Wayman. The original photograph is retouched.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is a photograph of Senator Harry S. Truman

title: Senator Truman Speaking Over Kansas City, Missouri
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman speaks over KCMO Radio in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Enters Airplane
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman boards a Braniff airplane at the Municipal Airport in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Political Cartoon
Scopenote: A political cartoon drawn by Dale Beronius depicts Senator Harry S. Truman's support of the President Franklin D. Roosevelt's Supreme Court proposal. The cartoon originally appeared in the Kansas City Star on April 26, 1937. The original drawing of this cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This photograph depicts Senator Harry S. Truman.

Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) speaks with Senator Bennett Champ Clark (right) and an unidentified man.

Scopenote: This photograph depicts Senator Harry S. Truman wearing a light colored suit and a dark bow tie.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman

title: Portrait of Mrs. Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is a portrait of Bess W. Truman, wife to Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Giving a Speech in Savannah, MO
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman gives a speech at a cornerstone laying ceremony for the post office in Savannah, Missouri. He is wearing Masonic regalia and standing behind a lectern, with two pitchers sitting next to him.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Max Lowenthal
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (right) is whispering to Max Lowenthal (left).

title: Harry S. Truman with Two Men
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center) is sitting at a table eating a snack with two unidentified men.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with a Group of Men
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left center) stands behind a car and talks to a group of men. All are unidentified.

title: Portrait of Harry Truman
Scopenote: This is a portrait of Harry S. Truman. The original is inscribed: To Edw. D McKim, My "unknown soldier" but my most happy comrade, may he live forever. Harry S Truman."

title: Harry S. Truman Addresses the Nation
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman Stands before a microphone for an address to the nation. This is a photograph of a photograph signed by Truman with the note, "To my good friend Tom Evans with every good wish for his success, Harry S. Truman."

title: General Ralph Truman
Scopenote: Portrait of General Ralph Truman, cousin of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Harry S. Truman With Group of Men
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman talks with a group of men. From left to right: unidentified; Kansas City, Missouri Mayor Bryce Smith (standing); Harry S. Truman; Henry Bundschu. This photo has been retouched.

title: John Vivian Truman near Plane
Scopenote: J. Vivian Truman (second from right), brother of Senator Harry S. Truman, is near a plane with four unidentified men.

title: Margaret Truman Signing
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (second row, center) sings as part of a choir. The microphone in the foreground is for CBS. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with Three Children
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman sits with two children on his lap, a third wearing a Indian headdress stands beside him. The children are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Congratulating Man
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (right) is congratulating Leo Keck (left), the newly elected president of the Excelsior Springs Chamber of Commerce. This event took place at the Elms Hotel in Excelsior Springs, Missouri.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Meets with Two Men
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center) meets with V. E. Phillips and James A. Taylor at the State Democratic Convention in St. Louis, Missouri.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman on the Capitol Steps
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman is walking down the steps of the United States Capitol Building.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This photograph depicts Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with Southwestern Democrats
Scopenote: While in Joplin, Missouri, Senator Harry S. Truman (left center) is greeted by a group of Democrats from the Seventh Congressional District in the southwest portion of the state. Senator Truman is shaking hands with Joplin Mayor Orville Mahoney. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with J. B. Beams (right) in Carrollton, Missouri during his 1940 Senate campaign.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman at a Picnic
Scopenote: Senator Harry. S. Truman (left) attends the American Legion Picnic in Cameron, Missouri. From left to right: Senator Truman; Father Maurice F. Wogan, Manvel H. Davis, and Mary Jane Truman. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Bess Truman
Scopenote: Bess W. Truman is seated in a chair.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with Family
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman spent the day of the Democratic Senate Primary in Sedalia, Missouri, his headquarters, with his family. From left to right: Mrs. Bess Truman, Sue Ogden, friend of Margaret's from Independence, Senator Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Reading Telegrams with Family
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (right) sits around the table with his wife, Bess Truman (left), and daughter, Margaret Truman (center), reading congratulatory telegrams for winning the 1940 Democratic Primary. Senator Truman defeated Governor Lloyd Stark and Maurice Mulligan to win the Democratic nomination for Senator.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman At Address With White Mules
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman stands with a group of men and white mules from the parade preceding his address at Brookfield, Missouri. From left to right: R. S. Brownlee, Dr. T. C. Oyler, Senator Truman, William A. Scanlon, Bill Street, C. B. Burns, Dr. J. T. McLarney, and Walter Burnett.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Giving a Speech
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (standing in the center) delivers a speech in Marshall, Missouri. On stage with him is John Hall, Democratic country chairman of Saline County and two unknown men.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This photograph depicts Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Camp Joseph T. Robinson
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of Camp Joseph T. Robinson in Arkansas.  Donor: Milton F. Perry.

title: Portrait of Senator Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is a portrait of Senator Harry S. Truman.  From: Roger Reynolds.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman Cook in their Apartment
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) is placing bread in a toaster, while Bess Truman (background, right) looks on. She is standing at the stove, appearing to stir something in a pan. A Fiesta-ware pitcher sits on the counter. They are in the kitchen of their apartment at 4701 Connecticut Avenue, NW in Washington, D.C. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Looks at Bookshelf
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman looks at a bookcase, most likely in the living room of his family's apartment in Washington, D.C. In his hands he holds a book, entitled "Automatic Arms: Their History, Development and Use." From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Reading
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman is standing in front of a bookcase holding a publication called "Automatic Arms." The original newspaper caption for this photo is, "Senator Truman reads a lot, his book fare covering a wide range." The photo is a reprint from the Detroit News Pictorial.

title: Harry S. Truman at Train Station
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman exits a train at an unknown location. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with an unidentified man at a banquet. Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (second from left) stands with a group of unidentified others alongside a train car.

Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with a man at a banquet and speaking engagement. Others are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman with Tom Evans, Fred Canfil, Lew Barringer, and Edward McKim

Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (second from left) talks with an unidentified man. The event and location are unknown.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (fourth from left) stands before the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois, as Mayor Ed Kelly of Chicago holds his hand up in the air. Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, Samuel Jackson, stands on the left. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (second from left) stands with two other men and a military officer at an unknown event.

title: Major General Paul Baade and General George Patton
Scopenote: Major General Paul W. Baade (left) shows General George S. Patton (right) a souvenir cane inscribed with the names of liberated French towns.   From: Milton F. Perry

title: Cartoon from The New Yorker
Scopenote: In this political cartoon by Mischa Richter, a hostess at an elegant dinner party seats two men next to each other. The caption of the cartoon says, "I'm putting you next to Senator Teaman, Mr. Armstrong; he's investigating you and your company." This cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: Harry S. Truman with Tom Evans, Fred Canfil, Lew Barringer, and Edward McKim
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman looks at letters and telegrams that he has received. Back row: unidentified, Fred Canfil, and Lew Barringer. Front row: Tom Evans, Harry S. Truman, and Edward McKim.

title: Harry Truman at a Naval Party
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center) attends a party at an unknown location with a naval officer and an unidentified man.

title: Harry S. Truman at a Dinner
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (seated, left) sits behind a table at a dinner and shakes hands with a group of sailors and other young men. All others are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman with Fred Canfil, Lew Barringer, Tom Evans, and Edward McKim
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman looks at letters and telegrams that he has received. Back row: unidentified, Fred Canfil, and Lew Barringer. Front row: Tom Evans, Harry S. Truman, and Edward McKim. The photo is autographed by Harry S. Truman.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Wearing a Badge
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman wears a badge for a Veterans of Foreign Wars meeting.

title: Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman poses for a photograph.

title: Harry S. Truman and Edward McKim
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman (center) stands with his World War I comrade Edward McKim (right) and another unidentified man.

title: Harry, Bess, and Margaret Truman At a Garden Party
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman attend a garden party. Mrs. Truman is second from the left. Harry is fourth from the left. Standing second from the right is Independence, Missouri mayor Roger Sermon. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Others at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) stands and points at the camera while attending the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. The other two men with him are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (foreground, second from right) sits with a group of unidentified people at the 1944 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Signs for Missouri, Indiana, and Montana are seen.

title: Truman Family at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: The Truman family attends the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Seated left to right are Bess Truman, Senator Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman. Both Bess and Margaret are wearing Truman ribbons. Others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess (left) and Margaret Truman (right) attend the Democratic National Convention in Chicago Illinois. both women are wearing Truman ribbons. Margaret holds a sign with "Truman" printed on it. Sitting behind Margaret Truman is Edward McKim. Others are unidentified.

title: 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: From left to right, Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and John W. Snyder, attend the 1944 Democratic National Convention. Standing behind them waving his hat, is Eddie McKim, a World War I comrade of Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess Truman (second from left) and Margaret Truman (third from left) sit in the stands while they attend the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman At the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Margaret Truman wears a Truman ribbon at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Family at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center) sits with his wife, Bess (left), and daughter, Margaret (second from right) while they attend the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Family and Others at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (top row, third from left) sits with his wife, Bess (top row, second from left), John Snyder (top row, second from right), and Edward McKim (top row, right) at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Also present is his daughter, Margaret (second row, left). All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Family at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center, third from right) sits in the stands at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. With him are his wife, Bess (center, fourth from right), John Snyder (center, second from right), Edward McKim (right), and daughter, Margaret (second row, left). All others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess Truman (left) and Margaret Truman (third from left) attend the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Also present is John Snyder (fourth from left). All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Others at 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: From left to right, Bess Truman, Senator Harry S. Truman, John W. Snyder, and Edward McKim sit at the 1944 Democratic National Convention. Margaret Truman is sitting just below Mr. McKim. Others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman, Bess, and Edward McKim at the 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center), Bess Truman (bottom left) and Edward McKim (bottom right) attend the 1944 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman at the 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unidentified man at the 1944 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Also present are Bess Truman (far left, in white hat) and Edward McKim (seated, between Truman and man shaking hands). All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Attends the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman leans over to talk to a man sitting behind him at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois, while his wife, Bess (in white hat) sits beside him. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Family at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (second row, second from left) sits next to his wife, Bess W. Truman (second row, left), in the stands of the Democratic National  Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Their daughter, Margaret, sits below them. Seated next to Senator Truman are John Snyder (third from left) and Eddie McKim (right). all others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Family at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center) sits with his wife, Bess (left), and daughter, Margaret (second from right) while they attend the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess (second from left) and Margaret (third from left) Truman are sitting in the stands at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Samuel Jackson (second from right) holds Senator Harry S. Truman's (right) hand high after Mr. Truman was chosen as Vice-President at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman, Margaret, and Bess at the 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unidentified man as he sits with Margaret (on his left) and Bess (on his right) at the 1944 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Bess at 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess Truman and Senator Harry S. Truman sit together at the 1944 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess and Margaret Truman attend the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Bess sits to the left, while Margaret to the right and holds a Truman sign. Seated behind and between them is John Snyder. Sitting behind Margaret is Eddie McKim. Others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry Truman Attends the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (second from right, looking up) sits in the stands at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Also with him is his wife, Bess (third from right, leaning down, in white hat), and his friend, Edward McKim (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Others at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center, third from right) sits with John W. Snyder (second from right) and Edward McKim (right) at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess (left) and Margaret Truman (right) stand up at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois, in front of unidentified others.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess and Margaret Truman are attending the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Bess is holding a light colored purse, while Margaret Truman is looking for something inside the purse. Standing beside Margaret Truman is John Snyder. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Bess and Margaret Truman are attending the Democratic National Convention. Bess is holding a light colored purse, while Margaret Truman is looking for something inside the purse. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman Attends the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (second from left) sits and reads a paper while attending the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois, with his wife, Bess (left). All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman at 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman is escorted by unidentified policemen at the 1944 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with Bess and Margaret at 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: From left to right, Bess Truman, Senator Harry S. Truman, and Margaret Truman sit together at the 1944 Democratic National Convention. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with Bess and John W. Snyder at the 1944 Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Left to right: Bess Truman, Senator Harry S. Truman, and John W. Snyder sit in the convention hall at the 1944 Democratic National Convention. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (looking up) and Bess Truman (in white hat) are sitting in the stands at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Family at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center, third from right) attends the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois with his wife, Bess (center, fourth from right), and daughter, Margaret (center, second from right). Also seated in the same row is Senator Truman's friend, Edward McKim. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman  at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman is helped from his seat at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois, as people around him clap and photographers take his picture. His wife, Bess Truman, is seated beside him (lower left corner). His friend, Edward McKim, is visible in the lower right corner. All others are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry Truman and Family at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center, second from left) attends the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. With him are his wife, Bess (center, left, in white hat), John Snyder (center, third from left), Edward McKim (center, right), and daughter, Margaret Truman (in front of Mr. McKim). All others are unidentified.

title: Battery D Reunion at the Ambassador Hotel
Scopenote: Members of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery, are seated around a set of tables in a ballroom at the Ambassador Hotel for their reunion dinner. In the upper right corner of the original photo is the inscription, "Best wishes Harry S. Truman." All are unidentified.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman with Senator Alben Barkley and Vice President Henry Wallace
Scopenote: After winning the Democratic nomination for Vice-President, Senator Harry S. Truman (left) returns to Washington. In this photo he is meeting with two of his biggest opponents for nomination, Senator Alben Barkley (right) and Vice President Henry A. Wallace (center). This photo is from Volume 1 of Matt Connelly's scrapbook.

title: Meeting of the Truman Committee
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (center), Democratic Vice Presidential nominee, is meeting with his colleagues on the Senate War Investigating Committee in Washington, D. C., following a meeting at which he tendered his resignation as chairman. Left to right: Senator Homer Ferguson, Senator Harold Burton, Senator Truman, Senator Tom Connally, and Senator Owen Brewster.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Trumans Family Listens to Returns at the Muehlebach Hotel Penthouse
Scopenote: The Truman family listens to the election returns at the Muehlebach Hotel penthouse in Kansas City, Missouri. From left to right: Mary Jane Truman, Senator Harry S. Truman, J. Vivian Truman (standing), Bess W. Truman (seated), and Margaret Truman. The person on the extreme right behind Margaret is unidentified.

title: Senator and Mrs. Harry Truman Cast Their Ballots
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman cast their ballots  in Independence, Missouri. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Franklin D. Roosevelt, Vice President-Elect Harry S. Truman, and Vice President Henry Wallace
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (left with his hand raised) rides in a car with Vice President-Elect Harry S. Truman (center) and Vice President Henry A. Wallace (far right), upon President Roosevelt's return to Washington, D.C. President Roosevelt's dog, Fala, is also in the picture, with his head peeking out over the top of the door. All others in the photo are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: President Franklin D. Roosevelt, Vice President-Elect Harry S. Truman, and Vice President Henry Wallace
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (left with his hand raised) rides in a car with Vice President-Elect Harry S. Truman (center) and Vice President Henry A. Wallace (far right), upon President Roosevelt's return to Washington, D.C. President Roosevelt's dog, Fala, is also in the picture, with his head peeking out over the top of the door. All others in the photo are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Battery D 25th Anniversary Reunion
Scopenote: Members of Battery D, 129 Field Artillery attend the 25th Anniversary Reunion at the Hotel President in Kansas City Missouri. The photo is inscribed in the upper left corner, "Harry S. Truman Nov. 11, '44 U.S.S. MO & VP-Elect." Senator Harry S. Truman is seated, sixth from the left. All others are unidentified.

title: President Franklin D. Roosevelt and Vice-President-elect Harry S. Truman in car
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt and Vice-President-elect Harry S. Truman riding to the White House from the railroad station upon President Roosevelt's return to Washington, D. C.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Clement Attlee Shake Hands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Prime Minister Clement Attlee say goodbye outside the White House. Others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Henry L. Stimson and Mrs. Stimson
Scopenote: Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson and Mrs. Stimson wave to reporters as they stand on the stairway next to an airplane. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Political Cartoon of President Harry S. Truman Leaving for Potsdam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) packs his suitcase for his trip to Germany in July of 1945 to deal with postwar Europe. Alongside this task, he faced the resignation Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau Jr. (left) as well as Supreme Court Justice Owen J. Roberts (right). Karl Kae Knecht created this political cartoon for the Evansville, Indiana Courier and appeared on July 6, 1945. The original drawing of this cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: Extended Family of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's extended family are gathered outside. Seated from left to right: Olive (Mrs. Ralph) Truman; Grace Truman; unidentified woman. Standing, left to right: unidentified woman; Harry S. Truman; Martha Ann Truman; General Ralph E. Truman; Luella Truman; and J. Vivian Truman.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman with Reporters
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman, second from the right, speaks with an unidentified group of reporters. Matthew Connelly is in the far left back corner.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Charles Ross and Bob Hannegan
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charles Ross (center) and Postmaster General Robert Hannegan (left) talk to an unidentified man (right). From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Secretary Henry L. Stimson
Scopenote: Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson (center) shakes hands with General George C. Marshall. Also pictured is Mrs. Stimson on the left. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Strikes and Disputes Cartoon by Karl Kae Knecht
Scopenote: In this political cartoon, President Harry S. Truman (behind the wheel) drives a car with Uncle Sam (first on left) and an American in the backseat (center). The cartoon highlights the economic difficulty the country faced reconverting from a wartime economy to a peacetime one. Karl Kae Knecht created this cartoon which appeared in the Evansville (Indiana) Courier on September 17, 1945. This cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: Taking Office Political Cartoon by Clifford Berryman
Scopenote: This photograph of a political cartoon depicts President Harry S. Truman (behind the podium) speaks with several media microphones in front of him. The ghosts of former presidents watch over him: (from left to right, top row to bottom) Theodore Roosevelt, Woodrow Wilson, Franklin Delano Roosevelt, George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Abraham Lincoln, and Andrew Jackson. Clifford Berryman created this political cartoon which appeared in the Evening Star on April 15, 1945. This political cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: President Harry S. Truman Placing Star On General Harry H. Vaughan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) places a star on General Harry H. Vaughan's shoulder.

title: Robert Hannegan and Vice President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Chairman of the Democratic National Committee Robert Hannegan, left, and Vice President Harry S. Truman, right, discuss matters while they sit in the Senate Office Building.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Portrait of Representative Charles Elston
Scopenote: Portrait of Representative Charles Elston, which is autographed: "To honorable Bob Freer with sincere regards and best wishes from Charles H. Elston, M.C. First dist. Ohio."

title: The Passengers are Beginning to Sit Back and Relax - Cartoon
Scopenote: This political cartoon by Jay N. Darling depicts a shocked couple entering the taxi of nervous and sweating new President, Harry S. Truman. In the second panel, President Truman drives into a "dangerous intersection" as his two passengers lean out the windows, looking concerned at what comes ahead. The third and fourth panel show President Truman accelerating the taxi and the joy of his two passengers. This cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: Political Cartoon, "President Truman's Talk Last Night"
Scopenote: In this political cartoon, President Harry S. Truman (upper center) looms over the islands of Japan, as do the atomic bombs and the Soviet Union's declaration of war against Japan. All three are surrounded by halos. The Japanese on the islands - all soldiers - look up at the three halos. This political cartoon by Karl Kae Knecht appeared in the Evansville, Indiana Courier on August 9, 1945. The original drawing of this cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: Political Cartoon, "His Fighting Spirit Carries On"
Scopenote: In this political cartoon by Jim Barstow, President Harry S. Truman (left) sits in the Oval Office and promises to prosecute the war to its successful conclusion. The ghost of Franklin Delano Roosevelt (right) looms above Truman, showing that his fighting spirit carries on. This cartoon was published on April 13, 1945. This cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: Political Cartoon, 1945 Inauguration
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by S. J. Ray. Outgoing Vice President Henry Wallace wishes incoming Vice President Harry S. Truman good luck as Truman replaces Wallace as President Franklin D. Roosevelt's Vice-President.

title: Scene On Roadway
Scopenote: Cars and cyclists speed down a roadway. In the foreground  is a sign: "For a pound of sugar a Russian labors 2 hrs. & 34 min. and American 5 min."

title: Edward McKim with Edwin Pauley
Scopenote: Edward McKim (right) watches as Edwin Pauley (left) signs a paper. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Edward McKim, Administrative Assistant to the President
Scopenote: Photograph of Edward McKim, who was the Chief Administrative Assistant to the President, 1945.

title: Fred Vinson and Matt Connelly Shake Hands
Scopenote: Fred Vinson (left) and Matt Connelly (right) shake hands across a desk. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right), accompanied by First Lady Bess Truman (left), leaves First Baptist Church. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Political Cartoon of Harry S. Truman as a Soldier and as President
Scopenote: In this political cartoon, President Harry S. Truman sits at his desk with the spectral memory of his military career watching over him and his decisions. Clifford Berryman created the cartoon which appeared in the National Tribune on April 26, 1945. The original cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: The Strike Threat, Clifford Berryman Cartoon
Scopenote: In this political cartoon, President Harry S. Truman (left) talks with Secretary of Labor Lewis B. Schwellenbach about a storm on the horizon: the "strike threat." Clifford Berryman created the cartoon and it appeared in the Evening Star on September 18, 1945. This cartoon is in the museum collection of the Truman Library.

title: Political Cartoon by Jim Berryman
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Jim Berryman for the Washington Evening Star. The cartoon depicts President Harry S. Truman with a handkerchief and holding a newspaper with the headline, "[Thomas] Dewey and [Robert] Taft Feud Over Results of War Crimes Trials." Truman is depicted as saying, "Whew! At last somebody is mad at somebody besides me!"

title: Harry S. Truman Sits on a Piano
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman sits on a piano while a unidentified girl plays and sings. This is a faked photograph.

title: Colonel Harry Vaughan and Vice President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Colonel Harry Vaughan (standing on the right) looks at a book with Vice President Harry S. Truman (seated, left).  He received orders to handle military duties for Vice President Truman, after serving as the military liaison officer for the Truman Committee. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly.

title: Lauren Bacall on Top of Piano While Vice President Harry S. Truman Plays
Scopenote: Lauren Bacall sits on top of a piano while Vice President Harry S. Truman plays the piano.  The two appeared at the National Press Club Canteen to entertain servicemen. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly.

title: Lauren Bacall on Piano with Vice President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Actress Lauren Bacall sits atop a piano while Vice President Harry S. Truman plays the piano at the National Press Club Canteen. They are at the canteen to entertain the servicemen.  The Library has checked on copyright and found no one who claims ownership.

title: Admiral Thomas G. Hart Sworn in as Senator
Scopenote: Admiral Thomas C. Hart, former Commander of the United States Asiatic Fleet, is sworn in as the Senator from Connecticut to fill the unexpired term of the late Democratic Senator Francis T. Maloney.  Pictured from left to right are Vice President Harry S. Truman, Senator Brien McMahon, and Thomas G. Hart. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly.

title: President Franklin D. Roosevelt Addresses Congress
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt, seated at the center table surrounded by microphones, reports on the Yalta Conference before a Joint Session of Congress.  Vice President Harry S. Truman and acting Speaker of the House John McCormack sit on the rostrum in the back, Truman on the left and McCormack on the right. Others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman in Chicago
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with an unidentified woman at an event for the Irish Fellowship Club at the Stevens Hotel in Chicago, Illinois. With Vice President Truman is Mayor Ed Kelly of Chicago (second from left). All others are unidentified.

title: Harry Truman at Luncheon
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (fifth from the right) attends a St. Patrick's Day dinner with a number of his friends and associates. Also in attendance are Fred J. Bowman (third from right), Eddie McKim (far right), J.F. Maryr, William J. Tuohy, Richard Finnegan, John Dreiske, Edward J. Kelly (fourth from the left, far back corner), H. Knabbs, Matt Connelly (second from left in the back corner), Bob Kennedy, Michael F. Mulcahy, J. Leonard Reinsch (back left corner), F. Ryan Duffy, and R. Hewart. This photo is autographed at the bottom by all the men present. In addition, Mr. Truman inscribed the following: " To Eddie McKim, my friend and advisor, the best I have. Harry S. Truman."

title: Harry S. Truman at Banquet
Scopenote: Chicago Mayor Edward Kelly (left) sits with Harry S. Truman (right) at a banquet. This was likely taken at the Stephens Hotel in Chicago, when Vice President Truman gave a speech to the Irish Fellowship Club on St. Patrick's Day.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman at a Luncheon
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (fifth from the right) attends a St. Patrick's Day dinner with a number of his friends and associates. Also in attendance are Fred J. Bowman (third from right), Eddie McKim (far right), J.F. Maryr, William J. Tuohy, Richard Finnegan, John Dreiske, Edward J. Kelly (fourth from the left, far back corner), H. Knabbs, Matt Connelly (second from left in the back corner), Bob Kennedy, Michael F. Mulcahy, J. Leonard Reinsch (back left corner), F. Ryan Duffy, and R. Hewart. This photo is autographed at the bottom by all the men present. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman in Chicago
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (second from right) attends an event for the Irish Fellowship Club at the Stevens Hotel in Chicago, Illinois. Pinning a boutonniere on Mr. Truman is Mayor Ed Kelly of Chicago. The men in the background are unidentified.

title: Alice M. Casey Presents Vice President Harry S. Truman with a Serviceman's Doughnut
Scopenote: Alice Marie Casey of Parsons, Kansas (center) presents Vice President Harry S. Truman (left) with a typical serviceman's doughnut.  Senator Clyde M. Reed of Kansas looks on from the right. Ms. Casey was selected as the most typical canteen hostess from among over 200 other "Donuteers." From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Ed McKim and Matthew Connelly
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits at his desk in the Oval Office with Edward McKim (left) and Matthew Connelly (right) standing behind him.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Members of His Staff
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (sitting) poses with members of his staff (standing, left to right): Administrative Assistant Eddie McKim, Military Aide Major General Harry Vaughan, and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1

title: Edward McKim Sworn in as Administrative Aide
Scopenote: Edward McKim (left) kisses a Bible after he is sworn in as an Administrative Aide to President Harry S. Truman. President Truman is in the background (third from right). On the right, partly obscured is Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Ed McKim and Matthew Connelly
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits at his desk in the Oval Office with Edward McKim (left) and Matthew Connelly (right) standing behind him.

title: Easter Sunrise Service at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman attended Easter Sunrise services at Arlington National Cemetery that were sponsored by the Knights Templar. The three men in the front are, from left to right, Admiral Ernest J. King, Charles N. Orr, and Vice President Harry S. Truman. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman is Sworn in as President
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (center left) is being sworn in as President of the United States. With him, from left to right, are Secretary of Labor Francis Perkins, Secretary of War Henry Stimson, Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, War Production Board Administrator Julius Krug, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Secretary of Agriculture Claude Wickard, Department Chairman of the War Manpower Commission Francis McNamee, Attorney General Francis Biddle, Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau, Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (mostly obscured by Truman), Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes, Margaret Truman, Chief Justice of the United States Supreme Court Harlan Stone, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion Administrator Fred Vinson, and House Minority Leader Representative Joseph Martin, Jr. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman is Sworn in as President
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (front left) is sworn in as President by Chief Justice Harlan Stone (center right).  Behind them are, from left to right, are: Department Chairman of the War Manpower Commission Francis McNamee, Attorney General Francis Biddle, Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau, Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (mostly obscured by Truman), Bess Truman, Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes, Margaret Truman, and Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman is Sworn in as President of the United States
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman, front left, is sworn in as President of the United States by Chief Justice Harlan Stone, front right. Behind them are, from left to right, Attorney General Francis Biddle, Secretary of State Edward Stettinius, Bess W. Truman (mostly obscured by Truman), Margaret Truman, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion Administrator Fred Vinson, and House Minority Leader Representative Joseph Martin, Jr. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Sworn in as President
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is sworn in as President of the United States. Standing in the foreground from left to right are: Mr. Truman, Bess W. Truman, and Margaret Truman. Standing in the background, from left to right are: Admiral William Leahy, unidentified (mostly obscured by Mrs. Truman's hat), Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, and William D. Simmons. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman is Sworn in as President
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (center left) is being sworn in as President of the United States. With him, from left to right, are Secretary of Labor Francis Perkins, Secretary of War Henry Stimson, Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, War Production Board Administrator Julius Krug, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Secretary of Agriculture Claude Wickard, Department Chairman of the War Manpower Commission Francis McNamee, Attorney General Francis Biddle, Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau, Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (mostly obscured by Truman), Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, Secretary of the Interior Harold Ickes, Margaret Truman, Chief Justice of the United States Supreme Court Harlan Stone, Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion Administrator Fred Vinson, and House Minority Leader Representative Joseph Martin, Jr. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Vice President Harry S. Truman is Sworn in as President
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (left with his hand raised) is sworn in as President of the United States.  Standing next to him is new First Lady Bess W. Truman (center) and their daughter, Margaret Truman (right). Standing in the background are Press Secretary Jonathan Daniels, Admiral William D. Leahy, and Secretary of Agriculture Claude Wickard. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 1.

title: Close-up of Truman being sworn in
Scopenote: Front row, left to right: President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman, and Margaret Truman, as Mr. Truman is being sworn in as President of the United States after the death of Franklin D. Roosevelt.  Original photo is from a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attending Roosevelt Funeral Procession
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) stands with Brig. General Elliott Roosevelt and his wife, Faye Emerson Roosevelt (center and right), as they wait for the funeral procession of former President Franklin Roosevelt to begin. Standing behind Mrs. Roosevelt is Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands With An Old Friend
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, glasses) shakes hands with an old friend as mourning crowds await the funeral train of Franklin D. Roosevelt at Union Station in Washington, D.C. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses a Joint Session of Congress
Scopenote: General view of the House of Representatives as President Harry S. Truman (standing at the podium) delivers a speech to a joint session of Congress. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Portrait of Martha E. Truman
Scopenote: This is a portrait photograph of Martha E. Truman, President Harry S. Truman's mother.

title: President Harry S. Truman with American Delegation to the United Nations Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (sitting) meets in the Oval Office of the White House with the American Delegation to the United Nations Conference in San Francisco, California. Delegation members from left to right: Commander Harold Stassen, Representative Charles Eaton of New Jersey, Barnard College Dean Mrs. Virginia Gildersleeve, Senator Tom Connally of Texas, Secretary of State Edward Stettinius, Senator Arthur Vandenberg of Michigan, and Representative Sol Bloom of New York. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs the Extension of the Lend-Lease Act
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (sitting) signs the extension of the lend-lease act at the White House as Chief of Foreign Economic Administration Leo Crowley (left) and Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (right) watch. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Matt Connelly and Stephen Early Shake Hands
Scopenote: The Press Secretary to former President Franklin D. Roosevelt, Stephen Early (left), and President Harry S. Truman's Appointment Secretary, Matt Connelly (right), shake hands. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Margaret Truman Attending Class at George Washington University
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (center) listens to Professor Ernest F. Shepard (left) as he lectures to his Victorian Poetry Class at George Washington University. All other women in the room are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Margaret Truman Sitting with Classmate
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) sitting with an unidentified classmate at George Washington University. It appears they are at a soda fountain, enjoying a beverage. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Margaret Truman with Classmate
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) studies with an unidentified classmate at George Washington University. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Matt Connelly at a Press Conference
Scopenote: Appointments Secretary Matthew Connelly (standing, second from right) and Press Secretary J. Leonard Reinsch (standing, right) at the first press conference given by President Harry S. Truman. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and the "Big Four"
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (sitting) meets with the "Big Four" Congressional leaders from Capitol Hill for the first time after taking office. Standing from left to right are: Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Senator Kenneth McKellar of Tennessee, Senate Majority Leader Alben Barkley of Kentucky, and House Majority Leader John W. McCormack of Massachusetts. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Matt Connelly Swearing In Ceremony
Scopenote: Matthew Connelly (foreground left) is sworn in as Senior Secretary by Administrative Officer Frank K. Sanderson (foreground right) as President Harry S. Truman (sitting) and other members of his Secretarial staff look on. Standing next to President Truman, with a large handkerchief in her pocket, is his personal secretary Rose Conway. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Matthew Connelly Swearing In Ceremony
Scopenote: Matt Connelly (foreground left) is sworn in as Senior Secretary by Administrative Officer Frank K. Sanderson (foreground right) as President Harry S. Truman (sitting) and other members of his Secretarial staff look on. Also seated beside President Truman is Grace Tully (partly obscured by Mr. Sanderson). Standing in the background, from left to right, are: Maurice C. Latta, Mary Eben, Shirley Green, Lauretta Young, unidentified woman (partly obscured), Rose Conway, five unidentified women, and Roberta Barrows. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Stephen Early Swearing In Ceremony
Scopenote: Stephen Early (foreground left) is sworn in as Special Assistant to the President by Administrative Officer Frank K. Sanderson (foreground right) as President Harry S. Truman (sitting) and other members of his Secretarial staff look on. Standing next to President Truman, with a large handkerchief in her pocket, is his personal secretary Rose Conway. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Democratic Senators
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with Democratic Party Senators in the Oval Office, shortly after becoming President.  First row (seated): unidentified; Glen H. Taylor. Second row (kneeling): two unidentified men; Joseph C. O'Mahoney; Dennis Chavez; Sheridan Downey; Warren Magnuson; and Claude Pepper. Third row: Carl Hatch; Joseph Guffey; unidentified; Allen Ellender; Kenneth McKellar; President Truman; Theodore Bilbo; Pat McCarran; Josiah Bailey; and Peter Gerry. Third row: unidentified; Edwin Johnson; Millard Tydings; unidentified (obscured); unidentified; Scott Lucas; Richard Russell; unidentified (partly obscured); unidentified; Harley Kilgore; George Radcliffe; Burnet Maybank (partly obscured); Carl Hayden; unidentified (mostly obscured); Theodore F. Green; unidentified; Olin Johnston (partly obscured); Brien McMahon; Hugh B. Mitchell; unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Edward McKim Sworn in as Administrative Aide to President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Edward McKim kisses the Bible after he is sworn in as an Administrative Aide to President Harry S. Truman. From left to right: unidentified, Edward McKim, Stuart Symington, President Harry S. Truman, unidentified, Matthew Connelly and Major General Harry Vaughan.

title: Edward McKim Sworn In as Administrative Aide
Scopenote: Edward McKim is sworn in under oath as an Administrative Aide to President Harry S. Truman. From left to right: Edward McKim, Stuart Symington, President Harry S. Truman, and an unidentified man.

title: Edward McKim and Stephen Early
Scopenote: Edward McKim (left), Administrative Assistant to President Harry S. Truman, talks with Press Secretary Stephen Early (right).

title: President Harry S. Truman Announces German Surrender
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is getting ready to deliver his radio address announcing the end of World War II in Europe following Germany's unconditional surrender. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Clifford Berryman Political Cartoon
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Clifford Berryman. It depicts President Harry S. Truman and a bear. The bear is holding a picture of a Civil War solider and saying "Mr. President, Cliff Congratulates You Now That You Have Joined The Boys of '61. He's One Of The Sons of '76 and Wishes You Many Happy Returns. "V-Day" is written on Truman's desk. Inscribed lower right corner, "And may you have the best of health. Sincerely, Cliff Berryman".

title: President Harry S. Truman Shaking Hands with a Dignitary
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with a unidentified dignitary (right) at the White House. Also present is John Snyder (second from left) and Captain James K. Vardaman (second from right, mostly obscured). In the foreground is President Truman's birthday cake.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Dropped Birthday Cake
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reaches out to an unidentified gentleman who has dropped his birthday cake during a birthday party at the White House. M.R. Evans is standing at the far right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Opens Gifts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) opens packages with unidentified men around him at his 61st birthday party hosted at the White House. Also present is Captain James K. Vardaman (left).

title: President Harry S. Truman Ties His Bow Tie
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman completes the tying of his bow tie during the celebration of his 61st birthday and his first full day as a resident in the White House.

title: German Surrender Press Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) holds a press conference, officially announcing the end of the war in Europe after Germany's unconditional surrender. Behind the President is: Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn, Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (standing), Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Senator Kenneth McKellar, Administrative Assistant Eddie McKim, Press Secretary Stephen Early (standing), Jonathan Daniels, Attorney General Francis Biddle, and Secretary of Labor Frances Perkins (in black hat). All others are unidentified. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman German Surrender Press Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is getting ready to deliver his radio address announcing the end of World War II in Europe following Germany's unconditional surrender. Reporters and photographers are gathered around his desk. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Kittens
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) offers a slice of birthday cake to two kittens sent to him at the White House as a present for his 61st birthday. General Harry Vaughan holds the cats while Commodore James Vardaman holds the crate the cats arrived in.

title: President Harry S. Truman on His Birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) opens a package he received on his birthday. Others present include John Snyder (second from left) and Commodore James K. Vardaman (second from right). The other man is unidentified. President Truman's birthday cake is on the table in the foreground, and Mr. Vardaman and the unidentified man are holding slices of cake on plates.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands at his Birthday Party
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with Williams Simmons (left) during his birthday party at the White House. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Admires Medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) looks at a medal hanging from the neck of an unidentified guest at his birthday party at the White House. Both other men are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman On His Birthday
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses for a photograph with members of his staff and others on his birthday. Seated, left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan, President Truman, and Commodore James Vardaman. Standing, left to right: unidentified. J. Leonard Reinsch, unidentified, John Snyder, Stephen Early, three unidentified men, Matthew Connelly, unidentified man, William Simmons, Edward McKim.

title: President Harry S. Truman Announces the Surrender of Germany
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is getting ready to deliver his radio address announcing the end of World War II in Europe following Germany's unconditional surrender.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Birthday Cake
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reaches down to help pick up his birthday cake which appears to have fallen on the floor. The man stooped down by the cake is unidentified. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Cutting His Birthday Cake
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman cuts into his birthday cake, while two unidentified men stand in the background.

title: Harry S. Truman Ties a Bow Tie
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman tries to tie his bow tie during the celebration of his 61st birthday and his first full day as a resident of the White House.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reads Victory Proclamation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing behind desk) reads the victory proclamation, officially ending World War II in Europe, with Germany signing unconditional surrender terms. Gathered around behind the President are (seated): Elmer Davis (hand to face), Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, Major General Philip Fleming, Representative Joseph Martin, General George Marshall, J. Leonard Reinsch, Colonel Harry Vaughan (standing behind Truman), John Snyder, First Lady Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, and Secretary of War Henry Stimson. Fred Vinson is in the foreground, looking into the camera. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses in front of the White House with his family while on his way to church. From left to right: President Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, Fred Wallace, Madge (Mrs. D. W.) Wallace, and Miss Mary Truman. A car can be seen in the background. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with his family for members of the press while on their way to church. From left to right: President Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, Fred Wallace, Madge (Mrs. D. W.) Wallace, and Miss Mary Jane Truman. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and British Foreign Minister Anthony Eden
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and British Foreign Minister Anthony Eden (right) shake hands during a meeting at the White House. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and his Secretaries
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with his Secretaries. From left to right: Matthew Connelly, Steve Early, President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross, Jonathan Daniels, and William D. Hassett. They are standing in the Oval Office of the White House. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Martha Truman With Her Children and General Vaughan
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's family arrive at Union Station in Kansas City, Missouri, after a visit to Washington, D. C. From left to right: J. Vivian Truman, Martha Ellen Truman, Mary Jane Truman, and Major General Harry Vaughan.

title: Margaret Truman and Captain Everett Walk Dancing
Scopenote: Margaret Truman and Captain Everett Walk practice a Virginia Reel while rehearsing for a Pan American Union party the following evening. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with War Bonds Salesman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) signs up to buy a bond from Roy Custer (right), war bonds salesman from Little Rock, Arkansas, who has sold over $500,000 worth of bonds. On the left is Senator John L. McClellan of Arkansas. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Matthew Connelly
Scopenote: Matthew Connelly, Appointment Secretary to President Harry S. Truman, reads a book on board the President's airplane, The Sacred Cow.

title: Vietta Garr Prepares a Meal
Scopenote: Vietta Garr, long time cook for the Truman family, is preparing a meal while managing the soda fountain and lunch counter at Crown Drug on 12th and Paseo in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: View of Truman Home From Window Across the Street
Scopenote: This is a view of the Truman home from a window across the street.  A man is mowing the lawn in front of the house.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Harry Hopkins, William Leahy, and Joseph Davies
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (sitting) examines a report as Joseph E. Davies (left), Admiral William D. Leahy (center standing), and Harry Hopkins (right) watch. Hopkins and Davis were guests of the President for breakfast and gave reports. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Harry Hopkins and Admiral William D. Leahy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) talks to Harry Hopkins (right) while Admiral William D. Leahy (left) looks on. A breakfast guest of President Truman, Hopkins presented a report to the president. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awarding Congressional Medal of Honor to Luther Skaggs, Jr
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) awards Private First Class Luther Skaggs, Jr. the Congressional Medal of Honor as Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal (left) and others look on. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Medal of Honor Recipients and Families
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing outside the White House with Congressional Medal of Honor recipients (front row) and their family members. From left to right, front row: Major Everett P. Pope, Private Gino J. Merli, Laurett Graham (niece of Lieutenant Rouh), Private First Class Luther Skaggs, Jr., and Lieutenant Carlton Rouh. Left to right, second row: unknown, General George Marshall, President Truman, General Alexander A. Vandegrift, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awarding Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman awards the Congressional Medal of Honor to Lieutenant Carlton R. Rouh. Lt. Rouh was given the medal for risking his life to save two comrades by throwing himself in front of a Japanese grenade. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Car Waving His Hat
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat while sitting in a car in Portland, Oregon. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman At Eisenhower Welcome
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (second from left) and Margaret Truman (third from left) stand at Liberty Memorial Mall during the welcoming ceremonies for Dwight D. Eisenhower. All others are unidentified.

title: Edward Stettinius Signs United Nations Charter
Scopenote: The United States delegation to the United Nations signs the charter at the meeting in San Francisco, California. President Harry S. Truman (second from left) looks on as Secretary of State Edward Stettinius Jr. (third from left) signs the document. The flags of countries around the world circle the room. Others on the right are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses the United Nations Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses the closing session of the United Nations Conference in San Francisco, California. Others are unidentified.

title: Edward Stettinius Signs the United Nations Charter
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) listens while Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (seated) speaks at the closing session of the United Nations Conference in San Francisco, California. Standing on the right are Senators Theodore Green (right) and Tom Connally (second from right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses the United Nations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes the hand of an unidentified man after signing the United Nations Charter at the San Francisco conference. Also present are Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (second from left) and Senator Tom Connally (fourth from left, partly obscured). Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses the United Nations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind the podium) addresses the closing session of the United Nations Conference at San Francisco, California. Seated on the right is Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (closest to podium) and Alger Hiss. Seated behind President Truman is Military Aide Major General Harry Vaughan (left) and Naval Aide Captain James Vardaman (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses the United Nations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind the podium) addresses the closing session of the United Nations Conference at  San Francisco, California. Standing behind President Truman on the right is Naval Aide Captain James Vardaman. Partly visible behind President Truman is Major General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

title: Secretary of State Edward Stettinius Signs the United Nations Charter
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) watches as Secretary of State Edward Stettinius signs the United Nations Charter at the San Francisco Conference. All others are unidentified.

title: Edward Stettinius Signs the United Nations Charter
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) watches as Secretary of State Edward Stettinius signs the United Nations Charter at the San Francisco Conference. Standing on the far right is Senator Theodore Green. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses the United Nations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind the podium) is applauded after his address to the closing session of the United Nations as San Francisco, California. Standing next to President Truman is Secretary of State Edward Stettinius and conference Secretary-General Alger Hiss. Standing behind President Truman is Major General Harry Vaughan (second from left) and Captain James Vardaman (third from left). All others are unidentified.

title: Secretary of State Edward Stettinius Signs the United Nations Charter
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) watches as Secretary of State Edward Stettinius signs the United Nations Charter at the San Francisco conference. Others are unidentified.

title: Senator Tom Connally Signs the United Nations Charter
