Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (second from left) watch as Senator Tom Connally signs the United Nations Charter at the San Francisco conference.  Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses the United Nations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind the podium) addresses the closing session of the United Nations Conference at San Francisco, California. Seated on the right is Secretary of State Edward Stettinius (closest to podium) and Alger Hiss. Seated behind President Truman is Military Aide Major General Harry Vaughan (left) and Naval Aide Captain James Vardaman (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Waving Hat
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat before entering the summer White House in Independence, Missouri. The Secret Service man holding the door is unidentified.

title: Sale of the First Sheet of the Roosevelt Memorial Stamps
Scopenote: Postmaster General Frank C. Walker sells the first sheet of the 3-cent postage stamp of the Roosevelt Memorial Series to former Secretary of State Cordell Hull. From left to right: Walker, Joseph J. Lawler (third assistant Postmaster General), Hull, and Mrs. Frances Hull. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets a Crowd in Kansas City, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is greeting a crowd that has gathered near the presidential airplane in Kansas City, Missouri. President Truman was back from a United Nations Conference and was on the way to his home in Independence, Missouri, where he would spend a few day. Margaret Truman (left) stands next to her father. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at University of Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivers a speech at the University of Kansas City campus in Kansas City, Missouri. The speech is in honor of the 50th anniversary of the Kansas City School of Law, which President Harry S. Truman briefly attended. Standing in the background on the left is President Truman's Naval Aide, Captain James Vardaman. In the foreground, two boys are holding up something, covered with a cloth. All others are unidentified. The original photograph is heavily retouched.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Honorary Degree
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) receives an honorary degree from Clarence Decker, President of the Kansas City University (foreground, right), accompanied by Naval aide Capt. James K. Vardaman, Jr. at rear, right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Family
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and First Lady Bess Truman (right) celebrate their 26th wedding anniversary while attending a Merchants Association dinner at the Hotel Muehlebach in Kansas City, Missouri. Also attending the celebration is their daughter, Margaret Truman (center).

title: President Harry S. Truman and James Byrnes Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) meets with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) at one of their discussions in preparation for the Potsdam conference. They are traveling to the Conference on board the USS Augusta.

title: Opening Session of the Potsdam Conference
Scopenote: Allied leaders sit down for the opening session of the Potsdam Conference in Potsdam, Germany. President Harry S. Truman is seated foreground (back to camera). Soviet Prime Minister Josef Stalin is at right. British Prime Minister Winston Churchill is at left. Secretary of State James Byrnes is seated to the right of President Truman. Admiral William Leahy is seated two to the right of President Truman. British foreign minister Anthony Eden is to the left of Winston Churchill. Soviet foreign minister Vyacheslav Molotov is to the left of Prime Minister Stalin. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and James Byrnes Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) meets with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) at one of their discussions in preparation for the Potsdam conference. They are traveling to the Conference on board the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Secretary of State James Byrnes Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) meets with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) at one of their discussions in preparation for the Potsdam conference. They are traveling to the Conference on board the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman and James Byrnes Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) meets with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) at one of their discussions in preparation for the Potsdam conference. They are traveling to the Conference on board the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman Eating with Chief Petty Officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at the head of the table, in civilian clothes) is eating lunch with unidentified Chief Petty Officers aboard the USS Augusta. President Truman traveled to Germany on board the USS Augusta for the Potsdam Conference. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Answers Mess Call
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front line, second from left) answers mess call with the crew of the USS Augusta, as he travels to the Potsdam Conference. All other sailors are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Infirmary Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) visits the infirmary aboard the USS Augusta. President Truman is on board the Augusta traveling to Germany for the Potsdam Conference. All other sailors and military officers are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman En Route to Potsdam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) walk along the deck of the USS Augusta. They are on board the Augusta, traveling to the Potsdam Conference.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) at the bow of the USS Augusta en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany.  The USS Philadelphia, the Augusta's escort, appears in the distance, steaming ahead.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) at the bow of the USS Augusta en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany.  The USS Philadelphia, the Augusta's escort, appears in the distance, steaming ahead.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) at the bow of the USS Augusta en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany.  The USS Philadelphia, the Augusta's escort, appears in the distance, steaming ahead.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) at the bow of the USS Augusta en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany.  The USS Philadelphia, the Augusta's escort, appears in the distance, steaming ahead.

title: President Harry S. Truman Examines Instruments on Board the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) work at taking a bearing while they are traveling on board the USS Augusta. They are headed to Germany to attend the Potsdam Conference.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: From left to right, Secretary of State James Byrnes, President Harry S. Truman, and Captain James H. Foskett, Commanding Officer of the USS Augusta, standing on the deck of the Augusta. They are en route to the Potsdam Conference.

title: President Harry S. Truman Eats With Crew Members Aboard the USS Augusta from Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman eats lunch with members of the crew of the USS Augusta. Seated with him are: Albert Rice, Seaman First Class, Independence, Missouri and Elmo Buck, Pharmacist's Mate Second Class, Marceline, Missouri. President Truman is en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany on the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) meets with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) and Admiral William Leahy (right), at one of their discussions in preparation for the Potsdam conference. They are traveling to the Conference on board the USS Augusta.

title: Secretary of State James Byrnes Eats Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: Secretary of State James Byrnes (center) eats lunch in the mess hall with the crew of the USS Augusta as he accompanies President Harry Truman to the Potsdam Conference in Germany. The sailors seated with him are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, and Secretary of State James Byrnes Meet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) meets with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) and Admiral William Leahy (right), at one of their discussions in preparation for the Potsdam conference. They are traveling to the Conference on board the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman Eats in Enlisted Men's Mess Hall, USS Augusta
Scopenote: Accompanied by Secret Service Agent George Drescher (behind Truman), President Harry S. Truman (foreground) carries his lunch tray through the chow line in the crew's mess hall on the USS Augusta. He is en route to the Potsdam Conference. All others sailors in this photograph are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) receives the latest weather report from an unidentified crew member of the USS Augusta (left) as he discusses preparations for the Potsdam Conference with Secretary of State James Byrnes (second from left) and Admiral William Leahy (right).

title: President Harry S. Truman Confers with Secretary of State James Byrnes and Admiral William Leahy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) meets with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) and Admiral William Leahy (right), at one of their discussions in preparation for the Potsdam conference. They are traveling to the Conference on board the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman Eats With Crew Members Aboard the USS Augusta from Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman eats lunch with members of the crew of the USS Augusta. Seated with him are: Albert Rice, Seaman First Class, Independence, Missouri and Elmo Buck, Pharmacist's Mate Second Class, Marceline, Missouri. President Truman is en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany on the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) meets with Secretary of State James Byrnes (left) and Admiral William Leahy (right), at one of their discussions in preparation for the Potsdam conference. They are traveling to the Conference on board the USS Augusta.

title: Secretary of State James Byrnes Eats Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: Secretary of State James Byrnes (center) eats lunch in the mess hall with the crew of the USS Augusta as he accompanies President Harry Truman to the Potsdam Conference in Germany. The sailors seated with him and standing behind him are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Eats With Crew Members Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) eats lunch with members of the crew of the USS Augusta. Seated with him are: Albert Rice, Seaman First Class, Independence, Missouri and Elmo Buck, Pharmacist's Mate Second Class, Marceline, Missouri. The sailor on the opposite side of the table is unidentified. President Truman is en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany on the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) receives the latest weather report from an unidentified crew member of the USS Augusta (left) as he discusses preparations for the Potsdam Conference with Secretary of State James Byrnes (second from left) and Admiral William Leahy (right).

title: President Harry S. Truman Eats With Crew Members Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) eats lunch with members of the crew of the USS Augusta. Seated with him are: Albert Rice, Seaman First Class, Independence, Missouri and Elmo Buck, Pharmacist's Mate Second Class, Marceline, Missouri. The sailor on the opposite side of the table is unidentified. President Truman is en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany on the USS Augusta.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Secretary of States James Byrnes Wave to British Ship
Scopenote: A destroyer of the British honor escort for the USS Augusta heads back to sea as President Harry S. Truman (left) and Secretary of State James Byrnes (right) wave good-bye. They have just arrived in Antwerp, Belgium on the Augusta to attend the Potsdam Conference.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross and General Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Press Secretary Charles Ross, and Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower chat after President Truman's arrival in Antwerp, Belgium en route to the Potsdam Conference in Germany.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Others Approaching Antwerp, Belgium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, left) and Press Secretary Charles Ross (seated, right) are looking out over a river while on a boat approaching Antwerp, Belgium. President Truman is en route to the Potsdam Conference. Standing behind President Truman, from left to right, is Captain James Vardaman, Secretary of State James Byrnes, and Admiral William D. Leahy. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman On the Autobahn
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's procession drives past units of the 2nd Armored Division, deployed on the autobahn leading from Potsdam to Berlin, Germany. President Truman is in the area to attend the Potsdam Conference.

title: President Harry S. Truman Rides Through Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: From left to right (back seat): President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of State James Byrnes, and Admiral William Leahy ride in a car past the ruins of the Reichschancellery in Berlin, Germany, where Hitler often spoke from the gallery. They are driving through Berlin, surveying the damage from Allied bombing. Unidentified Secret Service men and others surround the automobile. Standing talking to President Truman is probably Harry Vaughan. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Big Three at the Potsdam Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) stands with Soviet Prime Minister Josef Stalin (left) and British Prime Minister Winston Churchill (right) at Cecilienhof Palace during the Potsdam Conference. In the background are Clement Attlee (between President Truman and Churchill) and Admiral William D. Leahy (between Stalin and Truman).

title: Opening Session of the Potsdam Conference
Scopenote: The Opening Session of the Potsdam Conference poses for photographers. President Harry S. Truman is near the center at the back end of the table, wearing a bow tie. Clockwise around the table, starting at President Truman: Charles Bohlen; two unidentified men; British foreign minister Anthony Eden; Prime Minister Winston Churchill; unidentified British military officer; Clement Attlee; unidentified man; Soviet foreign minister Vyacheslav Molotov; Joseph Stalin; two unidentified men; Admiral William D. Leahy; Secretary of State James Byrnes. Also present are Edwin Pauley (behind Byrnes, partly obscured); Captain James K. Vardaman (behind Bohlen, partly obscured); Major General Harry Vaughan (standing behind Vardaman); and Averell Harriman (seated on Vardaman's left). All others are unidentified.

title: Secretary of War Henry Stimson Reviews Troops near Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson (in civilian clothes) is standing in the back of the leading half-track as he inspects the 2nd Armored Division in Berlin, Germany during the Potsdam Conference. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman, General Dwight D. Eisenhower, and General George S. Patton
Scopenote: Everyone stands at attention at a flag-raising (Flag of Liberation) ceremony in Berlin, Germany. From left to right, General Dwight Eisenhower, General George Patton, and President Harry S. Truman.  President Truman is in Germany to attend the Potsdam Conference. Standing behind President Truman is Captain James Vardaman, Truman's Naval Aide. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman After Church Services in Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) talks to Colonel L. Curtis Tiernan (right center) of Kansas City, Missouri, Chaplain of the U.S. Forces European Theater of Operations, after church services in the conference area in Berlin, Germany. The President is attending the Potsdam Conference and is reunited with his chaplain from World War I. Behind President Truman on the left is Major General Harry Vaughan. On the right is Fred Canfil. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Political Cartoon, "You Know Boys"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Karl Kae Knecht that appeared in the Evansville (Indiana) Courier. It depicts Winston Churchill (left), President Harry S. Truman (center), and Joseph Stalin (right) sit at table during the Potsdam Conference. Truman is depicted as saying, "You know boys - I'm from Missouri!"

title: President Harry S. Truman with Leaders at the Potsdam Conference
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Prime Minister Winston Churchill, and Generalissimo Josef Stalin in the Garden at Cecilienhof during their meeting at Potsdam. In the background are a Russian General, at left, and at right are Mr. F. T. Gusev, Soviet Ambassador to London, and military aide to President Truman, General Harry Vaughan.

title: President Harry S. Truman Inspects 508th Parachute Infantry Regiment
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (walking in front of troops, right, in civilian clothes) inspects 508th Parachute Infantry Regiment in Frankfurt, Germany, during a break in the Potsdam Conference. The break occurred as a result of the British parliamentary elections. General Dwight D. Eisenhower (walking in front of troops, center) joined President Truman for the inspection. All others are unidentified.

title: Leaders Meet At Potsdam Conference
Scopenote: Leaders of the Big Three pose for photographers at the Potsdam Conference. Front row, left to right: Prime Minister Clement Attlee, President Harry S. Truman, General Joseph Stalin. Back row, left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Ernest Bevin, Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, and Vyacheslav Molotov.

title: Leaders Meet at Potsdam Conference
Scopenote: Leaders of the Big Three Allied nations pose for photographers at the Potsdam Conference. Front row, seated in wicker chairs, left to right: Prime Minister Clement Attlee, President Harry S. Truman, General Joseph Stalin. Back row, left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Ernest Bevin, Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, and Vyacheslav Molotov.

title: Leaders Meet At the Potsdam Conference
Scopenote: Leaders of the Big Three Allied nations pose for photographers at the Potsdam Conference. Front row, seated in wicker chairs, left to right: Prime Minister Clement Attlee, President Harry S. Truman, General Joseph Stalin. Back row, left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Ernest Bevin, Secretary of State James F. Byrnes, and Vyacheslav Molotov.

title: James F. Byrnes and King George VI Shake Hands
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (foreground, second from left) and King George VI (center, right) shake hands during the King visit aboard the USS Augusta. Also present are Admiral William D. Leahy (left), President Harry S. Truman (foreground, third from left, mostly obscured by King George VI), Captain James Foskett (right), and Captain James K. Vardaman (just behind Captain Foskett). All others are unidentified. King George VI visited the Augusta before it left to return to the United States from the Potsdam Conference.

title: King George VI on Board the USS Augusta
Scopenote: King George VI visits President Harry S. Truman on Board the USS Augusta. He is visiting the President before Mr. Truman's return to the United States after attending the Potsdam Conference. Walking down the stairs from top to bottom are: Captain James Vardaman, Admiral Ralph Leatham, President Truman, and King George VI.

title: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes and King George VI Shake Hands
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (left) and King George VI (right) shake hands during the King's visit aboard the USS Augusta. Also present are President Harry S. Truman (background, center) and Captain James Foskett (second from right, slightly behind  Truman). All others are unidentified. King George VI visited the Augusta before it left to return to the United States from the Potsdam Conference.

title: King George VI and President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: King George VI of England precedes President Harry S. Truman up the steps on the USS Augusta as it sits off Plymouth, England. He is visiting the President before Mr. Truman's return to the United States after attending the Potsdam Conference. Others are unidentified.

title: King George VI Greets President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: King George VI of England (foreground, left) is greeting President Harry S. Truman (foreground second from left) as he boards the HMS Renown. President Harry S. Truman is followed by Secretary of State James Byrnes (second from right) and Admiral William Leahy (right). President Truman visited the Renown as he returned to the United States after the Potsdam Conference. Other sailors and naval officers are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Welcomes King George VI Aboard the USS Augusta
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) is welcoming King George VI of England on board the USS Augusta. He visited President Harry S. Truman on the Augusta as President Truman prepared to return to the United States after the Potsdam Conference. On the left is the background is Captain James K. Vardaman. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and James F. Byrnes Board the HMS Renown
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (right) board the HMS Renown to pay a visit to King George VI and are greeted by unidentified officers and crewmen. President Truman is preparing to return to the United States after the Potsdam Conference.

title: The HMS Renown
Scopenote: The HMS Renown, a ship which President Harry S. Truman visited after the Potsdam Conference to consult with King George VI.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Officers Aboard the HMS Renown
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right, with back toward camera, in civilian clothes) shakes hands with an unidentified officer, while King George VI of England (foreground, left, with back to camera). President Truman is on board the HMS Renown, paying a visit to King George VI as he prepares to return to the United States after the Potsdam Conference. All others in the background are unidentified.

title: Dramatic Profile View of the President at his Desk
Scopenote: Dramatic profile view of President Harry S. Truman at his desk. He is preparing to leave for the Potsdam Conference.  See 69-646 for same image.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Henry Stimson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) gets a report on bombing of Japan from Secretary of War Henry Stimson (right) upon his return from the Potsdam Conference. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs the United Nations Charter
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Secretary of State James Byrnes (right) sign the United Nations Charter. The charter was ratified by the United States Senate while the two men were abroad attending the Potsdam Conference. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Autographed Photo of President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Cabinet members are seated around a conference table for a photo, taken following a broadcast of the Japanese surrender. The outside border of the photo is autographed. From left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, National Housing Agency Administrator John Blandford, Jr., War Production Board Director Julius Krug, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion Director John Snyder, Office of Economic Stabilization Administrator William Davis, Foreign Economic Administration Director Leo Crowley, Secretary of Commerce Henry Wallace, Under Secretary of the Interior Abe Fortas, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Secretary of War Henry Stimson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reads the Japanese Surrender Message
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reads the Japanese surrender message from the Oval Office at the White House, with Cabinet members and others also present.  In the front row, from left to right, are Admiral William Leahy, Secretary of State James Byrnes, President Truman, and former Secretary of State Cordell Hull.  In the second row, from left to right, are War Production Board Director Julius Krug, Foreign Economic Administration Director Leo Crowley, Major General Philip Fleming, Office of Economic Stabilization Administrator William Davis, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion Director John Snyder, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, National Housing Agency Administrator John Blandford, and Postmaster General Robert Hannegan.  This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Reporters Scrambling in the White House
Scopenote: Reporters scramble for the phones after White House Press Secretary Charles Ross (not pictured) announced that the Swiss had not as yet received a reply from the Japanese. During the rush, one of the first reporters to reach the door fell, and the others narrowly avoided piling up in the doorway. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Announces the Surrender of Japan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at desk) announces the surrender of Japan to the assembled reporters. Seated on couch, left to right: David Niles (wearing round glasses, seated on the arm of the couch); Reathel Odum; First Lady Bess W. Truman; Samuel Rosenman, Special Counsel; and John W. Snyder, Director, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion. Also pictured: Secretary of State James Byrnes (behind President Truman, right) and Attorney General Tom Clark (standing, second from right). All others are unidentified.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1. Same as 73-2017.

title: Dignitaries Applaud During the Medal of Honor Ceremony
Scopenote: Dignitaries are applauding during Medal of Honor presentation ceremony in the East Room of the White House: (front row, from left to right) Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; unidentified man; General George C. Marshall; Fleet Admiral William Leahy; General Henry "Hap" Arnold. Behind General Arnold is General Omar Bradley. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presents Sergeant Ralph G. Neppel (right) of Glidden, Iowa with the Congressional Medal of Honor. Neppel was awarded the medal after losing both legs in action on December 14 in Germany while ignoring a charging tank and killing 20 Germans who were assaulting his position. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with a Beaver Hat
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) waves his new "5" Star Beaver hat that he received from the Chief of Police of Phoenix, Arizona. A delegation from Maricopa County, Arizona met with President Truman at the White House to discuss a hospital program. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Reporters Receive Pearl Harbor Report
Scopenote: Reporters scramble about to get copies of a report on the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor that President Harry S. Truman released. All are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman in a 1946 Ford Super Deluxe Tudor Sedan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits in the new 1946 Ford Super Deluxe Tudor Sedan that Henry Ford II presented to him at the White House. This is the first American car built for civilian use since February of 1942. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with a New 1946 Ford Super Deluxe Tudor Sedan
Scopenote: Henry Ford II (right) presented President Harry S. Truman  (second from right) with a new 1946 Ford Super Deluxe Tudor Sedan by Henry Ford II at the White House, the first American car built for civilian use since February of 1942.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a Baseball Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman throwing out the first ball at a baseball game between Washington and St. Louis.  Front row, from left to right: Reathel Odum, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, William Hassett (partly obscured by President Truman), President Truman, Admiral William Leahy, Washington Senators owner Clark Griffith, and Secret Service agent George Drescher.  Second row, left to right: George Allen, Matthew Connelly.  Behind Admiral Leahy is Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson. Behind Mr. Hassett is Senator Alben Barkley. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs a Baseball
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) signs a baseball for an unidentified young fan at the Washington Senators and St. Louis Browns baseball game. Admiral William Leahy (center) is also present. Seated behind President Truman is William Hassett, and behind him is Senator Alben Barkley. Seated two rows behind Admiral Leahy is Senator Arthur Vandenburg, and behind Mr. Vandenburg is Attorney General Tom Clark. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a Baseball Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Admiral William Leahy (right) enjoy the Washington Senators and St. Louis Browns baseball game. Seated behind President Truman are Matthew Connelly and William Hassett. Seated behind Mr. Hassett is Senator Alben Barkley. Seated two rows behind Admiral Leahy is Senator Arthur Vandenberg. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Council of Foreign Ministers Meeting in London
Scopenote: The formal opening meeting of the Council of Foreign Ministers at the Lancaster House in London, England. The man seated near the lower left corner at the table is Secretary of State James Byrnes. All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Vol. I.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Tom L. Evans and Fred Canfil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left, holding hat) walks down steps at the Federal Building in Kansas City, Missouri with Tom Evans (foreground, right, on stairs) and Fred Canfil (right). All others are unidentified. This is a retouched photo.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Bust of the Late President Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) is presented with a bust of the late President Franklin D. Roosevelt by members of the Order of Ahepa. A larger version of the bust will be erected at the Roosevelt home at Hyde Park, New York. Those present are John G. Carzio, Harris J. Boras, and Achilles Caysonis.   From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Harold Burton
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Senator Harold Burton (right) shake hands the day after Senator Burton's appointment to be Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court was confirmed by the United States Senate.

title: Robert P. Patterson and Henry L. Stimson Shake Hands
Scopenote: New Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson (left) is congratulated by the outgoing Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson (right) who has just received the Distinguished Service Medal from President Harry S. Truman (not pictured) In center back is General Jacob L. Devers. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Jacob Blaustein and Judge Joseph M. Proskauer
Scopenote: Jacob Blaustein, Executive Secretary (left), and Joseph M. Proskauer (right), President of the American Jewish Committee, leave the White House after a conference with President Harry S. Truman (not pictured). From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards the Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) awards Lieutenant Colonel Gregory Boyington (right) of the United States Marine Corps the Congressional Medal of Honor at the White House. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards the Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) awards Sergeant William G. Harrell (right), of the United States Marine Corps Reserves, the Congressional Medal of Honor during a ceremony at the White House. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: United Mine Workers Labor Meeting
Scopenote: United Mine Workers President John L. Lewis (right) and Bituminous Operators Group Chairman Ezra Van Horn (left) meet with Secretary of Labor Lewis B. Schwellenbach (center) in the Labor Department. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Pemiscot County (Missouri) Fair
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman dines at the 1945 Pemiscot County Fair in Caruthersville, Missouri. From left to right: Matthew Connelly, Charles Ross, an unidentified man, and President Truman. Those standing in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Council of Foreign Ministers Meeting
Scopenote: Alcide De Gasperi (center), Foreign Minister of Italy, reports to the Consultative Assembly at the Council of Foreign Ministers Conference in London, England. De Gasperi attended the conference as an observer for the Italian Government. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Accused War Criminal General Yamashita
Scopenote: Accused war criminal General Yamashita (left center) enters the High Commissioner's Residence near Manila, Philippines, where the war crime trial will be held. Major Aubrey S. Kenworthy (right center) walks General Yamashita through a Military Police guard detail shorty before arraignment. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Remains of the Father Superior of the Philippines
Scopenote: Colonel Walsh (left) and Brother Jose Marjabacas (right) look at the remains of the Father Superior of the Philippines. The Father Superior was shot by the Japanese while trying to escape from a tomb in which a number of priests and sisters were held. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: General Yamashita at His Arraignment
Scopenote: Accused war criminal General Yamashita (with arrow above him) at his arraignment at the High Commissioners Residence near Manila, Philippines. Others in the photo are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: General Yamashita With His Defense Staff
Scopenote: Accused war criminal General Tomoyuki Yamashita (center) confers with his defense staff of United States Army Officers through an interpreter during his arraignment before an American Military Commission in Manila. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets the President of Chile
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets the President of Chile, Senor Don Juan Antonio Rios, at the White House during an official visit to the United States. From left to right: President Truman, Secretary of State James Byrnes, and President Rios. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Soldiers Receiving the Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: Fifteen members of the Army Ground Forces stand on the White House lawn after being presented the Congressional Medal of Honor by President Harry S. Truman (not pictured). From left to right: Sergeant Christos H. Karaberis, Sergeant Freeman Horner, Corporal Desmond T. Doss, Corporal Clarence B. Craft, Captain James M. Burt, Corporal Melvin E. Biddle, Corporal Edward A. Bennett, Corporal Thomas E. Atkins, Private First Class William A. Soderman, Second Lieutenant Edward A. Silk, Sergeant Cleto Rodriguez, Sergeant Nicholas Oresko, Sergeant Dexter J. Kerstetter, and Sergeant Thomas J. Kelly. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Becomes a Life Member in the Military Order of the World Wars
Scopenote: Members of the Military Order of the World Wars presented President Harry S. Truman with an insignia making him an Honorary Past Commander-in-Chief in the Order, as well as Life Membership certificate. President Truman was already a member of the Kansas City Chapter of the Military Order of the World Wars. From left to right: Major E. Kemper Carter, Captain Arthur Brookfield, Admiral William H. Stamon, President Truman, Commander David Sholtz, General George C. Marshall, and Colonel Edwin S. Bettelheim, Jr.

title: President Truman Awards the Congressional Medal of Honor to Desmond Doss
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) awards the Congressional Medal of Honor to Corporal Desmond Doss (left), the first Conscientious Objector to receive a Medal of Honor, on the White House lawn. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: USS Enterprise in the Panama Canal
Scopenote: The USS Enterprise enters the Miraflores Lock in the Panama Canal while on her way to the East Coast to participate in Navy Day Ceremonies. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Autographs a Baseball
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) autographs a baseball for Private First Class Paul E. Davis (right), the first American soldier in Tokyo, Japan. Davis caught the baseball at the World Series. Also pictured is the newly elected Commander-in-Chief of the Veterans of Foreign Wars, Joseph M. Stack (center). From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and the General of the Brazilian Expeditionary Forces
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets the General Joao Batista Mascarenhas de Moraes, General of the Brazilian Expeditionary Forces in Italy, during his two week visit in the United States. Front row, left to right: President Truman, General de Moraes, and Ambassador Carlos Martins of Brazil. Back row, left to right: General Zenobio de Costa and Air Brigadier Antonio Appel Netto. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Before Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, podium) appears before a joint session of Congress. The president called for universal military training of the nation's young manhood. Seated behind Mr. Truman is Senator Kenneth McKellar (left) and Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn (right). All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Inspects the USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) takes an inspection tour of the USS Missouri on Navy Day in New York City, New York. Left to right: Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy, President Truman, and Captain Stuart S. Murray, commanding officer of the USS Missouri. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Motorcade on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seen waving from the first car) waves to a crowd while he is driven down Broadway in New York City, New York on Navy Day. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Naval Ships on Navy Day
Scopenote: This picture was taken from the USS Missouri on Navy Day in New York Harbor. Also pictured is the destroyer Renshaw (left of the USS Missouri) which is passing in front of the battleship USS New York, while in the background smoke clouds can be seen coming from the cruiser USS Helena. Ships in the reviewing column behind the Renshaw are the destroyers Welles and Hobby and the destroyer escort Finnegan. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reading the Surrender Plaque on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far left), Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (second from left), and Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy (third from left) read a plaque aboard the USS Missouri marking where the signing of the surrender of Japan took place. Truman was on board the USS Missouri during Navy Day celebrations in New York City, New York. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman at City Hall, New York City, Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center of the window) stands in a window at City Hall in New York City, with Mayor Fiorello La Guardia (left of President Truman) while serenaded by a choir of Midshipmen. The plaque below him commemorates the fact that George Washington had stood near that spot while the Declaration of Independence was read to the Continental Army. President Truman is in New York to attend Navy Day. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and the Presidential Party Aboard the Destroyer Renshaw During Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) looks out over the New York Harbor from the destroyer Renshaw on Navy Day. In the background is the USS Missouri giving off a salute to the President. Also pictured is First Lady Bess Truman (to the right of her husband) and Admiral Jonas Ingram (left). Other people in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Riverside Park, Navy Day
Scopenote: Riverside Park is massed with spectators for the fleet review during Navy Day in New York City, as a formation of planes cuts the skies above the fighting ships, extending far north of the George Washington Bridge. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Mayor Fiorello H. La Guardia Enter New York City Hall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front left) going into the New York City Hall with Mayor Fiorello La Guardia (right) during the celebration of Navy Day. George Drescher, Chief of the White House Secret Service, to the left. Major General Harry Vaughan is the third person behind La Guardia on the stairs. All others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman and Admiral Jonas H. Ingram aboard the USS Missouri
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (third from the left) aboard the deck of the USS Missouri with Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (third from the right) and Drucie Snyder (second from the right). The other ladies in the photograph are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman on USS Missouri Stairwell
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (top of the stairs) and Commodore James K. Vardaman (left of President Harry S. Truman) follow Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (bottom of stairs) after a luncheon on the USS Missouri during Navy Day celebrations in New York City, New York. Other people shown in the picture are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Renshaw on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (farthest right) turns to wave to the cheering crowd from the deck of the destroyer USS Renshaw during Navy Day celebrations in New York City. Behind the President are, from left to right, Commodore James K. Vardaman and Admiral Jonas H. Ingram. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signing USS Missouri Visitor's Log
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated behind the desk)  signs the visitor's log aboard the USS Missouri during the Navy Day celebration in New York City, New York. Standing behind the President are, from left to right, Admiral Jonas H. Ingram, Captain Stuart S. Murray, Mr. Grover Whalen, Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy, Mayor Fiorello La Guardia (partially obscured), and Commodore James K. Vardaman, Jr. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Boards the USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is piped aboard the USS Missouri on Navy Day in New York Harbor. Behind him are, from left to right, Vice Admiral Herbert F. Leary, New York City Mayor Fiorello La Guardia, and Admiral William D. Leahy (partly obscured). The sailors in the foreground are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Navy Day Celebrations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (farthest right) watches an aerial display from the deck of the destroyer Renshaw during Navy Day celebrations in New York City, New York. Behind the President are President Truman's Naval Aide, Commodore James K. Vardaman (left), and Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (center), Commander in Chief of the Atlantic Fleet. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Ships on Navy Day, New York Harbor
Scopenote: Ships sailing through the New York Harbor in New York City, New York on Navy Day. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Navy Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, waving from the backseat of an open car, rides by onlookers during the Navy Day parade in New York City, New York. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reading the Surrender Plaque on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far left), Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (second from left), and Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy (third from left) read a plaque aboard the USS Missouri marking where the signing of the surrender of Japan took place. Truman was on board the USS Missouri during Navy Day celebrations in New York City, New York. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: The Empire State Building and New York City Skyline During Navy Day
Scopenote: The Empire State Building and the New York City skyline are silhouetted as United States Navy planes fly overhead during Navy Day celebrations in New York City.

title: President Harry S. Truman and New York Governor Thomas E. Dewey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and Admiral Jonas H. Ingram (to the right of Truman), talking to New York Governor Thomas Dewey (left) on the deck of the USS Missouri on Navy Day. Standing behind Admiral Ingram is Admiral William D. Leahy. Other people in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Navy Day, New York City
Scopenote: Crowds gather in the Sheep Meadow of Central Park in New York City, New York to hear President Harry S. Truman's principal address on Navy Day. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: USS Franklin D. Roosevelt on Navy Day
Scopenote: The ship's company and guests mass on the flight deck of the aircraft carrier USS Franklin D. Roosevelt in New York Harbor on Navy Day. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Spectators Assembled for the Fleet Review During Navy Day at Riverside Park
Scopenote: Spectators are assembled for the fleet review during Navy Day at Riverside Park in New York City, as several ships are in the Hudson River.

title: Crowds Gather in Central Park
Scopenote: Crowds are gathered in Central Park in New York City and along the parade route, waiting to hear President Harry S. Truman's Navy Day address.

title: Crowds Along President Harry S. Truman's Parade Route During Navy Day
Scopenote: Crowds line the street as President Harry S. Truman's motorcade moves down the street during Navy Day ceremonies in New York City.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks at the Dedication of the USS Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking from the flight deck of the USS Franklin D. Roosevelt, commissioning the 45,000 ton aircraft carrier at the Navy Yard in Brooklyn, New York. President Truman is in the area for Navy Day ceremonies.  From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 1.

title: President and Mrs. Harry S. Truman Aboard USS Renshaw on Navy Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) looks out over the New York Harbor from the destroyer Renshaw on Navy Day. In the background is the USS Missouri giving off a salute to the President. Also pictured is First Lady Bess Truman (to the right of her husband) and Admiral Jonas Ingram (left). Other people in the photograph are unidentified.

title: Ships in New York Harbor
Scopenote: Ships take part in the celebrations held on Navy Day in New York Harbor. The destroyer USS Renshaw, carrying President Harry S. Truman, followed by the destroyers Welles and Hobby and the destroyer escort Finnegan, heads upstream in the fleet review. The aircraft carrier USS Midway is completing her 21-gun salute. Anchored ships are, from the foreground, the USS Augusta, the USS Midway, the USS Enterprise, the USS Missouri, the USS New York, the USS Helena, and the USS Macon. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Attending Crowd for President Harry S. Truman's Navy Day Speech
Scopenote: Crowds of people fill Central Park in New York City to hear President Harry S. Truman's speech on Navy Day. All are unidentified.

title: Spectators Assembled for the Fleet Review During Navy Day at Riverside Park
Scopenote: Spectators are assembled for the fleet review during Navy Day at Riverside Park in New York City, as several ships are in the Hudson River. Navy planes can be seen overhead.

title: Navy Day Celebrations, USS Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and other members of the presidential party on Navy Day in New York Harbor viewing the USS Missouri.

title: President Harry S. Truman and the Far Eastern Commission
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives members of the Far Eastern Commission at the White House. Front and middle rows, left to right: Dr. Wei Tao-Ming, Paul E. Naggair, Sir Girja Shankar Bajpai, President Truman, Dr. Herbert V. Evatt, and Secretary of State James Byrnes. Top row, left to right: Thomas A. Stone, L. Loudon, Major General Frank McCoy, C.A. Berendsen, General Carlos Romulo, and Lord Halifax. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Portrait of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is an early official portrait of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Autographed Portrait of President Truman
Scopenote: Autographed portrait of President Harry S. Truman, same as 58-486 only signed by President Truman at bottom on matte.

title: President Harry S. Truman Portrait
Scopenote: This is an early official portrait of President Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Opens Labor and Management Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, standing at the podium, opens the Labor and Management Conference at the Department of Labor Auditorium.  On the right is Judge Walter P. Stack of the North Carolina Supreme Court. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Thanks Selective Service
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center left) shakes hands with General Lewis B. Hershey (center right) while thanking members of the Selective Service. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Prime Minister Clement Attlee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) greets Prime Minister Clement Attlee (right) in front of the White House. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Lays a Wreath at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) places a wreath at the tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery as part of Armistice Day ceremonies. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Armistice Day Ceremonies at Arlington National Cemetery
Scopenote: A general view of ceremonies on Armistice Day at the tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Prime Minister Clement Attlee, and Prime Minster Mackenzie King
Scopenote: From left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Prime Minister Clement Attlee, and Prime Minster Mackenzie King are pictured shortly after boarding the United States Coast Guard Yacht Sequoia where they will discuss the problem of atomic energy.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Prime Minister Clement Attlee Places Wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
Scopenote: Prime Minister Clement Attlee places a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.  President Harry S. Truman (in the light coat and hat) and Prime Minister Mackenzie King (in the dark coat) stand on the far left. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Philippine Officials at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with Philippine officials at the White House.  From left to right are President Harry S. Truman, President Sergio Osmena of the Philippines, Paul V. McNutt, and Carlos Romulo.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Following the Signing of a Joint Declaration on Atomic Energy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with foreign leaders and Congressional leaders after the signing of a joint declaration on atomic energy. Seated are Prime Minister of Great Britain Clement Attlee, President Truman, and Prime Minister of Canada Mackenzie King. Standing in the background are (from left to right): Vannevar Bush, unidentified man, unidentified man mostly obscured, Congressman Charles Eaton, Senator Brien McMahon, Canadian Ambassador Lester Pearson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, Congressman Sol Bloom, and Admiral William Leahy.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents the National Geographic Society Medal to General Henry H. Arnold
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) presents the National Geographic Society Medal to General Henry H. Arnold (left).  Dr. Gilbert Grosvenor (right), President of the National Geographic Society, looks on. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Margaret Truman Christens Airplane
Scopenote: Margaret Truman christens the first American Airlines flagship to fly the Washington-Philadelphia-London route.  From left to right are stewardess Margaret Odom, American Airlines President Ralph S. Damon, and Margaret Truman.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: Bess Truman and Margaret Truman Enter the Metropolitan Opera House
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (left) and Margaret Truman (right) enter the Metropolitan Opera House to attend the opening night of the opera.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 1.

title: Captain Frank Welch and Margaret Truman at Metropolitan Opera House
Scopenote: Captain Frank Welch (left) and Margaret Truman (right) attend the opening night at the Metropolitan Opera House.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: British Joint Staff Mission Members Receive Medals from President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: High British Officers of wartime British Joint Staff Mission receive medals from President Harry S. Truman (center in civilian dress). From left to right in the front are Marshal Douglas Colyer, General Sir Gordon N. Macready, President Truman, Field Marshal Sir Henry Maitland Wilson, and Admiral of the Fleet Sir James Fownes Somerville. From left to right in the second row are Admiral Williams D. Leahy, Admiral Ernest J. King, General George C. Marshall, General Thomas Handy, and General Ira Eaker.

title: Margaret Truman Presents Baby Dolls to Bill Herson
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) presents baby dolls to Bill Herson (right), Radio Station WRC timekeeper, at the Doll House on F Street, launching WRC's campaign to provide dolls and toys for Washington's under-privileged children. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Truman Standing on Front of the Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses for photographers while outside his vacation residence on the naval base at Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Portrait of His Mother
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives a Christmas gift of an oil painting of his 92 year old mother, Martha Ellen Young Truman. The portrait was delivered by Frank Land (right).  From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, volume 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Leaders of Kiwanis International
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, seated, meets with leaders of Kiwanis International.  From left to right, standing are Ford Worthing, O.E. Peterson, Hamilton Holt, and George E. Stringfellow.

title: Admiral E. J. King Receives Distinguished Service Medal from President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Admiral Ernest Joseph King (right) receives his third Distinguished Service Medal from President Harry S. Truman (left).  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with General Carl A. Spaatz
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with General Carl A. Spaatz (right). President Truman is congratulating General Spaatz for winning the Robert J. Collier Trophy for an outstanding contribution to aviation by an American.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman presents six Congressional Medals of Honor. From left to right in the front are Private First Class Mike Colalillo, Captain Robert Hugo Dunlap, Lieutenant Richard Miles McCool, President Truman, Sergeant Vernon McGarity, Lieutenant Frank Burke, and Master Sergeant Vito R. Bertoldo. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman in the Snow
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman plays in the snow on the south grounds of the White House.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arriving In Kansas City For Christmas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman deplanes after he arrives in Kansas City, Missouri to spend Christmas Day with his family in Independence.

title: Truman Home Christmas Tree
Scopenote: The Christmas tree in the parlor of the Truman home in Independence, Missouri. The tree was sent from Colorado.

title: President Harry S. Truman Delivering Christmas Gifts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaves his home in Independence, Missouri to deliver belated Christmas gifts to his family in Grandview. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Coats On the Judges' Office Door
Scopenote: Coats and outerwear hang on the door of the Office of the President and the Offices of Judges Sanborn, Collet, and Duncan.

title: Portrait of Drucie Snyder
Scopenote: Greta Kempton portrait of (Edith) Drucie Snyder, daughter of Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and a good friend of Margaret Truman.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Portrait of James Forrestal
Scopenote: A portrait of Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: Secretary of State James Byrnes
Scopenote: A portrait of Secretary of State James Byrnes. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: President Harry S. Truman Hugs March of Dimes Poster Child
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman hugs a little girl, a poster child for the March of Dimes.

title: Political Cartoon, "No Place for a Pole Squatter"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon, "No Place for a Pole Squatter," by Jock Leyden. President Harry S. Truman and British Prime Minister Clement Attlee are depicted sitting on either side of a table labeled "Final Peace Terms." Sitting on the far side of the table is Joseph Stalin, sitting on a pole high above the table. The cartoon is from the Natal Daily News, Durban, Natal, South Africa.

title: Portrait of Clinton Anderson
Scopenote: A portrait of Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: Portrait of Averell Harriman
Scopenote: A portrait of Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: Portrait of Tom Clark
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a pencil sketch of Attorney General Tom Clark. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: Mr. and Mrs. Steelman and Mr. and Mrs. Connelly
Scopenote: John R. Steelman (left), Assistant to President Harry S. Truman, with his wife, Emma (second from left), chat with White House Appointment Secretary Matthew J. Connelly (second from right) and his wife (right).

title: Portrait of Matthew Connelly
Scopenote: Matthew Connelly, Appointment Secretary to President Harry S. Truman, is posing for a photograph.

title: General Charles DeGaulle
Scopenote: General Charles DeGaulle (with his back to the camera) speaks with an unidentified military officer. He appears to be presenting the officer with an award. Unidentified sailors stand in the background.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: Portrait of President Truman by John Slavin
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a portrait of President Harry S. Truman done by John Slavin. This portrait is in the collection of the Truman Library.

title: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman Alighting from Airplane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (right) both wave as they stand on a stairway leading into the presidential airplane. Printed at the bottom of the image is "Christmas 1946" (the Trumans used this image for their Christmas card). Inscribed on the original photograph: A very merry Christmas to Eddie Mary and all the McKims. Harry S. Truman Bess W. Truman."

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets Secretary Marshall at the Airport
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets Secretary of State George C. Marshall (right, on stairs) at the airport. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: Postmaster General Robert Hannegan
Scopenote: A portrait of Postmaster General Robert Hannegan. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: Portrait of Robert P. Patterson
Scopenote: A portrait of the Secretary of War, Robert Patterson. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: Matthew Connelly with a Lawn Mower
Scopenote: White House Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly oils his lawn mower.

title: President Harry S. Truman Examines Photograph
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman(second from left) looks at a photograph at the White House Photographers Association dinner. All others are unidentified. The photo that Truman is holding depicts him delivering a speech before a joint session of Congress on May 25, 1946.

title: President Harry S. Truman with General Carl Spaatz
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) sits with General Carl Spaatz (right). From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 2.

title: Portrait of Julius Krug
Scopenote: A portrait of Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: Portrait of John Snyder
Scopenote: A portrait of Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder. This portrait is part of the album "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: Portrait of Lewis Schwellenbach
Scopenote: A portrait of Secretary of Labor during the Truman Administration, Lewis Schwellenbach. This portrait is part of the album, "The Cabinet - December 25, 1946."

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Ship Model
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman Receives a model of a ship in the Oval Office of the White House. From left to right: unidentified, President Truman, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, and  Admiral Ernest King.

title: Matthew J. Connelly Family
Scopenote: White House Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (center) reads a book with his wife and son.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reads Speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is seated behind a microphone, preparing to deliver a speech over the radio.

title: President Harry S. Truman Swimming
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) is swimming from the presidential yacht USS Williamsburg in the Chesapeake Bay. Also with him in the water is Captain James Foskett (third from the right) and two unidentified Secret Service agents. Others on board the ship are unidentified.

title: Commander William Rigdon at Shangri-La
Scopenote: Commander William Rigdon looks through binoculars while at the President's retreat at Shangri-La in Maryland.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets with Staff Sergeant Eugene List
Scopenote: Staff Sergeant Eugene List (right), presents a copy of sheet music that he played at the Potsdam Conference to President Harry S. Truman (left). He played the piano at a dinner that President Truman hosted for Prime Minister Winston Churchill and Marshal Joseph Stalin and other Allied leaders.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets with Interim Committee
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with the Interim Committee on the Headquarters of United Nations in the Oval Office at the White House. From left to right, Dr. Shushi Hsu of China, President Truman, and Dr. Stojan Gavrilovic of Yugoslavia. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 2.

title: Matthew Connelly Receives Report from General Motors Fact Finding Panel
Scopenote: Presidential Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly receives a report from the General Motors fact finding panel that resolved the General Motors and United Auto Workers dispute. From left to right, Milton Eisenhower, Lloyd Garrison, and Matthew Connelly. From the Scrapbook of Matthew Connelly, Volume 2.

title: General Motors Fact Finding Panel Presents Report to Matthew Connelly
Scopenote: Matthew Connelly receives a report from the General Motors fact finding panel, tasked with resolving the dispute between the company and the United Auto Workers. From left to right, Milton Eisenhower, Lloyd Garrison, and Matthew Connelly, Appointment Secretary to President Harry S. Truman.   From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman pose for their first full family photograph in the White House. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 2.

title: Bess Truman and Margaret Truman Contribute to Fight Against Infantile Paralysis
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (second from right) and Margaret Truman (right) contribute to the fight against infantile paralysis by dropping their dimes into the Missouri bottle outside the Capitol Theater.  With them on the left is Richard Dobson, who recovered from infantile paralysis last year. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Mr. and Mrs. John Oeser
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with Mr. John Oeser of Westside, Iowa, who won the title of 1945's "Typical Midwest Farmer" (right). Mrs. John Oeser is on the left. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives National Officers of Future Farmers of America
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives some of the National Officers of the Future Farmers of America.  From left to right are Virgil Getto, Eugene Starkey, President Harry S. Truman, J. Clyndon Stuff, Joseph E. Espey, and Marion Baumgardner. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: Army and Navy Chiefs Attend Memorial Services for the Late General Smith Patton, Jr
Scopenote: Army and Navy Chiefs are attending memorial services for the late General S. Patton, Jr. Seated in the foreground are General Dwight Eisenhower and Mamie (Mrs. Dwight) Eisenhower. Seated in the row behind them is Admiral Chester Nimitz. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: Mrs. Beatrice Patton and George S. Patton IV after Memorial Services for General Patton
Scopenote: Beatrice (Mrs. George S.) Patton (left) and George S. Patton IV (right) leave the Cathedral after Memorial Services for General George S. Patton. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards Medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) awards a  medal to one of fifty four men and women who served more than two years without pay in the Selective Service System.  The man on the right is unidentified.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Commander Joseph T. O'Callahan with the Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presents Commander Joseph T. O'Callahan (right) with the Congressional Medal of Honor.  O'Callahan, a Catholic chaplain, risked his life to administer last rites to the dying on board the USS Franklin.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Cub Scout Robert Todd
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives gifts from Cub Scout Robert Todd, who won a trip to Washington for his sale of war bonds. The President was given a set of bookends and Mrs. Truman a pair of earrings and a necklace, all made from anthracite coal.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: Air Force Association Officers Visit President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Air Force Association Heads visit President Harry S. Truman.  From left to right, pictured are General James Doolittle, Colonel Willis S. Fitch, Sergeant Forest Vosler, President Harry S. Truman, Colonel Thomas Lanphier, Sergeant Merryl Frost, and Colonel James M. Steward. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: Amputees Visiting with Major General Harry Vaughan
Scopenote: A delegation of four amputees (all unidentified) representing those at Thomas M. England Hospital in Atlantic City, New Jersey visit with Major General Harry Vaughan (seated, center), President Harry S. Truman's Military Aide. They are visiting with General Vaughan at the White House to protest the closing of the Army's largest amputation center.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) receives the first sheet of Roosevelt Memorial postage stamps from Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (left).

title: Political Cartoon by Clifford Berryman
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Clifford Berryman for the Washington Evening Star. President Harry S. Truman is standing beside a seated Postmaster General Robert Hannegan discussing the new positions available after the Secretary of the Interior, Harold L. Ickes resigns.

title: Political Cartoon by Clifford Berryman
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Clifford Berryman for the Washington Evening Star. It shows a man labeled as Harold Ickes leaving the White House as he says, "Well, he can't say that there's any mistake about that!" Behind him, a large dust cloud labeled "Ickes Resignation" engulfs the White House.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Gold Star to Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presents a Gold Star to Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy (right) in lieu of a second Distinguished Service Medal.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: George E. Allen Before Senate Inquiry
Scopenote: George E. Allen faces a Senate inquiry into his background and qualifications for the job on the Reconstruction Finance Corporation Board. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Dr. Lise Meitner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) sits with nuclear scientist Dr. Lise Meitner (left) at the banquet celebrating her choice as Woman of the Year by the Women's National Press Club. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: Winston Churchill with British Ambassador Lord Halifax
Scopenote: Winston Churchill (right) stands with British Ambassador Lord Halifax (left) as Mr. Churchill arrived at the airport in Washington, D.C. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 2.

title: Spanish Class for Wives of Government Officials
Scopenote: Ramon Ramos (standing by the blackboard) teaches a Spanish Class at the White House for wives of government officials.  Seated, from left to right, are Mamie (Mrs. Dwight D.) Eisenhower, Margaret (Mrs. Robert) Patterson, Maryon (Mrs. Lester B.) Pearson, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Josephine (Mrs. Hugo L.) Black.  Standing, from left to right, are Miss Florence King, Mrs. Williams H. Davis, Miss Reathel Odum, Representative Jessie Sumner of Illinois, Priscilla (Mrs. John L.) Sullivan, and Augusta (Mrs. Clarence N.) Goodwin.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Secretary Clinton Anderson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Secretary Clinton Anderson (right) demonstrate the lack of difference between the new bread for America and the traditional bread. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Eleanor Roosevelt
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) visits with former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (right) at the White House. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman Is Presented with a Sombrero
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is presented with a sombrero by the Dons Club, representing the Lost Dutchman Gold Mine Research Committee of Phoenix, Arizona. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Opens the 1946 Red Cross Drive
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is delivering a radio speech to open the 1946 Red Cross Drive.  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: Winston Churchill with Family
Scopenote: Winston Churchill (second from left) arrives in Washington with his wife (right) and daughter Mary (second from right) after a train ride from Miami.  His son, Randolph Churchill (left), greets them at the station. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Winston Churchill On Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Winston Churchill (right) stand on the rear platform of a train for a trip to Westminster College in Fulton, Missouri.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Winston Churchill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Winston Churchill (left) leave Washington for Missouri where Winston Churchill will speak on foreign policy at Westminster College. Standing behind Mr. Churchill is Major General Harry Vaughan. The man behind Truman is unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman on the Back of the Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) waves his hat to the crowd from the back of the train in Washington, D. C. as he leaves for Fulton, Missouri. On the left is Major General Harry Vaughan.

title: President Harry S. Truman with John Snyder and O. Max Gardner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) receives the resolution endorsing a cash loan to Great Britain. On the left is Director of War Mobilization and Reconversion John Snyder and on the right is O. Max Gardner, Chairman of the Advisory Board of the Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Sword
Scopenote: General Walter Krueger (right) presents President Harry S. Truman (left) with a 650 year old Japanese sword. The general received the sword from a Japanese family while with the 10th Army occupation forces in Japan.  From: the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Winston Churchill Ride in Car
Scopenote: Surrounded by the Secret Service, Britain's former Prime Minister, Winston Churchill (right), and President Harry S. Truman (holding his hat) sit on the back seat of an open automobile in a parade in Fulton, Missouri, where both will be presented honorary degrees from Westminster College. Also seated in the backseat of the car is Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Winston Churchill Leave Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (upper right) exits train with Winston Churchill (center) and Admiral William Leahy (lower left) upon their arrival in Fulton, Missouri.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awarding Medals of Merit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) awards Medals of Merit to Colonel John M. Johnson (left), John S. Pelley (second from left), and J. Edgar Hoover (right).  From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol 2.

title: 1946 Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Matthew Connelly, Appointment Secretary to President Harry S. Truman, is with several fellow guests at the 1946 Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner. From left to right: unidentified man, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Matthew Connelly, unidentified man, unidentified girl, Irma (Mrs. Robert E.) Hannegan. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: 1946 Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others at the 1946 annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner. Front row, left to right: Margaret Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Henry Wallace, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, and Joseph E. Davies. Others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: 1946 Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Matt Connelly (right) socializes with Reathel Odum (Secretary to Bess W. Truman, second from right) and other unidentified guests at the 1946 annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: 1946 Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
