Scopenote: A group of men and women are seated at a table at the 1946 Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner. Seated around the table, from left to right: Matthew Connelly, John Steelman, two unidentified men, William Hassett, Major General Harry Vaughan, Clark Clifford, and unidentified woman. Seated at a table in the background, visible to the left of Mr. Hassett, is Dean Acheson. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands With Wounded Veterans
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with wounded veterans from the Washington area during a garden party at the White House. Over 800 veterans attended the event. President Truman is shaking hands with Army Nurse Lieutenant Joan Cruchacz. Standing in the receiving line from left to right: unidentified woman, Secretary of State James Byrnes, unidentified woman (partly obscured), President Truman, General Harry Vaughan, and Captain Clark Clifford. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard Yacht
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman relaxes aboard the presidential yacht USS Williamsburg during a vacation cruise to Bermuda.

title: President Harry S. Truman on Board the USS Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and some of his advisors and friends are on board the USS Williamsburg for a vacation cruise. From left to right: Ted Marks, President Truman, Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (standing), General Harry Vaughan, and Press Secretary Charles Ross. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits the Governor of Bermuda
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman riding in the official landau while visiting the Governor of Bermuda, Admiral Sir Ralph Leatham, in Hamilton, Bermuda. From left to right (in the back of the landau): Captain James Foskett, General Harry Vaughan (turned slightly to the side), President Truman, Admiral Leatham.

title: President Harry S. Truman and His Party Return from a Fishing Trip
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his party return from a fishing trip while on vacation in Bermuda. From left to right: George Allen, Captain James H. Foskett, Clark Clifford (mostly obscured), Press Secretary Charles Ross, Ted Marks, and President Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Prime Minister MacKenzie King
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) meets with Prime Minister MacKenzie King of Canada (left) at the White House.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Mayors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with mayors of several cities, who visited the White House to protest regulations of the Civil Aeronautics Authority covering the distribution of money appropriated by Congress to build municipal airports. Standing in the front row, left to right: Mayor Thomas Burke of Cleveland, Ohio; President Truman; and Mayor Edward J. Kelly of Chicago, Illinois. Second row, left to right: Mayor Edward Jeffries of Detroit, Michigan; Mayor W. Cooper Green of Birmingham, Alabama; and Mayor Vincent Murphy of Newark, New Jersey. Back row, left to right: Unidentified; Paul Betters of the United States Conference of Mayors; and unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets with the Atomic Energy Control Commission
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with members of the all-civilian Atomic Energy Commission. From left to right: Sumner Pike, Lewis Strauss, President Truman, Chairman David Lilienthal, Robert F. Bacher, and William W. Waymack.

title: General Wallace Graham Receives Award
Scopenote: White House Physician General Wallace Graham (front, left) receives the Belgian Croix de Guerre and the Order of Leopold from the Ambassador of Belgium, Baron Robert Silvercruys (front, right), for his service as Chief of Surgical Service in the 24th Field Hospital after D-Day. This surprise ceremony took place in the Oval Office at the White House with President Harry S. Truman present (back, right). The other man is unidentified.

title: President and Mrs. Harry S. Truman Leave for Independence
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and First Lady Bess W. Truman are standing on the back of the train as they leave for Independence, Missouri to go and vote. Joining them on the train is Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn (right).

title: Truman Family Returns to Washington, D.C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), First Lady Bess W. Truman (left), and Margaret Truman return to Washington, D. C. after a visit to Independence, Missouri to vote in the election. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Soviet Foreign Minister Molotov
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Soviet Foreign Minister Vyacheslav Molotov (right) talk at their meeting at the White House. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, Vol. 1.

title: First Lady Bess W. Truman Receives Community Chest Award
Scopenote: Actress Ingrid Bergman (right) pins a Community Chest pin award on First Lady Bess W. Truman (left) at the White House.

title: President Harry S. Truman Places Wreath at Tomb of the Unknowns
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman places a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery, in commemoration of Veteran's Day. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reviews a Brigade with Naval Officers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reviews a Brigade of Midshipmen with Naval officers during his visit to the United States Naval Academy at Annapolis, Maryland. Front row, walking towards the camera (left to right): unidentified, Vice Admiral Aubrey W. Fitch, Superintendent of the Naval Academy; and President Truman. Second row (left to right): Major General Harry H. Vaughan, Presidential Military Aide; Captain James H. Foskett, Presidential Military Aid; and Captain Jesse R. Wallace, Chief of Staff, Severn River Naval Command (mostly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Watches the Navy-Pennsylvania State University Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands at attention while attending the football game between the United States Naval Academy and Pennsylvania State University held at Annapolis, Maryland. Standing in the front row from left to right are: Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Gwyneth (Mrs. Aubrey) Fitch; President Truman; Vice Admiral Aubrey W. Fitch, Superintendent of the Naval Academy; Fleet Admiral William D. Leahy, Chief of Staff to the President. Visible on the left just behind President Truman is Brigadier General Wallace Graham. Visible on the right just behind President Truman is Major General Harry Vaughan. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the United States Naval Academy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, back to camera), examines a statue of a figurehead from the USS Delaware on the grounds of the United States Naval Academy at Annapolis, Maryland. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Turkey as a Gift
Scopenote: Lieutenant Colonel Lewis Jackson (left) and Senator Olin Johnston (right) present President Harry S. Truman (center) with a turkey. The turkey is a gift from Wilton E. Hall (not pictured), publisher of the Anderson Independent and Daily Mail of Anderson, South Carolina.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Members of East Asia Fellowship Team
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) is meeting with members of the East Asia Fellowship Team, under the sponsorship of the Board of Foreign Missions of the Presbyterian Church. From left to right: Reverend Tamiki Uemura, President Truman, Dr. Josefa Llano, and Miss Hsiang Fohmei. They delivered oral greetings of the Emperor and Empress of Japan.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Turkey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives a gift of a 42-pound tom turkey from Austin, Texas. The Poultry and Egg Board presented the turkey to President Truman on behalf of its members. In the foreground, from left to right: R. E. James, President of the National Turkey Federation; President Truman; and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson. All others are unidentified.

title: White House Christmas Tree
Scopenote: White House workmen brush aside snow as they put the finishing touches on a stand on the south grounds of the White House where President Harry S. Truman will participate in a public tree lighting ceremony on Christmas Eve. All are unidentified.

title: White House Christmas Tree Lighting Stand
Scopenote: White House workmen brush aside snow as they put the finishing touches on a stand in front of the White House where President Harry S. Truman will participate in a public tree lighting ceremony on Christmas Eve. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Members of the Commission on Universal Military Training
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) meets for the first time with members of the President's Commission on Universal Military Training. Standing behind President Truman are, from left to right: Reverend Edmund Walsh, Karl Compton, Anna Rosenberg, Sam Rosenman, Truman K. Gibson, Joseph E. Davies, and Daniel Poling.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaking on Christmas Eve Outside the White House
Scopenote: On center stage, President Harry S. Truman delivers a speech to a large crowd on the South Grounds of the White House. The recently lit Christmas Tree is on the right, and the White House is in the background on the left. All others are unidentified.  From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 2.

title: Christmas Tree in East Room, White House
Scopenote: The East Room of the White House decorated for Christmas, with the Christmas tree decorated and lighted.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meeting with George E. Allen and John D. Goodloe
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with George E. Allen (right), who resigned from his post as Director of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation. His successor, John D. Goodloe, stands in the center. From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signing an Executive Order with Members of the Atomic Energy Commission
Scopenote: In the presence of the Atomic Energy Commission, President Harry S. Truman signs an Executive Order that ended the wartime Manhattan Project and transferred its responsibilities to civilian authority. From left to right, Carroll Wilson, President Harry S. Truman, David Lilienthal, Sumner Pike, Colonel K.D. Nichols, Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson, General Leslie Groves, Lewis L. Strauss, and William W. Waymack. From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 2.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reading in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is sitting in a chair on the lawn of the Little White House at the Naval  Submarine Base in Key West Florida. One of the books sitting beside his chair is the "Lincoln Reader" by Carl Sandburg. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Salonica Warehouse and Quay in Greece
Scopenote: Original caption: Salonica warehouse and quay destroyed by Germans, now rebuilt by AMAG [American Mission for Aid to Greece].

title: Brallo Bridge, Greece
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the destroyed wooden Brallo Bridge in Greece. Original caption: Brallo Bridge, destroyed by Germans - note vegetation."

title: United States Ship in Pireaus Harbor in Greece
Scopenote: A United States ship, "Yellowstone," flying the flags of the United States and Greece, is tied to a dock on the Pireaus harbor in Greece. Original caption: First US ship to tie to a rebuilt dock in Pireaus Harbor - a sample of AMAG [American Mission for Aid to Greece] construction & giving view of harbor & buildings."

title: Asopos Bridge and Tunnel
Scopenote: The Asopos bridge and tunnel in Greece. As part of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, the United States helped fund construction programs to rebuild Greece after World War II. Original caption written on photo: Asopos Bridge and tunnel - destroyed by Germans - note vegetation.

title: Dwight Griswold on Balcony
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold is standing on the American Consul Balcony looking at the harbor in Salonika, Greece. Griswold was the Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece.

title: Painting of Margaret Truman by Greta Kempton
Scopenote: Portrait of Margaret Truman, a painting by Greta Kempton.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Queen Frederika and Erma Griswold in the Palace Gardens in Athens, Greece
Scopenote: Queen Frederika (right), wife of King Paul of Greece, and Erma Griswold (left), wife of Dwight Griswold, chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, sit on a bench in the palace gardens in Athens, Greece.

title: A Typical Rural Scene in Greece
Scopenote: Two unidentified men walk along a rural road in a photograph with the handwritten label, "A Typical Rural Scene in Greece."  From: Mrs. Henry I. Bomgardner.

title: Dwight Griswold with Greek Prime Minister Dimitrios Maximos in Athens, Greece
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold (left), Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, meets with Greek Prime Minister Demetrios Maximos (right) in an office in Athens, Greece. Original caption written on photo: Griswold & The Prime Minister, D. Maximos, Athens 1947.

title: Dwight Griswold in Greece
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold sits outside his hotel, the King George Hotel in Athens, Greece. and looks at Constitution Square. Griswold was the Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece (AMAG). The Acropolis is in the background.

title: Dwight Griswold with Greek Prime Ministers
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold, Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, meets with current and former Greek prime ministers in Athens, Greece. From left to right: Stylianos Gonatas, Dwight Griswold, Demetrios Maximos, and Panagiotis Kanellopoulos.

title: Construction Camp in Greece
Scopenote: As part of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, the United States helped fund construction programs to rebuild Greece after World War II. Here is a construction camp from the South Portal of the Brallo Tunnel.

title: Dwight Griswold at Kavella, Greece
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold (foreground, third from left) is shaking hands with a group of men in Kavella, Greece. Griswold was the Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece (AMAG). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Reading in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman reading outside while on vacation in Key West, Florida. One of the books sitting beside his chair is the "Lincoln Reader" by Carl Sandburg.

title: Queen Frederika and Erma Griswold in the Palace Gardens in Athens
Scopenote: Queen Frederika (right), wife of King Paul of Greece, and Erma Griswold (left), wife of Dwight Griswold, Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, stand under an arbor in the palace gardens in Athens, Greece.

title: Dwight Griswold Leaving Office
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold, Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, exists the Greek Prime Minister's Office in Athens, Greece.

title: Group of Men in Salonika
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold, Jr., Major Leno Melas, the Governor General of Macedonia, Dwight Griswold, Sr., and other unidentified men are gathered in Salonika, Greece.   From: Erma Griswold Bomgardner.

title: Bess Truman portrait
Scopenote: Portrait of First Lady Bess Truman.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.   Photograph may be used if credited to Hessler Studio of Washington, D. C.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet and Family Outside the White House
Scopenote: The Cabinet members meet with President Harry S. Truman and his family outside the White House to accompany him to Capitol Hill as he delivers the State of the Union address. From left to right, Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, Bess Wallace Truman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, Secretary of Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach.   From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: President Harry S. Truman Leaving for the Opening of Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his family and Cabinet are leaving for the Capitol building to attend President Truman's State of the Union address to Congress.  From left to right, are: Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of State James Byrnes, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach. There is a copy of President Truman's signature directly below his picture. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Delivering the State of the Union Address to the 80th Congress
Scopenote: A closeup of President Harry S. Truman delivering the State of the Union Address to the members of Congress. In the background is President Pro Tempore of the Senate Arthur H. Vandenberg (left) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin (right). From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: Delivering the State of the Union Address to the 80th Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) delivers the State of the Union Address to the members of the 80th Congress from the rostrum. Seated behind President Truman are Senator Arthur Vandenberg (left) and Speaker of the House Joseph Martin. All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: Delivering the State of the Union Address before the 80th Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivers his State of the Union Address to the members of the 80th Congress. All others are unidentified.   From: scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 3.

title: Margaret and Bess Truman at the Infantile Paralysis Fund Drive
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (right) contribute to the Infantile Paralysis Fund Drive by placing coins in a bottle labeled "Missouri". The man in the center is unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shaking Hands with Congressional Leadership
Scopenote: Sitting at his desk in the Oval Office, President Harry S. Truman (center) is shaking hands with President Pro Tempore of the Senate Arthur H. Vandenberg (left) and Speaker of the House Joseph W. Martin Jr. (right). From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: Secretary of State George C. Marshall Shakes Hands with Former Secretary of State James F. Byrnes
Scopenote: From left to right, newly sworn in Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Harry S. Truman, and outgoing Secretary of State James F. Byrnes have a good laugh. Visible in the background between General Marshall and President Truman is Secretary of War Robert Patterson. Visible in the background behind Mr. Byrnes is Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach.  From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: George C. Marshall is Sworn in as Secretary of State
Scopenote: George C. Marshall, in the foreground on the left, is sworn in as Secretary of State by Chief Justice Fred Vinson, in the foreground on the right. Standing behind them, from left to right, are: Senator Arthur Vandenburg, Admiral William Leahy, Major General Harry Vaughan, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, an unidentified photographer, outgoing Secretary of State James Byrnes, and Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shaking Hands with General George C. Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with General George C. Marshall (left) during the ceremony swearing him in as Secretary of State. Standing between them is the outgoing Secretary of State, James Byrnes. Visible in the background between Marshall and Byrnes is Secretary of War Robert Patterson. From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: General George C. Marshall Taking Oath as Secretary of State
Scopenote: George C. Marshall (left) is taking the oath for the position of Secretary of State, as President Harry S. Truman (center, background) looks on. Marshall is sworn in by Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson (right). Visible in the background behind President Truman are, from left to right: Senator Arthur Vandenburg (partially obscured by Marshall's shoulder), Rear Admiral James Foskett, Major General Harry Vaughan, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Attorney General Tom Clark.  From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: Bess Wallace Truman and Eleanor Roosevelt at Infantile Paralysis Fundraiser
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (left), an unidentified young woman (center), and former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (right) at a nation-wide radio broadcast from the White House to promote fundraising efforts for infantile paralysis. From the Scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, Volume 3.

title: Map of Jackson County, Missouri
Scopenote: This map depicts Jackson County, Missouri which includes Kansas City, Independence, Lee's Summit, and Grandview. Several historic places are underlined. The map includes some Civil War battles.   From: Jackson County Historical Society

title: Official Cabinet Photograph
Scopenote: This is an official photo of President Harry S. Truman and member of his Cabinet. Copies of each man's signature are printed below the image. From left to right, they are Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Official Cabinet Photograph
Scopenote: This is an official photo of President Harry S. Truman and member of his Cabinet. From left to right, they are Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Secretary of War Robert Patterson, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Matthew Connelly Accepts a Sack of Potatoes from Nina Herschner
Scopenote: Matthew Connelly (left), Appointment Secretary to President Harry S. Truman, accepts a sack of potatoes from Senator Francis J. Myers (right), as Nina Herschner (center) looks on. Ms. Herschner is the Pennsylvania Potato Blossom Queen and from Felton, Pennsylvania.

title: President Harry S. Truman Poses With Fish
Scopenote: Form left to right; Admiral William Leahy, President Harry S. Truman and Captain Willard A. Saunders weigh the fish they had just caught in Key west, Florida. President Truman was on a vacation excursion to Key West.

title: President Harry S. Truman Fishing Off of Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman fishing on the Dolphin while on vacation in Key West, Florida. The original caption is: "The President has what is adjudged the best catch of the tournament."

title: Cabinet Members Leave the White House After Ceremony Welcoming Mexican President
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet leave the White House following an official ceremony welcoming President Miguel Aleman of Mexico. From left to right: Secretary of State George Marshall, Secretary of the Navy James Forestall, and Secretary of War Robert Patterson. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: 35th Division Reunion Parade in Kansas City, Missouri
Scopenote: Members of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery, march in the 35th Division Reunion parade in Kansas City, Missouri. President Harry S. Truman (center) waves his hat to the crowd. On the left, carrying the guidon, is Frank Spina. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Princeton University
Scopenote: From left to right General Dwight Eisenhower, President Harry S. Truman, and former President Herbert Hoover stand together as they are honored at an event at Princeton University.

title: President Harry S. Truman Examines Car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party are standing around an old car while at the home of Stanley Woodward in Charlottesville, Virginia. From left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Major General Harry Vaughan, President Truman, General Wallace Graham, Press Secretary Charles Ross, and Clark Clifford.

title: Group of Men
Scopenote: Mr. Rankin (left), Dwight Griswold (left center), Henry Grady (right center), and James Van Fleet gather together for a group photograph in Greece. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Pushes a Car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party are pushing an old car into a shed while at the home of Stanley Woodward in Charlottesville, Virginia. from left to right: unidentified (probably Charles Ross), Admiral William Leahy, General Harry Vaughan, President Truman, unidentified, General Wallace Graham.

title: President Harry S. Truman Pushes a Car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his party are pushing an old car into a shed while at the home of Stanley Woodward in Charlottesville, Virginia. from left to right: President Truman, General Harry Vaughan, Admiral William Laby (mostly obscured), and General Wallace Graham.

title: Presidential Plane "Independence" at the Frankfurt Airport
Scopenote: The presidential plane "Independence" sits at the Frankfurt Airport on its way to Greece, surrounded by unidentified men. Original caption written on photo: "Airport and Presidential Plane Independence at Airport at Frankfurt. Ger. July 14-1947 on way to Greece with lot of Greek Mission members."  From: Mrs. Henry I. Bomgardner.

title: Political Cartoon, "How Many Lives"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Clifford Berryman that appeared in the Washington Evening Star. Clement Attlee and President Harry S. Truman are standing on the left, with Truman saying, "How many lives do you suppose that bird has?" The bird he refers to is labeled the "Dove of Peace" and is sitting in a tree. Soviet leader Joseph Stalin is shown on the right, shooting at the bird with a weapon labeled "11th Russian veto."

title: Brazilian Independence Day Parade
Scopenote: The Brazilian Independence Day Parade took place in Rio de Janeiro, during the visit of President Harry S. Truman to Brazil. This photograph was taken from the terrace of the seventh floor of the Standard Oil Building in Rio de Janeiro.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Brazilian Independence Day Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with President of Brazil Eurico Gaspar Dutra (center right) are standing as they review a Brazilian Independence Day parade. Standing on the left of President Truman is First Lady Bess W. Truman. Margaret Truman is fifth from the left. All others are unidentified.

title: Dr. Edwin G. Nourse Reports to the Cabinet
Scopenote: Dr. Edwin G. Nourse, head of the President's Special Economic Advisory Council, reports to the Cabinet that rationing and price controls are essential to the success of the food conservation program through which the United States is called upon to aid starving Europe. In the front row, from left to right, pictured are Acting Secretary of State Robert Lovett, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Attorney General Tom C. Clark. Standing from left to right are: Vice Chairman of the Economic Advisory Council Leon Keyserling, Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Assistant to the President John Steelman, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Chairman of the Economic Advisory Council Dr. Edwin Nourse, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, and Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Political Cartoon by Clifford Berryman, "Sour Note"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon entitled "Sour Note" by Clifford Berryman for the Washington Evening Star. On the left, Robert Taft is holding a piece of paper that says "Eat Less." In the center, President Harry S. Truman is holding a piece of paper that says "Waste Less." On the right, Thomas Dewey is depicted as singing and is holding a piece of paper that says, "Don't Endanger Our Health."

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives the Committee on Civil Rights Report
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is receiving a report from the Committee on Civil Rights from Charles Wilson. Standing, from left to right: Most Reverend Francis J. Haas, Roland B. Gittelsohn, Mrs. Sadie T. Alexander, James B. Carey, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Jr., Mrs. M.E. Tilley, Channing H. Tobias, Charles Wilson, Boris Shishkin, Charles Luckman, and Francis P. Matthews.

title: King Paul and Queen Frederika of Greece Speak with Senators
Scopenote: King Paul of Greece (center) speaks with four Senators while Queen Frederika of Greece (second from left, facing away from camera) speaks with another group of unidentified men. The Senators are identified, from left to right as Senator Brooks, Senator Richard Russell, Senator Milton Young, and Senator Theodore Green. All others are unidentified.

title: Senate Appropriations Committee in Greece
Scopenote: The Senate Appropriations Committee was in Athens, Greece, and Mr. James H. Keeley reported on the works that the American Embassy had been doing in Athens. Back row, left to right: Senator Leverett Saltonstall, Senator William Knowland, Senator Richard Russell, Senator Guy Cordon, and Senator Henry Dworkshak. Seated, from left to right: Senator Charles Brooks, Mr. Keeley, Senator Styles Bridges, Senator Theodore Green, and Senator Milton Young.

title: Senate Appropriations Committee in Athens, Greece
Scopenote: The Senate Appropriations Committee met with members of the American Mission for Aid to Greece to gather further information conditions and the future needs of American aid to Greece. Standing, left to right: General Richards, Senator Leverett Saltonstall, Admiral Snackenberger, John Peurifoy, the assist secretary of state, General Livesay, Senator William Knowland, and Senator Henry Dworshak. Seated, left to right: Senator Milton Young, Senator Styles Bridges, and Governor Dwight Griswold.

title: Political Cartoon, "Quiet Please"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Clifford Berryman, published in the Washington Evening Star. President Harry S. Truman is asking Congressman Harold Knutson to stop banging the drum on Tax Reduction as Truman has a large piece of paper on his desk labeled "Special Session and Foreign Aid."

title: President Harry S. Truman Leaves for the Capitol for the Joint Session of Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, far left, leaves for the Capitol to address a Joint Session of Congress.  In the front, from left to right, are Secretary of State George C. Marshall, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder.  Behind, from left to right, are Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, and Press Secretary Charles Ross. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Toy Target Gun
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives a toy target gun from Major General A. C. McAuliffe (right) on behalf the Field Artillery Association. The presentation occurred in President Truman's Oval Office.

title: President Harry S. Truman Given Flower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives a "forget-me-not" flower from Ginger Leonard as the Disabled Veterans of America prepared their annual fund drive.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Pan-American Society Award
Scopenote: In a brief ceremony at the White House President Harry S. Truman (right) receives the a medal from the Pan American Society of the United States by Thomas W. Parker (left), President of the Pan American Society of the United States.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits the Freedom Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with Tom Clark (left) and Fred Vinson (center) view the Gettysburg Address manuscript on the Freedom Train while it was stopped at Union Station in Washington, D. C. The Freedom Train was a seven-car rolling exhibit containing documents of American liberty next to documents of tyranny and despotism. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Charles Corte In Hospital
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) visits Charles Corte (right), an Acme Newspictures photographer, at Georgetown Hospital after unveiling a plaque in honor of former President Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: President Harry S. Truman Rides in Motorcade to Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat to the crowd as he rides in a car from Boca Chica Airport to the Little White House at the Naval Submarine Base at Key West, Florida. Seated in the back seat of the car, from left to right: President Truman, Captain Cecil Adell, and Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets His Pilot
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) greets his pilot, Lieutenant Colonel Henry Myers (left) as he prepared to board his plane for a short vacation to Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman Displaying his Submarine Tie Clasp
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shows off the tie chain given to him as he was made an honorary submarine skipper. The chain has two dolphins on is making an "S."

title: President Harry S. Truman with a Movie Camera
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman pauses during a stroll around the Key West Submarine base to take motion pictures with the camera presented to him as President of the "One More Club," by the White House News Photographers Association. He was in Key West, Florida for a vacation.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Scroll
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center in white suit) receiving a scroll and other items from the officers and crew of the submarine U-2513, proclaiming him a qualified submariner. President Truman and other members of his party visited the submarine while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Standing behind President Truman on the left is Admiral William Leahy. Also in the photo is Presidential Press Secretary Charles Ross (last row, in dark suit, next to naval officer) and John Steelman (next to Mr. Ross). All others in the photo are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Bag
Scopenote: While speaking at the dedication of the Everglades National Park, President Harry S. Truman (right) received a bag for Mrs. Truman from the Seminole Indian, Ingran Billie (center). Truman received other gifts from the Seminoles present. All others are unidentified. Truman spoke at the dedication while he was on vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman Returns From Vacation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman Returns to Washington, D. C. after a vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: Dwight and Erma Griswold in Constantinople, Turkey
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold, Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, stands with his wife Erma Griswold in a photograph labeled "Constantinople, Turkey, Dec. 10-1947." From: Mrs. Henry I. Bomgardner.

title: President Harry S. Truman Congratulates Admiral Chester W. Nimitz
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman congratulates Admiral Chester W. Nimitz  after a ceremony in the White house awarding Nimitz a Gold Star in lieu of earning a fourth Distinguished Service Medal. From Left to Right; President Harry S. Truman, Catherine F. Nimitz, Chester W. Nimitz, Dwight D. Eisenhower, and John L. Sullivan. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Christmas Turkey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives a 47-pound turkey for Christmas from the National Turkey Federation. Foreground, from left to right: President Truman, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Trever L. Jones, Director of the National Turkey Federation, and Albert E. Matlack, President of the National Turkey Federation. All others are unidentified.

title: Lewis Rodert Receives Collier Trophy from President Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presents the Collier Trophy to Lewis A. Rodert, chief of the flight research section of the Cleveland Laboratory on National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics. He earned the trophy for his work in developing de-icing technology for airplanes.

title: Maurice Latta and Matthew J. Connelly Review Bill
Scopenote: Maurice Latta (left) points at President Harry Truman's signature as Matthew Connelly (right) holds the bill that authorized emergency relief to France, Italy, and Austria.

title: President Harry S. Truman Invited to Rose Bowl
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is shown with Representative Carl Hinshaw (right) as he called at the White House to invite the President to the annual Rose bowl Game in Pasadena, California.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets Around the World Fliers
Scopenote: Clifford V. Evans (left) of Washington and George W. Truman (right) who encircled the globe in their Piper PA-12 Super Cruiser planes, show President Harry S. Truman (middle) some of the "short-snorter" bills which they collected on their trip.

title: Photograph Inscribed to Robert Freer
Scopenote: A portrait of an unidentified man that is inscribed to Robert Freer. The inscription reads: "To Robert E. Freer, an able lawyer, a fine public official and a loyal friend. With the best wishes of Homer [illegible] December 19, 1947."

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Secretary of State George Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets Secretary of State George Marshall with other members of his Cabinet upon his return form the London Foreign Ministers Conference. From left to right; Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug, Attorney General Tom Clark (background, mostly obscured) and Secretary Marshall.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets Secretary of State George Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) greets Secretary of State George Marshall (right) after Marshall's return from the Big Four Ministers Conference in London, England.

title: Margaret Truman Speaks With Reporters
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) speaks with a group of women reporters before her first concert before her father, President Harry S. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman Attends Christmas Party
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (seated, left) attends a Christmas Bag Party at the Central Union Mission where she presents gifts to five-year-olds Carl Eager, Jr. (foreground, center) and Jean Copeland (foreground, right). Others in the background are unidentified.

title: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman Attends Christmas Party
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (seated, left) attends a Christmas Bag Party at the Central Union Mission where she presents gifts to five-year-olds Carl Eager, Jr. (foreground, center) and Jean Copeland (foreground, right).

title: Margaret Truman Congratulated
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) receives congratulations from Secretary of Treasury John W. Snyder (left) and Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder after Margaret's concert in Washington's Constitutional Hall.

title: President Harry S. Truman With a Poinsettia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman points to the poinsettia plant which the Society of American Florists gave to him as a Christmas gift. From left to right are: Robert H. Roland, Granville Gude, and President Truman.

title: Copy of Painting By Greta Kempton
Scopenote: This is a photograph of President Harry S. Truman's official portrait as painted by Greta Kempton. There is a photographic copy of Mr. Truman's signature across the lower right corner of the painting.

title: President Truman Campaigning in Texas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in center with patterned tie) mingles with a crowd while campaigning in Texas. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST. All others are unidentified.

title: Crowd Gathers Outside the White House
Scopenote: A crowd gathers on Pennsylvania Avenue outside the White House, as a limousine prepares to drive through the gate. From: Dr. George M. Gloss.

title: A Donkey in Greece
Scopenote: A donkey is carrying a load strapped to its back as it drinks water from a trough in front of a sign which reads "A.D.P. Store House" on a rural path in Greece. Original caption: The Greek tractor.

title: A Crowd Gathers Outside the White House at the 1949 Inauguration of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: A crowd gathers on Pennsylvania Avenue outside the White House, as a limousine prepares to drive through the gate. Two more police officers in the foreground work to clear the way for a police officer on a motorcycle. All are unidentified. From: Dr. George M. Gloss.

title: Inauguration Medal
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the Inauguration Medal with an image of President Harry S. Truman on the left and an eagle on the right made by sculptor Julio Kilenyi.

title: Inauguration Medal
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the Inauguration Medal with an eagle on the face and President Harry S. Truman's name made by sculptor Julio Kilenyi.

title: Men Working on Roads
Scopenote: In Serres, Greece, men are beginning new road programs. Men are working on creating the shoulder and the foundation for the roads. This project was funded by the American Mission to Aid Greece. All men are unidentified.

title: Building the Kavalla Airport
Scopenote: In Greece, men are building the Kavalla airport. The airport is being built with United States war surplus materials and funded by the American Mission for Aid to Greece. All the men are unidentified.

title: Portrait of Mrs. Evlyn Cook Snyder
Scopenote: Greta Kempton portrait of Mrs. Evlyn Cook Snyder, wife of Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Key West, Florida, Little White House
Scopenote: Key West, Florida headquarters of the President, the Little White House.  This is an exterior view of the house, with a guard and a car in the foreground.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: The Little White House
Scopenote: The Little White House in Key West, Florida at the Naval Submarine Base, which served as a vacation home of President Harry S. Truman.   From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Dwight Griswold at the Dedication of Griswold Quay, Salonica, Greece
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold (at center, in pale suit), Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, observes the dedication of Griswold Quay in Salonica, Greece, with Mrs. Erma Griswold (second from the left of Griswold, in pale dress) and other unidentified individuals. The photograph is labelled "Dedication of Griswold quay - Salonica 1948."

title: Photograph of California Campaign Advertisements
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the campaign headquarters of Representative Clyde Doyle, with storefront signs reading "Vote Democratic" and "Truman and Barkley; Clyde Doyle for Congress."  One of cars parked in front of the building also has bumper stickers for Mr. Doyle.  Donor: Honorable Clyde Doyle.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman Campaign
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, left, and First Lady Bess W. Truman, second from left, campaign from the back of a railroad car in an undetermined location. Others with them are unidentified.
Institutional Creator: Keystone Pictures, Inc., New York, NY

title: President Harry S. Truman and Unidentified Woman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unidentified woman.

title: Corinth Canal
Scopenote: This is a picture of the Corinth Canal as work of the reopening starting. As work begins, a dredge and dragline are on the water. This project was funded by the American Mission for Aid to Greece.

title: Little White House
Scopenote: This is a view of the exterior of the Little White House on the Naval Submarine Base in Key West, Florida. President Harry S. Truman spent several vacations on the base. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Lounge on USS Williamsburg
Scopenote: The President's Lounge on board the USS Williamsburg, the ship used as President Harry S. Truman's yacht.

title: Political Cartoon, "Gosh It's Me Again!"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Bruce Russell.  The cartoon depicts Uncle Sam looking at his reflection in the table after using "Truman's Cabinet Shuffle Polish."  An inscription at the bottom of the cartoon reads, "To President Harry S. Truman with my very best wishes-Bruce Russell."

title: Drawing, "I'm So Wild About Harry"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a drawing by cartoonist Benjamin Levinson. It depicts a replica of President Harry S. Truman's campaign button featuring a braying donkey with the words "I'm So Wild About Harry" on the side. The text below the donkey says: "To Harry S. Truman, President of the United States. This picture is a symbol of the high regard in which you are held by your party and conveys as well the sentiment of millions of fellow Democrats who are eager to manifest their regard by their ballots on Election Day. Benjamin Levinson."

title: A Crowd Outside the White House
Scopenote: A crowd gathers on Pennsylvania Avenue outside the White House. All are unidentified. From: Dr. George M. Gloss.

title: A Crowd Gathers Outside the White House
Scopenote: A crowd gathers on Pennsylvania Avenue outside the White House, as a limousine prepares to drive through the gate. From: Dr. George M. Gloss.

title: Dwight Griswold in the American Mission for Aid to Greece Office in Athens, Greece
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold, Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece (AMAG), writes at a desk in the AMAG office in Athens, Greece. Original caption: In AMAG office - Athens.  From: Mrs. Henry I. Bomgardner.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Chicago
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) meets with Chicago Mayor Martin Kennelly (right) and another man on the rear platform of the presidential train when it was in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Inauguration Medal
Scopenote: This is a photo of the Inauguration medal with an image of President Harry S. Truman on the face made by sculptor Julio Kilenyi.

title: Corinth Canal
Scopenote: This is a view of the East side of the Corinth canal in Greece. The photograph captured the reopening of the working canal in Greece. Repairing the canal was funded by the American Mission for Aid to Greece.

title: 1948 Cartoon by Paul Loring "You Were So Right, Harry!"
Scopenote: Political cartoon by artist Paul Loring, entitled "You were so right, Harry!"  Shows President Harry S. Truman and a donkey in a rowboat, in a sea labeled "Victory".

title: Mr. and Mrs. Dewey on a ferry boat in San Francisco bay
Scopenote: Governor and Mrs. Thomas E. Dewey on a ferry boat, San Francisco bay.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: The Little White House
Scopenote: The Little White House in Key West, Florida at the Naval Submarine Base, which served as a vacation home of President Harry S. Truman.   From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Waves from the Campaign Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) waves from the back of the campaign train as he shakes hands with Democratic Vice-Presidential nominee Alben Barkley. Margaret Truman (right) watches from the back of the train. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: People Congregating Around a Campaign Train
Scopenote: A crowd of people are standing around the back of President Harry S. Truman's campaign train during a stop in an unknown city. From the scrapbook of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Political Cartoon, "Whose Move?"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a New York Star political cartoon by Walt Kelly. President Harry S. Truman is pictured sitting at a table with a chess game laid out, with the table labeled "Berlin Chess Game." Sitting on top of the table, directly in front of Truman is Joseph Stalin, smoking a pipe. The text next to Stalin reads, "Whose Move?"

title: A Crowd Gathers Outside the White House
Scopenote: A crowd gathers outside the White House. Several cars that are part of a motorcade can be seen in the background. All are unidentified. From: Dr. George M. Gloss.

title: A Crowd Gathers Outside the White House
Scopenote: A crowd gathers on Pennsylvania Avenue outside the White House, as a limousine prepares to drive through the gate. From: Dr. George M. Gloss.

title: Photograph of President Truman by Curtis
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an oil painting of President Harry S. Truman by Curtis of Oklahoma City, Oklahoma.

title: Campaign Floats in a California Parade
Scopenote: A three dimensional campaign ad, in the form of a house, reading "Keep it Intact and Elect Harry S. Truman" sits on the back of a flatbed truck as a float in a California parade. The house also has pictures of President Harry S. Truman and Vice Presidential candidate Alben Barkley on it. All people in the photo are unidentified. Donor: Honorable Clyde Doyle

title: President Harry S. Truman Stands on Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands on the rear platform of a train. The exact date and location are unknown.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Two Girls
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (facing camera, second from left) greets two little girls, while Edward McKim (facing camera, left) stands beside him. The original photo is inscribed: "To the Misses McKim with best wishes for a long and happy life. Harry S. Truman."

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Wave from the Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Margaret Truman (right) wave from the back of the campaign train. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Man Placing Black Wreath
Scopenote: An unidentified man places a black wreath on the pillar in front of the Republican National Committee Headquarters. This photo was likely taken after the 1948 election. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Crowds Watch a Motorcade Pass
Scopenote: A crowd gathers along Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D. C. to watch a motorcade move down the street. A welcome banner can be seen in the distance. From: Dr. George M. Gloss.

title: Corinth Canal, Almost Re-Opened
Scopenote: Ships and construction equipment sit in the middle of the Corinth Canal. Original caption: Corinth Canal, almost re-opened.

title: Matt Connelly
Scopenote: This is a photographic portrait of President Harry S. Truman's Appointment Secretary, Matthew Connelly.

title: American Mission for Aid to Greece Staff
Scopenote: American Mission for Aid to Greece staff pose for a photograph. Standing, from left to right, are Ayer, Coombs, Gillmor, Barker, Gallagher, Dawson, Holmgreen, McGuire, Norton, Shea, Griffiths, Golden, Dobson, Moffat, McKay, Clay, Iverson, and Lawsdale. Seated in the front row, from left to right, are May, Patterson, General William Livesay, Dwight Griswold (Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece), Howard, Snackenberg, and Hedley.   From: Mrs. Henry I. Bomgardner.

title: President Harry S. Truman Gives State of the Union Address
Scopenote: This is a composite photo of President Harry S. Truman as he delivers his State of Union address.

title: President Harry S. Truman Leaving the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is leaving the White House with First Lady Bess W. Truman (left), and daughter Margaret Truman (right). They are traveling to the Capitol Building so that President Truman can deliver his State of the Union address.

title: Margaret Truman Poses Beside Portrait
Scopenote: Margaret Truman poses beside her portrait as artist Greta Kempton (right) puts the finishing touches on the painting.

title: Official Cabinet Photograph
Scopenote: This is an official photo of President Harry S. Truman and his Cabinet. Seated around the table from left to right, are: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman, Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming, Assistant to the President John Steelman, Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach, Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Attorney General Tom C. Clark. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Secretary Clinton P. Anderson with Senator Charles Tobey
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson (right) told Senator Charles W. Tobey (left) on the Senate Banking Committee, during testimony before that committee, that "We may have to use limited price control on commodities affecting the cost of living" if inflation is to be curbed.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Air Policy Commission
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) with the members of the Air Policy Commission discussing the public report on the National Aviation Policy. Standing, from left to right: Palmer Hoyt, George Baker, John McCone, S. Paul Johnston, Thomas K. Finletter, and Arthur Whiteside.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Air Policy Commission
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman discuses national aviation policy in his office with members of the Air Policy Commission.  From Left to Right; Palmer Hoyt, George P. Baker, John A. McCone, President Truman, S. Paul Johnston, Thomas K. Finletter, and Arthur D. Whitesides.

title: Margaret Truman Helps Make First Contribution to March of Dimes
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) holds three-year-old Terry Tullos of Laurel, Mississippi, as he makes the first contribution to the March of Dimes Infantile Paralysis Fund Campaign.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receiving "Crazy Dog" Necklace
Scopenote: Native American Thunderbolt Lefthand (right) presents a "Crazy Dog" necklace to President Harry S. Truman (left). Joining them is Senator Milton R. Young of North Dakota (center).

title: Margaret Truman Makes Fundraising Appeal in White House Broadcast
Scopenote: Margaret Truman appealed for contributions to the March of Dimes campaign during a White House broadcast arranged by the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis.  Front row left to right; Lady Inverchapel, Margaret Truman, Roberta (Mrs. Fred) Vinson. Back row, left to right: Lady Balfour, Mrs. John Baker, and Mrs. Ralph Edwards.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands With Contest Winners
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets the four national winners of the Voice of Democracy contest during their visit to Washington, D. C. The competition was sponsored by the National Association of Broadcasters, the Junior Chamber of Commerce, and the Radio Manufacturers Association. From left to right: Janet Geister, Rose Ellen Mudd, President Truman, Alice Wade Tyree, and Laura Shatte.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs Smith-Mundt Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs the Smith-Mundt Bill, also known as the "Voice of America Bill,' which authorizes foreign informational activities, including radio broadcasts to Soviet Russia and other countries. Standing, from left to right; Senator H. Alexander Smith; Dr. Walter Lemon, President of the World Wide Broadcasting Foundation; Howland H. Sargent; Representative Karl E. Mundt; and Under Secretary of State Robert Lovett.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Honorary Scroll
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives an honorary scroll of membership from the Royal Netherlands Choral Society as a tribute to the American soldiers who occupied Maastricht, the first Netherlands town to be liberated from the Germans. Presenting the scroll are Colonel Edward W. Gould (middle) and the Ambassador from Holland Eelco Nicolaas van Kleffens (right).

title: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess W. Truman Attend Congressional Club Reception
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and first Lady Bess W. Truman attend a reception held in their honor by the Congressional Club. From left to right stand Margaret Truman, Bess Truman, President Truman, Mrs. Clifford Davis (President of the Congressional Club), and Representative Clifford Davis.

title: Colonel Robert B. Landry Named Air Force Aide
Scopenote: Colonel Robert B. Landry (middle) sits with General Harry Vaughan (left) and Captain Robert Dennison (right) after being named Air Force Aide.

title: General Omar N. Bradley Takes Over As Army Chief of Staff
Scopenote: General Omar N. Bradley talks to his wife, Mary Elizabeth Bradley, after assuming his new duties as Army Chief of Staff.

title: General Dwight D. Eisenhower Administers Oath to Omar  N. Bradley
Scopenote: From left to right: General Dwight Eisenhower, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Army Kenneth Royall, and General Omar Bradley. General Eisenhower is swearing in General Bradley as the new Army Chief of Staff.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents a Medal to Dwight D. Eisenhower
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) presents General Dwight D. Eisenhower (right) with the third leaf cluster to the Distinguished Service Medal during a ceremony at the Pentagon.

title: Honoring Lady Reading
Scopenote: Dignitaries meet with the Dowager Marchioness of Reading after she received the National Achievement Award at ceremonies in New York City.  From left to right; Lady Iverchapel, Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt, Lady Reading, and Lord Archibald Clark Kerr, Baron Iverchapel.

title: Crowd Applauds Entrance of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: James A. Farley (foreground), Ex-Postmaster General and former Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, applauds the entrance of President Harry S. Truman (left, background) to the Jefferson-Jackson Dinner in the Mayflower Hotel. Matthew Connelly greets President Truman in the center background. All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attended a $100 a plate fundraiser dinner at the Mayflower Hotel in honor of Jefferson-Jackson Day. Truman (left) is talking with Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath (center) and his daughter Margaret Truman (right). Unknown people are seated in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses Jackson Day Celebration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman makes his formal address at the annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Attend Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attended a $100 a plate fundraiser dinner at the Mayflower Hotel in honor of Jefferson-Jackson Day. Truman (left) is talking with Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath (center) and his daughter Margaret Truman (right). Unknown people are seated in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) attends the Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner at the Statler Hotel before he goes to the Mayflower Hotel where he will make his address. On the left sits Margaret Truman and on the right Wilson Wyatt, National Chairman of the Jefferson-Jackson Day Committee. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Delivers Jefferson-Jackson Day Address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivers his Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner address at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D. C. Others sitting in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attended a $100 a plate fundraiser dinner at the Mayflower Hotel in honor of Jefferson-Jackson Day. Truman (left) is talking with Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath (center) and his daughter Margaret Truman (right). Unknown people are seated in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Representatives of West New York, New Jersey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman accepts a gold card making him an honorary member of the Golden Jubilee Anniversary Committee of West New York, New Jersey. From left to right; Executive Secretary of the Golden Jubilee Committee Harry J. Swensen; Mayor Wilbur J. McGowan; General Executive of the Committee and former mayor of West New York, Joseph Stilz; President Truman; Representative Edward J. Hart; and public relations department head George Rosenberg.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets with Officials of Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with the Governor of Puerto Rico and others on the terrace of the Jagueyes Hotel in Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico. From left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Governor Jesus T. Pinero, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug and President of the Puerto Rican Senate Luis Munoz Marin. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives in Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) rides in the back of a car through a crowd of people during his visit to San Juan, Puerto Rico. With him is the Governor of Puerto Rico, Jesus T. Pinero. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with the Governor of Puerto Rico and others on the terrace of the Jagueyes Hotel in Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico. From left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Governor Jesus T. Pinero, President Truman, and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug.

title: President Harry S. Truman Talks with Press in Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) talks with reporters in Key West, Florida before he leaves for Puerto Rico as part of his vacation trip.

title: President Harry S. Truman Applauded in San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated on back of car) is applauded by San Juan residents as he rides through Puerto Rico's capital. The Puerto Rican Capitol Building is in the background. All others are unidentified.

title: Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: The harbor at Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, on the occasion of President Harry S. Truman's vacation visit to the island.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks in Virgin Islands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses a crowd during his visit to Charlotte Amalie, Virgin Islands. The sign above the President's head reads "Welcome President Truman Champion of Human Rights."

title: President Harry S. Truman and Governor William Hastie in an Automobile
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, driver's side) and Governor William Hastie (back seat, passenger side) are seated in their automobile at "Drake's Seat," a promontory overlooking Magens Bay, on the island of St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area. The driver of the car is unidentified.   From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Governor William Hastie Greets President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is greeted by Governor William Hastie (second from left) as he leaves his yacht, the USS Williamsburg, for a tour of the island of St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. Standing in the background are, from left to right: William Hassett (wearing bow tie), Captain Robert Dennison, General Wallace Graham (mostly obscured by Krug), Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Chair of the Municipal Council of St. Thomas Mr. Roy Gordon, and Colonel Robert Landry (mostly obscured by Gordon). All others are unidentified. Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Governor's Mansion, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: While on a trip to Puerto Rico, President Harry S. Truman (center) talks with Governor Jesus T. Pinero (left) and the Secretary of Interior, Julius Krug (right) at the Governor's Mansion during an official reception.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks With Governor William Hastie
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Governor William Hastie (right) of the Virgin Islands at "Drake's Seat," a promontory overlooking Magens Bay, on the island of St. Thomas. Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: President Harry S. Truman Riding in a Convertible
Scopenote: While visiting St. Croix in the Virgin Islands, President Harry S. Truman rode in the back of a convertible as he was welcomed by crowds of people. This picture was taken as he was on a tour inspection of Frederiksted. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits St. Croix Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in civilian clothes) steps ashore from a PT boat during his vacation visit to St. Croix in the Virgin Islands.  The PT boat brought him ashore from his yacht, the USS Williamsburg. Also present is Admiral William Leahy (foreground, turned sideways). Other sailors and naval officers are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: The large crowd gathered at the harbor at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands awaiting the arrival of President Harry S. Truman. Truman visited St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Presidential Yacht Williamsburg Anchored Offshore at the Virgin Islands
Scopenote: The Williamsburg, President Harry S. Truman's yacht, is anchored offshore at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands. President Truman is visiting the Virgin Islands.  From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Gift While in Cuba
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, seated on the back of the open car, receives a scrapbook from twelve year old William Barrett, son of Chief Pharmacist's Mate P.W. Barrett of the United States Navy, while Admiral William Leahy (front seat) looks on. Young Barrett presented the scrapbook to the President on behalf of his schoolmates during the President's visit to Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greeted by School Children
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) rides in his automobile past a group of school children during his visit to the U.S. Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. He visited Guantanamo Bay while on a vacation cruise. All others are unidentified

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives at Guantanamo Bay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, third from left, in civilian clothes) is greeted by Captain E. C. Battle (foreground, second from left) upon his arrival at the U.S. Naval Base, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. Truman visited Guantanamo Bay during a vacation cruise. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands With African American Reporters
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with African American reporters who traveled with him on his trip  through the Caribbean after their arrival at Boca Chica Airport in Key West, Florida. From left to right; Llewellyn A. Coles, P. Bernard Young, Jr., Lemuel Graves, and President Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Boards
Scopenote: At Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with William Simmons (lower right) before flying to Key West, Florida. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Scrapbook
Scopenote: William Barrett (left), age 12, son of United States Navy Chief Petty Officer P. W. Barrett, present a scrapbook to President Harry S. Truman (right) during his visit to Guantanamo Bay Naval Base in Cuba. President Truman visited Cuba as part of his vacation trip to Key West, Florida, and other locations. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Children Gather to Greet President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: School children are gathered together at the United States Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, during President Truman's visit to the base. President Truman visited the base during his vacation cruise.

title: President Harry S. Truman Debarking a Plane
Scopenote: On his return home from a Caribbean tour, President Harry S. Truman is de-boarding the "Sacred Cow" in Key West, Florida where he will vacation for a time.  President Truman (front) is followed by Admiral William Leahy. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Poses With Children in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with three young admirers while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Left to right: Curtis Hingson, son of Lieutenant Commander and Mrs. J. M Hingson: Sandra Jean Smith and Ray Smith, Jr., children of Lieutenant Commander and Mrs. Ray Smith.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the National Airport in Washington with Pilots
Scopenote: Before boarding his plane at the National Airport in Washington, D. C., President Harry S. Truman has a hearty handshake for Colonel Henry Myers (left), his former pilot, and Lieutenant Colonel Francis W. Williams (right) who was at the controls of the Sacred Cow for the first time with the President aboard when the Chief Executive took off for a two-week Caribbean and Florida vacation. Colonel Myers, who went along as far as Key West, has been "breaking in" his successor. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman on a Submarine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves as he steps down into the submarine "Requin" on his vacation in Key West, Florida. While on board he was given a demonstration of a submarine-mounted picket radar used for coastal and fleet defense. The sailor in the background is unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets with Children
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds nine month old Curtis Hingson's hand while Sandra Jean Smith and Ray Smith, Jr. stand in front of him. This photograph was taken as Truman was leaving the naval base in Key West, Florida. He was there for a radar demonstration on the submarine "Requin."

title: Captain Robert Dennison Displays His Trophy Fish
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's staff pose with the fish they caught while on vacation with the President in Key West, Florida. Captain Robert Dennison (center) holds up the 29 pound mackerel he caught. From left to right, General Wallace Graham, Correspondence Secretary William Hassett, Admiral William Leahy (wearing hat and glasses), Eben Ayers (partly obscured), Captain Dennison, unidentified reporter, Colonel Robert Landry (mostly obscured), and Special Counsel Clark Clifford. All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Press Conference at Key West, 1948
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing center in white suit) holds a press conference in the North Garden at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Standing behind President Truman are some of his advisors (from left to right): two unidentified men; John R. Steelman, Rear Admiral Robert Dennison; William Hassett; Eben Ayers; General Robert Landry (partly obscured); Clark Clifford (mostly obscured); Admiral William Leahy; unidentified man (in background); Major General Harry Vaughan (wearing t-shirt). Members of the press corps are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: White House Staff Members at the Little White House
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's staff join him on his vacation trip to Key West, Florida. Here they gather on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West. From left to right: Clark Clifford, William Hassett, John Steelman and Matthew Connelly.

title: Press Conference at Key West, 1948
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds a press conference on the lawn of the "Little White House," his vacation quarters at Key West, Florida. Standing behind President Truman are various members of his staff, including William Hassett (third from left), Colonel Robert Landry (fourth from left), Eben Ayers (sixth from left, behind Truman), Clark Clifford (behind Truman, partly obscured), Admiral William Leahy (eighth from left), and Major General Harry Vaughan (ninth from left, wearing t-shirt). All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds Press Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at the table) holds a press conference while on vacation in Key West, Florida on the Naval Submarine Base to discuss how the Presidential election is having a negative effect on the settlement of foreign and domestic affairs. Standing behind President Truman is, from left to right: unidentified, unidentified, General Wallace Graham, John Steelman, Admiral Robert Dennison, William Hassett, Eben Ayers, General Robert Landry, and Clark Clifford. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Laughing
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is laughing after returning from fishing trip while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Laughing
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is laughing after returning from fishing trip while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hand with Marine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with one of the Marines who guarded the Little White House in Key West, Florida during Mr. Truman's vacation. President Truman reviewed the soldiers before he returned to Washington, D. C. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Returns Home
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is greeted at the airport in Washington, D. C. by his daughter Margaret (left) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (right). He returning from a vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman Departing Boca Chica
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves as he boards his plane to depart Boca Chica, Florida for Washington, D. C. He traveled to Florida for a vacation at the "Little White House" in Key West. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly.

title: Democratic National Chairman J. Howard McGrath Makes Announcement
Scopenote: Democratic National Chairman J. Howard McGrath (center) announces to White House reporters that President Harry S. Truman authorized Mr. McGrath to say that he will definitely be a candidate for re-election on the Democratic ticket. Standing with Mr. McGrath on the right is the Executive Director of the Democratic Committee, Gael Sullivan. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives a Medal
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is shown receiving a gold medal from John W. Laird (right),  President of the Friendly Sons of St. Patrick in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The ceremony took place at the White House and the medal itself is a replica of one worn by George Washington who was a member of the society.

title: Dwight Griswold Talking to Man
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold (left), Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, is sitting in a chair talking to an unidentified man. The original photograph is autographed (illegible).  From: Erma Griswold Bomgardner.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greeting Arthur Vandenberg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Senator Arthur Vandenburg (right) before he addressed the members of Congress on the growing threat of Communism in Europe. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman Addresses the 80th Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses Congress regarding the growing Communist power in Europe and what the United States should do to stop it. Senator Arthur Vandenberg is seated behind the microphones at left, Speaker of the House Joseph Martin is seated at right. All others are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman Addresses the 80th Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses Congress regarding the growing Communist power in Europe and what the United States should do to stop it. Senator Arthur Vandenberg is seated behind the microphones at left, Speaker of the House Joseph Martin is seated at right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses the 80th Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses Congress regarding the growing Communist power in Europe and what the United States should do to stop it. Senator Arthur Vandenberg is seated behind the microphones at left, Speaker of the House Joseph Martin is seated at right.

title: President Harry S. Truman Delivers Congressional Speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses Congress regarding the growing Communist power in Europe and what the United States should do to stop it. Senator Arthur Vandenberg is seated behind the microphones at left, Speaker of the House Joseph Martin is seated at right.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses 80th Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses Congress regarding the growing Communist power in Europe and what the United States should do to stop it. Senator Arthur Vandenberg is seated behind the microphones at left, Speaker of the House Joseph Martin is seated at right.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with Nicholas Kostrukoff
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with Nicholas Kostrukoff (left), conductor of the Don Cossack chorus. President Truman and his family attended a performance of the chorus in Washington, D. C.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Stamps
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, left) receives a sheet of stamps honoring General Omar Bradley (seated, right) being appointed Army Chief of Staff.
