Standing from left to right are: General Harry Vaughan, Colonel Robert Landry, Captain Robert Dennison, and Commander Harold Gutekunst. These stamps will raise money for a trophy room honoring General Bradley in the public library in Moberly, Missouri, General Bradley's hometown.

title: President Harry S. Truman Boards Yacht
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) boards the presidential yacht for a trip to Williamsburg, Virginia where he will receive an Honorary Degree from William and Mary College. Also traveling with him are his daughter Margaret (center) and First Lady Bess W. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Vetoes Legislation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) signs a message attached to a presidential veto of a tax bill on the Presidential yacht USS Williamsburg while en route to Williamsburg, Virginia. From left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, William J. Hopkins, and Truman.

title: Canadian-American Day Celebrations
Scopenote: From left to right, Virginia Governor William Tuck, Viscount Alexander, Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King, and President Harry S. Truman are standing together talking during Canadian-American Day in the Great Hall of the Wren Building at the College of William and Mary in Williamsburg, Virginia. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Honorary Degree
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives honorary degree from the College of William and Mary in Williamsburg, Virginia. The man standing at the podium behind the microphones is unidentified. President Truman is in the second row of men behind the microphone, second from the left. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Governor William M. Tuck
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with Virginia Governor William Tuck (left) in the Great Hall of the Wren Building at the College of William and Mary, where they both received honorary degrees.

title: President Harry S. Truman Leaves Historical Building in Williamsburg, Virginia
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaves a historical building in Williamsburg, Virginia, an early English colony restored to its 18th century appearance during the Canadian-American Day Convocation ceremonies at the College of William and Mary. Several unidentified women in period costumes are standing with him. Others are unidentified.

title: Governor William Tuck Speaks at College of William and Mary Ceremony
Scopenote: Virginia Governor William Tuck speaks at a ceremony outside the Wren Building at the College of William and Mary in Williamsburg, Virginia. Seated behind Governor Tuck is President Harry S. Truman (third from left), who received an honorary degree at the ceremony. Seated next to Truman (fourth from left) is W&M president John Edwin Pomfret. Seated on the far right is Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Signs Foreign Aid Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signs the Foreign Assistance Act which would send $6,098,000,000 around the world to combat Communism. This bill created the European Recovery Program to implement the Marshall Plan. Standing behind President Truman from left to right are: Senator Arthur Vanderburg, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Representative Charles Eaton, Senator Tom Connally, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, (mostly obscured), Speaker of the House Joseph Martin, Representative Sol Bloom, and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson (behind Bloom, mostly obscured).

title: Prince Charles Visits White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) greets Prince Charles, the Regent of Belgium (center) as the Prince arrives at the White House.  On the left is Stanley Woodward, chief of Protocol of the State Department. The photographer in the background is unidentified.

title: Dwight Griswold with Queen of Greece
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold and Erma Griswold are with Queen Frederika of Greece. Behind them are a group of child refugees brought to Thrace to avoid being kidnapped. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Medal
Scopenote: Prince Charles of Belgium (left) presents President Harry S. Truman (right) a Belgian War Cross at the White House to be awarded the American Unknown Soldier of World War II, yet to be chosen.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Toasts to Prince Regent of Belgium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) presents signed copies of the toasts exchanged at the White House Stag Dinner party to Prince Regent Charles of Belgium (left). President Truman hosted the dinner party for the Prince the previous evening.

title: White House Balcony, South Portico
Scopenote: This is a photo of the exterior of the White House, showing the balcony on the South Portico. President Harry S. Truman oversaw the addition of the balcony to the White House, at a cost of $15,000. This is also referred to as the "Truman Balcony."

title: President Harry. S. Truman Welcomes "National Boy of the Year" Frank Harrison
Scopenote: President Harry. S. Truman (left) welcomes fourteen-year old Frankie Harrison (right), of Valdosta, Georgia in his office at the White House after he was selected the "National Boy of the Year" by the Boys Clubs of America.

title: President Harry S. Truman Delivering Speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks to the nation across all major networks to open a war savings bond drive. A painting of President George Washington hangs in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Cowboy Boots
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receives a pair of cowboy boots made by Tony Lama from members of the House of Representatives and the Chamber of Commerce of El Paso, Texas. From left to right: Representative Ken Regan, President Truman, Representative George H. Mahon, Representative W. R. Poage and Representative Ed Gossett.

title: President Harry S. Truman Throws Out First Ball For American League
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, standing, fourth from right) holds a baseball presumably given to him by Clark Griffith, President of the Washington Baseball Club (front row, standing, third from right). Two unidentified baseball players are also present. Seated in the stands, front row, left to right are: General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder, and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman. Seated behind them are, left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified.

title: Head and Shoulders Photo of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman displays a grinning smile for photographers. Original caption: "President Truman takes time out to pose for photographers today as he completed his third crisis ridden year in the White House with expectations that the worst is yet to come."

title: Gib Crockett Cartoon "The President Goes Into Training for his Non-Political Western Trip"
Scopenote: Gib Crockett cartoon "The President Goes into Training for his Non-Political Western Trip."  The cartoon shows President Truman on a soapbox with advisors around him (Charles Ross, Clark Clifford and Harry Vaughan) telling him "watch your gestures" and "don't look at your notes."

title: Margaret Truman with reporters
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) conducts an interview by reporters on the train when President Harry S. Truman was on his trip to the Western States. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Civic Award
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) receives the Golden Anniversary Civic Award of the Fraternal Order of Eagles in recognition of "Gratitude for his contributions to the welfare of our country and its citizens" at a White House ceremony. DeVere Watson, Grand Worthy Vice President of the Eagles (left), made the presentation.

title: Trip of President Harry S. Truman to Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives by train for a visit to Omaha, Nebraska. From left to right: Olive (Mrs. Ralph) Truman, General Ralph Truman, Mary Jane Truman, President Truman, and Edward McKim. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Mary Jane Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) stands with his sister Mary Jane Truman (second from left) on the reviewing stand at the 35th Division Reunion parade in Omaha, Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Edward McKim at World War II Memorial Shrine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Edward McKim (right) sit in an automobile upon President Truman's arrival in Omaha, Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the World War II Memorial Shrine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands with others at the World War II Memorial Shrine in Omaha, Nebraska. Standing next to him Robert Storz. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Edward McKim
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind podium, right) stands with Eddie McKim (behind podium, left, partly obscured) at the 35th Division Reunion in Omaha, Nebraska. Also present is General Robert Landry (far right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) shakes hands and stands with unidentified individuals during his trip to Omaha, Nebraska for including a reunion with members of the 35th Division. Standing with President Truman is his sister, Mary Jane Truman (second from left). Also present is President Truman's World War I comrade, Edward McKim (background, right). All others are unidentified.

title: Battery D Parade in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: Tanks move down a street in Omaha, Nebraska during a parade for the 35th Division Reunion. All people are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: Unidentified students from Central High School carry the colors and march in the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. President Harry S. Truman (behind reviewing stand, front row, fifth from left) holds his hat over his heart while viewing the Parade. Also present is his sister, Mary Jane (front row, third from left), and Mayor Glenn Cunningham of Omaha (second from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 35th Division Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, leaning over to shake hands) views the 35th Division Reunion Parade from the reviewing stand in Omaha, Nebraska. Also present are, front row, left to right: Eddie McKim; Mayor of Omaha Glenn Cunningham; and Mary Jane Truman. A 4-H group marches by in the parade. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left) meets with two young girls at an event in Omaha, Nebraska. Also present are Eddie McKim (second from left), and Monsignor Curtis Tiernan (standing behind Mr. Truman, partly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leans over the reviewing stand to shake hands with an unidentified man during the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center group, front row, third from the left) stands on the reviewing stand with unidentified others for a parade in Omaha, Nebraska, for the 35th Division Reunion. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Marches in 35th Division Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, carrying hat) walks in a parade in Omaha, Nebraska, for the reunion of the 35th Division, his unit during World War I. Also present are Frank Spina (far left), Edward McKim (behind Truman), General Harry Vaughan (slightly behind McKim), Admiral Robert Dennison (second from right), and General Wallace Graham (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind reviewing stand, center, wearing armband) views a car as it moves past during the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. Among others present with Mr. Truman are his sister, Mary Jane (front row, fourth from left), and Mayor  of Omaha Glenn Cunningham (front row, third from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends War Memorial Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) places a wreath at the War Memorial in Omaha, Nebraska, during dedication ceremonies. The photographers and others around him are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (waving his hat) sits in the back seat of a car upon his arrival in Omaha, Nebraska. Also in the back seat of the car with him are his sister, Mary Jane (center) and his World War I comrade, Eddie McKim. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman Walking in 35th Division Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, holding hat) walks with Battery D in the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. Walking next to and slightly in front of Mr. Truman and carrying the Battery D guidon is Frank Spina. Walking behind Mr. Truman, in civilian dress and two-tone shoes is Edward McKim. All others are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman with Eddie McKim
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) rides in a car with his sister Mary Jane Truman (middle) and Edward McKim (right) upon their arrival in Omaha, Nebraska. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and 35th Division Members in Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, in civilian clothes) walks with members of the 35th Division in their Reunion parade in Omaha, Nebraska. The man on the left holding the banner is Frank Spina, World War I comrade of President Truman's. Walking behind President Truman are his military aides: General Harry Vaughan (second from left); Admiral Robert Dennison (fourth from left); General Robert Landry (fifth from left); and General Wallace Graham (sixth from left, mostly obscured). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Edward McKim in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands on the reviewing stand with Edward McKim (on Truman's right, with hat in hand) at the 35th Division parade in Omaha, Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) arrives in Omaha, Nebraska and meets with his sister, Mary Jane (left), and his World War I comrade, Eddie McKim (right). Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends War Memorial Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the dedication of the War Memorial Shrine in Omaha, Nebraska. Standing in the front row, from left to right: Mayor of Omaha Glenn Cunningham; Governor of Nebraska Val Peterson; President Truman; Robert Storz. Standing slightly behind President Truman is his Appointment Secretary, Matthew Connelly. Standing behind Governor Peterson is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right, wearing armband) attends the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. Also present are his World War I comrades Frank Spina (left, in military hat and civilian suit) and Eddie McKim (second from right). Also present is President Truman's Military Aide, General Harry Vaughan (third from right) and Air Aide, General Robert Landry (background, right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends War Memorial Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the dedication of the War Memorial Shrine in Omaha, Nebraska. Standing in the front row, from left to right: Mayor of Omaha Glenn Cunningham; Governor of Nebraska Val Peterson; President Truman; Robert Storz. Standing slightly behind President Truman is his Appointment Secretary, Matthew Connelly. Standing behind Governor Peterson is General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Marches in 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, wearing armband) marches with members of his World War I unit during the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. His World War I comrade Frank Spina holds the banner for their unit, Battery D. Marching in line behind President Truman are, from left to right: unidentified military officer, General Harry Vaughan, Eddie McKim, Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, and General Wallace Graham. In the next row, visible between Mr. McKim and Admiral Dennison, is Monsignor L. Curtis Tiernan. An unidentified photographer is sitting on the bumper of the car in front of the men, taking pictures. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Mary Jane Truman and Edward McKim
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman climbs into a car in which his sister, Mary Jane Truman, is already seated. Edward McKim stands to the right of President Truman. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Edward McKim in Omaha
Scopenote: Edward McKim (obscured from view) and President Harry S. Truman sit in an automobile upon President Truman's arrival in Omaha, Nebraska. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the World War II Memorial Shrine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits amongst unidentified others at the World War II Memorial Shrine in Omaha, Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: Unidentified students from Benson High School carry the colors and march in the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. President Harry S. Truman (behind reviewing stand, front row, fifth from left) holds his hat over his heart while viewing the Parade. Also present is his sister, Mary Jane (front row, third from left), and Mayor Glenn Cunningham of Omaha (second from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at 35th Division Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) reaches down to shakes hands with an unidentified man while attending the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Marches in 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: President Harry Truman (center, in two-tone shoes) marches in a parade with members of his World War I unit, Battery D, 129th Field Artillery, 35th Division, during the 35th Division Reunion in Omaha, Nebraska. Also present is Frank Spina (left of Mr. Truman, holding banner and wearing hat). In the line of military officers behind President Truman are, from left to right: unidentified; General Harry Vaughan, Eddie McKim, Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, and General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Marches in 35th Division Parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, waving hat) marches with members of Battery D in the 35th Division Reunion parade in Omaha, Nebraska. Marching beside him, carrying a guidon, is Frank Spina. Marching behind President Truman are his military aides, from left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, General Robert Landry, and General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) rides in a car with the mayor of Omaha, Glenn Cunningham (center), and the Governor of Nebraska, Val Peterson (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Edward McKim in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: Edward McKim (right, in bow tie) sits in the back of a car with President Harry S. Truman (left) in Omaha, Nebraska. President Truman is shaking hands with a young girl, who is unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: While visiting Omaha, Nebraska, President Harry S. Truman (center) stands with his sister, Mary Jane Truman (left), and Edward McKim (right). He is in Omaha for the 35th Division Reunion.

title: President Harry S. Truman at World War II Memorial Shrine
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends the World War II Memorial Shrine dedication in Omaha, Nebraska. Seated in the front row, from left to right: two unidentified men; Mayor Glenn Cunningham of Omaha; Governor Val Peterson; President Truman; and Robert Storz.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman arrives in Omaha, Nebraska, to attend the dedication of the War Memorial and the 35th Division Reunion Parade. From left to right: Olive (Mrs. Ralph) Truman, Brigadier General Ralph Truman, Mary Jane Truman, President Truman, and Eddie McKim. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends War Memorial Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) attends the dedication of the War Memorial in Omaha, Nebraska. Also with him is Robert Storz (right), Mayor Glenn Cunningham of Omaha (behind Mr. Truman), and Mr. Truman's World War I comrade, Eddie McKim (behind Mr. Storz). All others are unidentified.

title: 35th Division Reunion Parade
Scopenote: Tanks and soldiers roll by during the 35th Division Reunion parade in Omaha, Nebraska. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) rides in a car during the 35th Division Reunion Parade in Omaha, Nebraska. He is sitting in the back seat with his World War I comrade, Eddie McKim (wearing bow tie). Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) stands in front of a building with Edward McKim (left) and General Harry Vaughan (right) during a visit to Omaha, Nebraska.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets Parents of Wilma Coates
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing in car) meets the parents of Wilma Coates in Carey, Idaho. Wilma was killed by a hedge hopping plane. Standing behind them is General Harry Vaughan. Others are unidentified.

title: Lodge at Sun Valley, Idaho
Scopenote: A view of the main lodge at Sun Valley, Idaho, where President Harry S. Truman enjoyed an overnight stay on his Western tour.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aims a Rifle at a Cameraman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sighting a shotgun at Sun Valley, Idaho. The man on the left is Joseph Burgy, Director of Sports and Recreation at Sun Valley. All others are unidentified.

title: Lodge at Sun Valley, Idaho
Scopenote: A view of the main lodge at Sun Valley, Idaho, where President Harry S. Truman spent the night while on his Western tour.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Grand Coulee Dam
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Washington Governor Monrad Wallgren (left) stand on a bridge during his visit to the Grand Coulee Dam in Washington State on his Western trip.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman and others at Dry Falls Overlook
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves his hat as he, Margaret Truman (left) and unidentified others take in the view on an observation platform at Dry Falls Overlook, near the Grand Coulee Dam, a stop on Truman's trip to the West Coast. (see also 2012-245 and 59-236)

title: Reporters Listen to Speech of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Reporters sit in a large group at tables while listening to President Harry S. Truman give a speech  at the University of California during his western trip. All are unidentified.

title: Flag Day Celebration, Golden Gate Park
Scopenote: A large crowd looks towards the stage at the Flag Day celebration at Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, California. All are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks at Flag Day Celebration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles as he takes the podium at a Flag Day celebration in Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, California. Standing behind President are General Mark Clark (right), Admiral Chester Nimitz (second from right), and San Francisco Mayor Elmer Robinson (third from right). All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks at Flag Day Ceremony in San Francisco
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, behind podium) speaks at a Flag Day celebration in Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, California. Armed forces officers and naval officers, and other civilians are seated behind the President. From the Scrapbook of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Waves at Flag Day Celebration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves to the press and public at a Flag Day speech in Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, California. Standing behind President Truman on the right are (from left to right): San Francisco Mayor Elmer Robinson, Admiral Chester Nimitz, General Mark Clark, and Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Stage for Flag Day in San Francisco
Scopenote: An unidentified man speaks at the Flag Day ceremonies at Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, California. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Arrives to Speak on Flag Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far right) enters onto the stage as generals salute and the band plays at the Flag Day ceremony in Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, California. Standing in the front row on the right side of the podium are San Francisco Mayor Elmer Robinson, Admiral Chester Nimitz, and General Mark Clark. Also present is General Wallace Graham (second row near center, behind two empty chairs) and Admiral Robert Dennison (second row, just over the shoulder of General Clark). All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Generals and Admirals Meet in San Francisco for Flag Day
Scopenote: A group of Generals and Admirals pose for a photograph during a Flag Day ceremony in Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, California. Among those present are Admiral Chester Nimitz (third from the left) and General Mark Clark (second from right). All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Campaign in New Mexico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) and Margaret Truman (third from right) campaign from the back of a railroad car in New Mexico. Also present is General Harry Vaughan (right). Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigns in New Mexico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, second from left, smiles and waves while campaigning in New Mexico. The other men with him are unidentified.
Institutional Creator: Keystone Pictures, Inc., New York, NY

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Campaign in New Mexico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) and Margaret Truman (third from right) view the crowd from the back of a railroad car while campaigning in New Mexico. Also present is Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (second from right) and General Harry Vaughan (right). Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigns in New Mexico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind microphone) delivers a speech from the back of a railroad car while campaigning in New Mexico. Standing behind him is Clinton Anderson (third from right in striped suit) and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman Campaign in New Mexico
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (third from right) waves to the crowd while on a campaign stop with President Harry S. Truman (second from left) in New Mexico. Also present is Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (second from right) and General Harry Vaughan. Others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman during Campaign in New Mexico
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) smiles as she reads a paper that is handed to her while on the back of a railroad car during President Harry S. Truman's campaign stop in New Mexico. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigns in New Mexico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) campaigns from the back of railroad car in New Mexico. All others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman during Campaign in New Mexico
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) appears on the back of a railroad car during a campaign stop in New Mexico in 1948 with her father, President Harry S. Truman. Others in the photo are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman in New Mexico During 1948 Presidential Campaign
Scopenote: Margaret Truman, behind microphone, waves at the crowd from the back of the train during President Harry S. Truman's campaign in New Mexico. Others are unidentified.

title: King Paul of Greece Gives a Speech
Scopenote: King Paul of Greece (standing, in military uniform), delivers a speech. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Dwight Griswold with Major General and Mrs. Livesay
Scopenote: Dwight Griswold (left), chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, and his wife Erma Griswold (second from left) greet Major General William G. Livesay (right), commanding general of the  United States Army Group Greece, and his wife. The photograph is labeled "The Dwight Griswolds and Maj. Gen. and Mrs. Livesay."

title: Political Cartoon, "Out of My Way Mister!"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Jim Berryman of President Harry S. Truman, showing him with his hat and coat off laying on the ground. He is saying "Out of my way, mister....let me at 'im!" He is pushing Thomas Dewey out of the way in order to get at a man labeled "80th Congress." This cartoon was originally published in July 1948.

title: Dwight Griswold, Ailanos, and Tsaldaris at Ribbon-Cutting for the Corinth Canal
Scopenote: Ailanos (left, holding hat) and Constantine Tsaldaris (right, in white hat, facing away from camera) cut the ribbon held by Dwight Griswold (center), Chief of the American Mission for Aid to Greece, to reopen the Corinth Canal in Greece connecting the Gulf of Corinth with the Saronic Gulf in the Aegean Sea. Harold Holtz, a member of Griswold's staff, stands in the lower left hand corner of the photograph with other unidentified men.

title: President Harry S. Truman with President Romulo Gallegos
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) is seated in the back seat of an open car with President Romulo Gallegos of Bolivia (left). He is in the United States to attend a dedication of a statue of Simon Bolivar in Bolivar, Missouri.

title: James Roosevelt and Dwight D. Eisenhower Supporters
Scopenote: James Roosevelt (right, in striped suit) and members of the California delegation to the Democratic National Convention are advocating for the nomination of General Dwight D. Eisenhower to the Democratic ticket. All others are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: James Roosevelt and the California Delegation Arrives in Philadelphia for the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: James Roosevelt (center, in doorway) is greeted by William O. Douglas and Dwight D. Eisenhower supporters upon arriving in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania for the Democratic National Convention. Standing beside Mr. Roosevelt is John Shelly, Chairman of the California delegation (left). All others are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: James Roosevelt Arrives in Philadelphia for the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: James Roosevelt (center, wearing glasses) arrives in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania for the Democratic National Convention, and he is greeted by the California delegation. Standing beside Mr. Roosevelt is John Shelley, the Chairman of the California delegation. All others are unidentified. From the Campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman Family Gathered at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's family are gathered at the Democratic National Convention. Front row from left to right are: Mary Jane Truman and J. Vivian Truman. Standing are General Ralph Truman, and Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Takes the Stage at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman takes the stage at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Standing next to him is Vice Presidential candidate, Senator Alben Barkley. Visible behind Mr. Barkley is First Lady Bess W. Truman. All others are unidentified. This is a photo taken of a television screen. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Acceptance Speech at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's delivers his acceptance speech at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. This is a photo of a television screen showing President Truman speaking. Others in the background are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Alben Barkley at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Senator Alben Barkley are shaking hands looking into the crowd. They are on the stand at the 1948 Democratic Convention in Philadelphia.  Standing behind Mr. Truman is Marian (Mrs. Max) Truitt, Alben Barkley's daughter. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Acceptance Speech at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's delivers his acceptance speech at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. This is a photo of a television screen showing President Truman speaking. Others in the background are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: Margaret Truman at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: Margaret Truman is attending the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. This is a photo taken of a television screen. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Scopenote: Dignitaries gather at the stage for President Harry S. Truman's acceptance speech at the Democratic National Convention. From left to right are First Lady Bess Truman, President Truman, Marian Barkley Truitt, Senator Alben Barkley, and Representative Sam Rayburn. This is a photo taken of a television screen. All others are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Takes the Stage at the Democratic National Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing on stage at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Foreground, from left to right: Marian Barkley Truitt, President Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Margaret Truman. Others in the background are unidentified. This is a photo taken of a television screen. From the Campaign Scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Cabinet Members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands with members of his Cabinet before leaving for the Capitol to address a special session of Congress.  From left to right are: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Clark Griffith at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), Clark Griffith (right), and Major League Baseball Commissioner Happy Chandler (left) pose for a picture at Griffith Stadium on Clark Griffith Night.  Also present is Admiral William Leahy (front row, second from right, slightly turned away from the camera). All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: At Griffith Stadium on Clark Griffith Night, President Harry S. Truman (left) speaks to the crowd. Clark Griffith (right), owner of the Washington Senators, stands next to the President. Standing on the far right is Major League Baseball Commissioner Happy Chandler. Others in the background are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Celebration for Clark Griffith at Griffith Stadium
Scopenote: Baseball players and unidentified men gathered on the field of Griffith Stadium, Washington, D.C. President Harry S. Truman was in attendance for the baseball game, as well as ceremonies honoring Washington Senators owner Clark Griffith, who celebrated 50 years in baseball. The man on the left is New York Yankees Manager Bucky Harris. All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Clark Griffith Shakes Hands with President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Clark Griffith (center), shakes hands with President Harry S. Truman (right) and Happy Chandler, Commissioner of Major League Baseball. They are with Mr. Griffith to celebrate Clark Griffith Night at Griffith Stadium, honoring Mr. Griffith's 50 years in baseball. Standing in the second row are Admiral Robert Dennison (left) and General Robert Landry (second from left). All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Staff at Baseball Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far right) chats with members of his staff at a baseball game in Griffith Stadium. Front row, left to right: Major General Harry Vaughan, Admiral William Leahy, and President Truman. Second row, left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, unidentified, General Robert Landry, Matthew Connelly, and unidentified. All others are unidentified. From the Scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman on the Campaign Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) speaks from the back of the campaign train with during a stop in Newton County, Missouri. With him is Congressman Clarence Cannon (left). The other man is unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman on the Campaign Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) and First Lady Bess Truman (right) aboard the campaign train with the Newton County Democrats. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with the Newton County Democrats
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) speaks from the back of the campaign train with during a stop in Newton County, Missouri. The others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigning in Iowa
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses the assembled crowd from the back of the presidential train during a campaign stop in Iowa. All others on the back of the train and in the crowd are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman with the Newton County Democrats
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at the podium) speaks from the back of the campaign train with during a stop in Newton County, Missouri. With him is Congressman Clarence Cannon (left). The others are unidentified.

title: Truman in San Antonio, Texas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with several men during a campaign stop in San Antonio, Texas. He is holding a sombrero in his hands, possibly a gift from those present. From left to right: Chief of Police Fred Palmer, Postmaster Dan Quill, a representative of the Mexican Chamber of Commerce, Ramon Galindo, President Truman, Fire and Police Commissioner Raymond South, and Texas Governor Beauford Jester. All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman with the Newton County Democrats
Scopenote: Congressman Clarence Cannon (standing at the podium) speaks from the back of a campaign train, as President Harry S. Truman holds a large basket. They are on the back of a train in Newton County, Missouri. The other men in the photo are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands Congress of Industrial Organization Leaders
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands outside the White House with members of the Congress of Industrial Organization's (CIO) Executive Committee shaking their hands in response to their support and promise of financial aid in his election campaign.  Standing, from left to right: James B. Carey, Emil Mazey, President Harry S. Truman, Jack Kroll, and Philip Murray. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Political Cartoon, "There's Always Room"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Clifford Berryman in the Washington Evening Star. President Harry S. Truman is sitting on a sleigh labeled "Truman Bandwagon" and being pulled by a donkey. Two men, labeled "Murray" and "Green", depicting Philip Murray and William Green, are pushing the wheels. A man labeled "Lewis," depicting John L. Lewis, is sitting indifferent on a fence. Truman is saying to Lewis, "There's always room for one more, John."

title: President Harry S. Truman with a Small Boy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) holds the hand of an unidentified small boy while speaking from the rear platform of a train in Altoona, Pennsylvania.

title: Cartoon by Cargill "Light Horse Harry"
Scopenote: Political cartoon by Cargill illustrating the split in the Democratic party in 1948, showing Harry S. Truman straddling a donkey split in two called the Democratic Party.  They are on both sides of a cliff entitled "Wallace Split."  This refers to Henry Wallace's run in 1948 for the Progressive Party.

title: Dixiecrat Political Cartoon by Clifford Berryman
Scopenote: Political cartoon by Clifford Berryman in which J. Howard McGrath (left) holds a gun and says to Harry S. Truman "I'm going to run those Dixiecrats out of here."  Truman replied "I'm afraid they've already gone, Howard."  An inscription from the cartoonist to Senator McGrath says "My Dear Senator, with my best wishes, be sure that gun doesn't kick back, some of them do.  C. K. Berryman, Washington Star, September 5, 1948."

title: President Harry S. Truman Confers With United States Advisory Commission on Education Exchange
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with several members of the United States Advisory Committee on Education Exchange. Seated in the center is President Harry S. Truman. Standing behind him from left to right are Karl T. Compton, Mark Starr, Assistant Secretary of State George V. Allen, Dr. Bennett H. Branscomb, and Martin McGuire. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presented With Lyall Beggs
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with Lyall T. Beggs, (right) Commander in Chief of the Veterans of Foreign Wars, highlighting the 49th annual VFW encampment held in St. Louis, Missouri. The other man is unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets Supporters in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets supporters from the rear of the presidential train in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania during the 1948 presidential campaign. All others are unidentified. from the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Leaves for Campaign Trip
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is standing on the rear platform of the Presidential Rail Car with Margaret Truman (right) and Kentucky Senator Alben Barkley (left) as Truman leaves to begin the first leg of his 1948 presidential campaign "whistlestop" tour. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Delivering a Speech in Chicago, Illinois
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivers a speech in Chicago, Illinois during the 1948 presidential campaign. Others in the background are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigns from a Train in Iowa
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (first from left) campaigns from the back of a train in Iowa City, Iowa. His daughter Margaret (second from left) stands next to him, receiving flowers from an unidentified woman. All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigning from a Train in Iowa
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind podium) campaigns from the back of a train in Iowa City, Iowa. Also on the platform with President Truman is Democratic candidate for Senator Guy Gillette (right).  All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Has Lunch with Farmers in Dexter, Iowa
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman eats lunch with farmers in Dexter, Iowa at the National Plowing Contest. President Truman (center) is seated with Howard Walker of Dexter, Iowa (left), and Ralph Mortimer of Dallas Center, Iowa (right). Mr. Truman made a campaign speech at the Plowing Match before sitting down to lunch. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with Winners of the National Plowing Match
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is shaking hands with the winners of the National Plowing Contest in Dexter, Iowa. On the left is defending champion Ronald H. Orr of Beatrice, Nebraska, and on the right is new champion Charles G. Long of Bethany, Missouri. Others in the background are unidentified. Mr. Truman stopped in Dexter as part of his presidential "whistlestop" campaign. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses a Crowd in Dexter, Iowa
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses an estimated crowd of 75,000 people in Dexter, Iowa during an appearance at the National Plowing Match as part of the 1948 presidential campaign. All others are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigning From a Train in Iowa City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) speaks from the back of a train in Iowa City, Iowa. His daughter, Margaret (fourth from left), joins him, beaming at the crowd. All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigning from a Train in Iowa
Scopenote: Among several men, President Harry S. Truman (second from the left) speaks from the back of a campaign train in Iowa City, Iowa. Also on the train platform with President Truman is Guy Gillette, candidate for Senator (second from right). All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: Marching Band at Truman Campaign Event
Scopenote: At this campaign stop for President Harry S. Truman in Iowa City, Iowa, a local marching band plays for the crowd at the train station. All people are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: People Waiting for the Arrival of President Harry S. Truman in Dexter, Iowa
Scopenote: A crowd of unidentified people, including two children with a mule, are waiting at the railway station for the arrival of President Harry S. Truman in Dexter, Iowa. President Truman spoke at the National Plowing Match in Dexter.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Family Wave to Supporters in Des Moines, Iowa
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and family wave to supporters from the rear of the presidential train in Des Moines, Iowa during the 1948 presidential campaign. From left to right are: Iowa Governor Robert D. Blue, Democratic candidate for Iowa Governor Carrol Switzer, President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman. Others in the background are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Herb Plambeck at the National Plowing Match
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Herb Plambeck, National Plowing Match Director at the National Plowing Match in Dexter, Iowa. Others in the background are unidentified. From the Campaign Scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: Kathleen Meldrem Presents an Ear of Corn to President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Five-year-old Kathleen Meldrem presents an ear of corn to President Harry S. Truman while he was en route to Dexter, Iowa during the 1948 presidential campaign. from the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: Margaret Truman Campaigns from Train in Iowa
Scopenote: Waving to the crowd, Margaret Truman (center) campaigns with her father, President Harry S. Truman, in Iowa City, Iowa. Others in the background are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: Margaret Truman Smiling on Campaign Train
Scopenote: Standing behind a bouquet of flowers, Margaret Truman smiles from the back of a campaign train at a stop in Iowa City, Iowa. All others are unidentified. Taken from campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigning from a Train in Iowa
Scopenote: Among several men, President Harry S. Truman (second from the left) speaks from the back of a campaign train in Iowa City, Iowa. Also on the train platform with President Truman is Guy Gillette, candidate for Senator (second from right). All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Conferring with Iowa Democrats Aboard the Presidential Campaign Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is conferring with Iowa Democrats aboard the presidential campaign train in route to Dexter, Iowa. Seated from left to right, are: Colonel B. J. Palmer, President Harry S. Truman, and Hugh Harrison. Back row, from left to right: Guy Gillette, Jim France, Carroll Switzer, Ralph Evans. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Governor William L. Knous in Denver, Colorado
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) walks through a doorway with Colorado Governor William L. Knous (second from right) during a campaign stop in Denver, Colorado. All others are unidentified. From the Campaign Scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Truman Campaigning in Denver, Colorado
Scopenote: A large crowd of people is gathered to hear President Harry S. Truman speak during a campaign stop in Denver, Colorado. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Delivering a Campaign Speech in Denver, Colorado
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivers a campaign speech during a visit to Denver, Colorado. Others are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman and His Family on the Campaign Trail in Denver, Colorado
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left), First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left), and Margaret Truman (behind Mr. Truman, partly obscured) are walking through a building, past a line of well-wishers, during a campaign stop in Denver, Colorado. All others are unidentified. From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Gives a Speech During a California Campaign Tour
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind podium) speaks to a crowd from the back of a train car during a campaign stop in California. James Roosevelt is on the far right of the platform. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands During a California Campaign Tour
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind podium) shakes hands with an unidentified man while on the back of a train car during a campaign tour in California. All others are unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman During a California Campaign Stop
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (second from right) stands with several unidentified men and two unidentified young girls in Girl Scout uniforms on the back of a train car during a campaign stop in California.

title: President Harry S. Truman During a California Campaign Tour
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) speaks with three unidentified men on the back of a train car during a campaign tour in California.

title: President Harry S. Truman Gives a Speech During a California Campaign Tour
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind podium) speaks to a crowd from the back of a train car during a campaign tour in California.  All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigning on a Train in Bakersfield, California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) stands on the back of a train, campaigning in Kern County, Bakersfield, California. All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigns in California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left) campaigns from the back of a train in California. His daughter Margaret (fifth from left) stands with him, as do his wife Bess (sixth from left), and James Roosevelt (seventh from left). All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigning in California
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fifth from left) campaigns from the back of a train in California with several men, including James Roosevelt (sixth from left). All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: James Roosevelt with a Group
Scopenote: James Roosevelt (fifth from the left) poses for a photograph with several people while campaigning with President Harry S. Truman in California. All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: Crowd at a Truman Welcome Rally
Scopenote: A crowd in California welcomes President Harry S. Truman at a campaign stop. Police form a line for the people to stand behind. A "Welcome President Truman" sign adorns a building. A few people are climbing power line poles to get a better view. All people are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Editing Speech
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman edits a campaign speech while on a train in California. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman Addresses Crowd at Campaign Rally
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center behind the train podium) addresses the crowd gathered to hear him at a train station in California. James Roosevelt (far right on rear platform) joins him. All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman and James Roosevelt Campaigning in California
Scopenote: Waving, President Harry S. Truman (first from left) campaigns with James Roosevelt (second from left) on a train in California. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman and James Roosevelt Campaign from a Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fifth from the left) campaigns from the back of a train in California.  With him is James Roosevelt (seventh from the left), the eldest son of former President Franklin Delano Roosevelt. All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman and James Roosevelt Campaign from Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) waves from a train while campaigning in California with James Roosevelt (third from left). All others are unidentified. Taken from the campaign scrapbook of HST.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Mayor Dan Ponder of El Paso, Texas
