Scopenote: A large crowd applauds during President Harry S. Truman's campaign speech in Gary, Indiana.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Chicago
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman rides in an open car during a campaign stop in Chicago, Illinois with Secret Service men walking beside the car. The car was on Madison Street between Union and Halsted Streets in Chicago. All others are unidentified.

title: A Crowd Awaits President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: A crowd watches cars drive by during President Harry S. Truman's trip to Gary, Indiana. All are unidentified.

title: A View of the Crowd in Gary, Indiana
Scopenote: A large crowd listens during President Harry S. Truman's speech in Gary, Indiana. All are unidentified.

title: Admiral William Leahy Presents Medal
Scopenote: Admiral William Leahy (left) presents the American Automobile Association's life-saving medal to 15-year-old Jane Hatton (center). The issuance of the medal due to Jane's part in saving the life of a fellow student. The man on the right is unknown. From the scrapbook of Matthew Connelly, volume 4.

title: View of a Crowded Street
Scopenote: Crowds gather outside the Memorial Auditorium during President Harry S. Truman's visit to Gary, Indiana. All are unidentified.

title: A View of the Crowd in Gary, Indiana
Scopenote: A large crowd listens during President Harry S. Truman's campaign speech in Gary, Indiana.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Gary, Indiana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is walking out of a train station in Gary, Indiana. The other two men are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Chicago
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman rides in an open car during a campaign stop in Chicago, Illinois with Secret Service men walking beside the car. The car was on Madison Street between Union and Halsted Streets in Chicago. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Henry Schricker
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Democratic candidate for Governor of Indiana Henry F. Schricker (right) ride in an open car during the President's trip to Gary, Indiana.

title: President Harry S. Truman in South Bend, Indiana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with supporters on the back of his train car during a stop in South Bend, Indiana. Pictured left to right are Frank McKinney, Frank M. McHale, John E. Hurt, and President Harry S. Truman.

title: Campaign Trip to Worcester, Massachusetts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from right) and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (right) make a campaign trip to Worcester, Massachusetts. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Rhode Island Campaign Event
Scopenote: A crowd stands behind a rope line with police reinforcement at a campaign event for President Harry S. Truman in Rhode Island.  Several supporters hold signs supporting Truman for President, others welcoming the President to Rhode Island.

title: Bess Wallace Truman Campaigns in Rhode Island
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (right) speaks with two unidentified women during a campaign visit for President Harry S. Truman to Rhode Island.

title: Bess Wallace Truman Campaigns in Rhode Island
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) and First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (second from right) are greeted by unidentified women during a campaign stop for President Harry S. Truman in Rhode Island.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Rhode Island Politicians
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unidentified man during a campaign stop in Rhode Island. Clockwise, starting at lower left, are President Harry S. Truman, Senator Theodore F. Green, Governor John O. Pastore, Senator J. Howard McGrath, and unidentified man.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Rhode Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with an unidentified man during his trip to Rhode Island. Senator J. Howard McGrath is visible in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Quincy, Massachusetts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks to a crowd at a campaign stop in Quincy, Massachusetts. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Quincy, Massachusetts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing behind the podium) speaks to the crowd during a campaign stop in Quincy, Massachusetts. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Campaigns in Rhode Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, left) shakes hands with an unidentified man prior to delivering a speech in Rhode Island. Seated next to President Truman is First Lady Bess W. Truman. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Riding in a Car
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman rides in a car in during a campaign stop in Quincy, Massachusetts.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his vacation party prepare to go for a walk while in Key West, Florida. From left to right: Les Biffle, Admiral William Leahy, Jonathan Daniels, William Bray, and President Truman.

title: Barkley, Truman and Leslie Biffle
Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley, President Harry S. Truman, and Leslie Biffle at Key West, Florida, where the President vacationed after reelection.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Cartoon by Paul Loring "Move Over"
Scopenote: Political cartoon by Paul Loring entitled "Move Over."  It shows an elephant in the dog house, and a man with "polls" under his arms asks the elephant to move over.  This refers to the 1948 presidential election in which President Harry S. Truman won the election even though the pollsters said he wouldn't.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is met by Vice President-elect Alben Barkley after the 1948 Presidential election.  From the campaign scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Converses With Associates
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) talks with his Appointment Secretary, Matthew Connelly (left) and his Press Secretary, Charles Ross (right) while on vacation in Key West, Florida. They are standing underneath a palm tree on the grounds of the "Little White House." From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Truman on vacation in Key West
Scopenote: Head and shoulders view of President Truman on vacation in Key West, before the 1949 inauguration. He is trying to grow a beard.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Items on the Desk of Louis Johnson
Scopenote: This is a photo of the desk of Louis Johnson, which displays photos of President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley, and keys commemorating the inauguration of Truman, Barkley, and Charles A. Ward.

title: First Lady Bess Truman at Carlton Hotel
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (second from left) shakes hand with India Edwards, Chairwoman of the Women's Division of the Democratic Party (right) at an event at the Carleton Hotel in Washington, D. C. Standing in the background, right, is Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan. The other woman is unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Celebrates 1948 Win
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman celebrates his win in the 1948 presidential election at the Kansas City campaign headquarters in the Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri. From left to right: unidentified, President Truman, Judge Richard Duncan, Judge Albert Ridge, and Ted Marks.

title: Hanging a Wreath Outside the Republican National Committee Headquarters
Scopenote: An unidentified man hangs a black wreath on the porch of the Republican National Committee Headquarters.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds the "Dewey Defeats Truman" Newspaper
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds up the Chicago Tribune newspaper with the headline "Dewey Defeats Truman" at the train station in St. Louis, Missouri.

title: Rear Platform Appearance in Sedalia, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) makes an appearance on the rear platform of a train during a stop in Sedalia, Missouri. He is traveling back to Washington, D. C. after the successful conclusion of the 1948 presidential campaign. Also visible on the back of the train is First Lady Bess W. Truman (left).

title: Bernard Dickmann with President Harry S. Truman Holding Up the Newspaper "Dewey Defeats Truman"
Scopenote: At St. Louis Union Station, postmaster Bernard Dickmann (left) stands next to newly elected President Harry S. Truman as Mr. Truman holds up the famous Chicago Tribune newspaper headline "Dewey Defeats Truman."  Man in background is unidentified.  From:  Campaign Scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: The Truman Family in Sedalia, Missouri
Scopenote: The Truman family makes an appearance on the rear platform of a train during a stop in Sedalia, Missouri. He is traveling back to Washington, D. C. after the successful conclusion of the 1948 presidential campaign. From left to right: Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and President Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman in St. Louis, Missouri
Scopenote: From left to right, Bernard Dickmann, President Harry S. Truman, Robert Hannegan, and an unidentified woman stand on the rear platform of a train in St. Louis, Missouri. Truman is returning to Washington, D. C. after the successful conclusion to the 1948 presidential campaign.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Sedalia, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) makes an appearance on the rear platform of a train during a stop in Sedalia, Missouri. He is traveling back to Washington, D. C. after the successful conclusion of the 1948 presidential campaign.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Sedalia, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) makes an appearance on the rear platform of a train during a stop in Sedalia, Missouri. He is traveling back to Washington, D. C. after the successful conclusion of the 1948 presidential campaign. Also visible on the back of the train is Margaret Truman (second from right). Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman on a Train Platform in Jefferson City, Missouri
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) on the rear platform of a train with an unidentified man (right) in Jefferson City, Missouri. President Truman is holding up a piece of paper. The man next to Truman has autographed the photo (illegible). Written in Mr. Truman's handwriting at the bottom of the photo: "Jefferson City Nov 5, 1948 Washington Post, Crow Telegram."

title: President Harry S. Truman holding the Chicago Daily Tribune that says "Dewey Defeats Truman."
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with the Chicago Daily Tribune, headlined:  "DEWEY DEFEATS TRUMAN".  He is in St. Louis, Missouri, en route to Washington, D. C. after the election.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Eben Ayers with Telegrams
Scopenote: Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers with stacks of telegrams congratulating President Harry S. Truman on winning the election.

title: Magazine photo of Thomas E. Dewey, called "Our Next President."
Scopenote: Photo of Thomas E. Dewey on the cover of The Billboard, November 6, 1948, headlined:  "OUR NEXT PRESIDENT".  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Key West with Alben Barkley and Leslie Biffle
Scopenote: Left to right:  Alben Barkley (Vice-President elect), President Harry S. Truman, and Leslie Biffle of the Senate Minority Policy Committee, pose for a photograph outside the Little White House at Key West, Florida. They visited President Truman while he took a vacation trip to Key West.

title: President Harry S. Truman and his Staff at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff and vacation party pose for a photograph on the lawn of the Little White House, Key West, Florida. Front row (left to right), William Hassett, Vice President-Elect Alben Barkley, President Harry S. Truman, Admiral William Leahy, and John Steelman.  Second row (left to right), Donald Dawson, Eben Ayers, General Robert Landry, General Harry Vaughan, Leslie Biffle, Clark Clifford, Stanley Woodward, General Wallace Graham, Admiral Robert Dennison, William Bray and Jonathan Daniels.

title: President Harry S. Truman Sits With Family, Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) sits with his wife Bess Truman (left) and daughter Margaret Truman (right) on the lawn of the Little White House during vacation in Key West, Florida. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4. See also image 64-425.

title: The First Family Sits on the Lawn of the Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) sits with his wife Bess Truman (left) and daughter Margaret Truman (right) on the lawn of the Little White House during vacation in Key West, Florida. See also image 64-197.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross and Matthew Connelly at Key West
Scopenote: All hands turn out to welcome Press Secretary Charles Ross and Matthew Connelly to Key West, Florida. From left to right: Donald Dawson, Wallace Graham, Charles Ross (back to camera), Harry Vaughan (wearing long-sleeved shirt, obscured by Connelly), Matthew Connelly (facing right), unidentified man in striped shirt, Margaret Truman, unidentified man, John Steelman (mostly obscured by Truman), President Harry S. Truman, General Robert Landry, Governor Mon Wallgren, and Admiral Robert Dennison. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Marching Band in Key West
Scopenote: As part of a joke played on Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (background, right, in suit and tie), an African-American marching band led Mr. Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross (partly obscured by trumpeter) into the gates of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. They were in Key West to join President Harry S. Truman on vacation. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross and Matthew Connelly at Key West
Scopenote: All hands turn out to welcome Press Secretary Charles Ross and Matthew Connelly to Key West, Florida. From left to right: Donald Dawson, Wallace Graham, Charles Ross (back to camera), Harry Vaughan (wearing long-sleeved shirt, obscured by Connelly), Matthew Connelly (facing right), unidentified man in striped shirt, Margaret Truman, unidentified man, John Steelman (mostly obscured by Truman), President Harry S. Truman, General Robert Landry, Governor Mon Wallgren, and Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: President Harry S. Truman Picnics in Key West
Scopenote: A picnic lunch is served to President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff on the lawn at the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. The President sits in the back of the circle in the center of the picture, to his left is Bess Truman. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Parade in Key West With Girls Walking
Scopenote: In a joke being played on Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross upon their arrival at Key West, Florida, African-American girls from the Douglas School and a marching band lead them to the Little White House. They are in Key West to join President Harry S. Truman and his party on vacation. All are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Parade in Key West Showing Baton Twirlers and Band
Scopenote: In a joke being played on Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross upon their arrival at Key West, Florida, African-American baton twirlers from the Douglas School and a marching band lead them to the Little White House. They are in Key West to join President Harry S. Truman and his party on vacation. All are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Parade in Key West With Band and Spectators
Scopenote: In a joke being played on Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross upon their arrival at Key West, Florida, an African-American marching band lead them to the Little White House. They are in Key West to join President Harry S. Truman and his party on vacation. Mr. Ross is near the center, wearing a bow tie. Mr. Connelly is walking beside him. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Parade in Key West With Crowd
Scopenote: In a joke being played on Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross upon their arrival at Key West, Florida, an African-American marching band lead them to the Little White House. They are in Key West to join President Harry S. Truman and his party on vacation. Mr. Ross is near the center, wearing a bow tie. Mr. Connelly is walking beside him, smoking a cigarette. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Baton Twirlers from the Douglas School of Key West
Scopenote: In a joke being played on Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross upon their arrival at Key West, Florida, African-American baton twirlers from the Douglas School and a marching band lead them to the Little White House. They are in Key West to join President Harry S. Truman and his party on vacation. Mr. Ross can be seen on the far left, behind the band, wearing a bow tie. On the extreme right, from right to left, are Stanley Woodward, General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, and General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds Press Conference in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, foreground, left) holds press conference while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Standing behind President Truman are, from left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, and Clark Clifford. Also present is Margaret Truman (right, leaning on the back of a chair occupied by a reporter). All other reporters, photographers, and journalists are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and His Lunch Guests
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses for photographers with his luncheon guests while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Seated in the front row from left to right are Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, President Harry S. Truman, and Senator Claude Pepper. Standing in the back row from left to right are Mr. Fitzpatrick, Governor Fuller Warren,  Representative George Smathers, Mr. Griffin, and Mr. Hicks.

title: President Harry S. Truman and His Lunch Guests
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses for photographers with his luncheon guests while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Seated in the front row from left to right are Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, President Harry S. Truman, and Senator Claude Pepper. Standing in the back row from left to right are Mr. Fitzpatrick, Governor Fuller Warren, Representative George Smathers, Mr. Griffin, and Mr. Hicks.

title: Picnic Lunch at the Little White House
Scopenote: A picnic lunch is served to President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff on the lawn at the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. All are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Photographed
Scopenote: As President Harry S. Truman says goodbye and poses for photographers before boarding the presidential plane in Key West, Florida, his daughter Margaret Truman snaps a photo of him from the other angle. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets Marshall Plan Advisors
Scopenote: Conferring with his chief Advisors on International Affairs, President Harry S. Truman decided that the European Recovery Program, or the Marshall Plan, be continued on a large scale. Seated in President Truman's office from left to right are President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of State George Marshall, Economic Cooperation Administrator Paul Hoffman, and Ambassador W. Averell Harriman. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: Attorney General Tom Clark with Congressmen
Scopenote: Attorney General Tom Clark (center) speaks with Representative Karl E. Mundt (left) and Representative Richard M. Nixon (right) during Clark's testimony before the House of Representatives' Un-American Activities Committee. Clark discussed his opposition to proposals to ban the Communist Party in the United States.

title: President Harry S. Truman Returns Home from Vacation
Scopenote: From left to right, Secretary of the Defense James Forrestal, Attorney General Tom Clark and President Harry S. Truman share a laugh after the President arrived home at the National Airport from a vacation trip to Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman Walks to Lunch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, holding papers) walks to lunch with Under Secretary of State Robert Lovett (right, in dark coat and hat). Others in the photo are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, volume 4.

title: Governor Thomas Dewey and a Donkey
Scopenote: Former Republican presidential candidate Governor Thomas Dewey (at microphone) is standing on the back of a train talking with some people. A donkey near the train wears a Republican campaign banner with Vice-Presidential candidate Earl Warren's face on it. Standing next to Mr. Dewey on the left is his wife, Frances Dewey. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 4.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Reporters
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from the left) shares a laugh with a group of unidentified reporters while on a walk in Independence, Missouri.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greeting Neighbors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (fourth from the left) greets unidentified neighbors while out walking in Independence, Missouri. All others are unidentified.

title: Portrait of President Truman as Grand Master
Scopenote: This portrait of President Harry S. Truman painted by Greta Kempton depicts him as the Grand Master of the Masonic state Lodge of Missouri, in 1940.

title: Political Cartoon, "Old Deal vs. Fair Deal"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by John M. Baer." The cartoon is in two scenes: top scene 1921-'33 depicts Old-Time Tory letting Farmer drown. Farmer screaming, "Help! Help!" Old-Time Tory replying, "Oh, Let Him Drown!". Below scene depicts HST throwing life support, Farm-Support Program, to drowning Farmer. Farmer saying, "I'm Getting In A Little Deep, Harry!". Harry S. Truman replies, "Don't Worry! This Will Save You!" Inscribed bottom right corner, "To a loyal friend of all producers- Hon. Harry Truman".

title: Political Cartoon, "He'll Fight to Finish!"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by John M. Baer. The cartoon depicts Harry S. Truman in boxing ring just haven beaten "Wood Bill" being carried on stretcher by Charles Halleck and Joseph Martin, Truman saying "That's Only The First Round!" Robert Taft is on the sidelines with "Taft-Donnell-Smith Bill" saying to the bill, "You're Next! Climb In There And Sock The Champ!!" Artists' signature bottom left corner, along with "Ring Side!" Inscribed bottom right corner, "To Hon. Harry S. Truman- a true friend of workers John M. Baer In 'Labor'".

title: Mrs. Max O. Truitt, Daughter of Vice President Barkley
Scopenote: Mrs. Max O. Truitt, daughter of Vice President Alben Barkley.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman on a Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) bends to hear a question from the audience while Matthew Connelly stands on the left. Both are on the back of a train as Truman tours the country. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: Newsmen waiting outside President's office
Scopenote: Newsmen waiting outside the President Harry S. Truman's office for a news conference.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Portrait of Secretary of the Treasury, John W. Snyder
Scopenote: Greta Kempton portrait of Secretary of the Treasury, John W. Snyder.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: The Evans' in Miami
Scopenote: Mr. Tom Evans and his wife can be seen in this image on vacation in Miami, Florida on the beach. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: Portrait of President Harry S. Truman by Greta Kempton
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a portrait of President Harry S. Truman by Greta Kempton.

title: Political Cartoon, "Something Fishy All Right!"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Burris Jenkins, Jr. The cartoon depicts men throwing away many trashcans full of stinky fish into a truck, labeled "National Sanitation Dept." Two of the fish are labeled "REMINGTON" and "HISS." Truman watches from a window and says, "BUT THEY'RE ONLY RED HERRING." This cartoon was in reaction to the House Committee on Un-American Activities' accusations against federal employees including William Remington and Alger Hiss. Truman called these accusations a "red herring."

title: Political Cartoon on the Federal Budget
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Jim Berryman. Alben Barkley (second from the right) is talking to President Harry S. Truman (right). Barkley is saying "Maybe we'd better try to get a little more for health insurance!" A man labeled as Congress is screaming, stamping on top of a paper labeled "Federal Budget," with papers with various billion dollar amounts, and another paper, "$250,000,000 for compulsory health insurance."

title: Governor Forrest Smith and President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Governor Forrest Smith of Missouri and President Harry S. Truman at unidentified inaugural event.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Vice President Elect Alben Barkley Attends his First Cabinet Meeting
Scopenote: Vice President-Elect Alben Barkley attends his first Cabinet meeting.  Seated from left to right are: Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, President Harry S. Truman, Alben Barkley, and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. Standing from left to right are: Federal Works Administrator Philip Fleming, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Under Secretary of State Robert Lovett, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin, Economic Cooperation Administrator Paul Hoffman, and Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Photograph of a Letter to President Harry Truman from Eleanor Roosevelt
Scopenote: Photograph of a 1949 letter to President Truman from former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, offering her resignation as a member of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Table of Guests at Truman-Barkley Dinner
Scopenote: This is a view of one of the tables at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. All are unidentified.

title: Cabinet Officers Attend Truman-Barkley Dinner
Scopenote: This is a view of one of the tables at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Standing in the center from left to right are Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Secretary of State Dean Acheson. Seated on the right is Nell (Mrs. Jesse) Donaldson. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Alben Barkley Attend Truman-Barkley Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), Vice President Alben Barkley (right), and an unidentified man pose for a picture at the Truman-Barkley Dinner at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: Guests at the Truman-Barkley Dinner
Scopenote: This is a view of one of the tables at the dinner honoring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C. Left to Right, unidentified man, unidentified woman, General Harry Vaughan, Margaret (Mrs. Harry) Vaughan, James Vardaman, unidentified woman.

title: President Harry S. Truman Prepares to Speak at Truman-Barkley Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, left) prepares to speak during the Truman-Barkley Dinner at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D. C. Also present are First Lady Bess W. Truman (seated, second from left) and daughter Margaret Truman (right). All others are unidentified.

title: Official dinner, Truman-Barkley Club
Scopenote: Official dinner, during the inaugural festivities, of the Truman-Barkley Club.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Mrs. Harry S. Truman and Others at the Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, General Harry H. Vaughan, President Harry S. Truman, and Chairman Carter Barron stand together at the Inaugural Gala.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Two girls and the Inaugural cake
Scopenote: Two girls and the Inaugural cake, taken during the inaugural gala.   Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: John Snyder signing bills for Battery D members
Scopenote: Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder signing bills for Battery D members during inauguration festivities.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Celebrities at the 1949 Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Inaugural party with program by movie stars and others.  Left  to Right: Edgar Bergen, Joan Davis, Lena Horne, Margaret O'Brien, George Jessel, unidentified, Dorothy Maynor, unidentified, unidentified, President Harry S. Truman, Alice Faye, Phil Regan, unidentified woman (partly obscured), Lucy Monroe, unidentified man, Jane Powell, Kathryn DeWitt, Gene Kelly.  This photograph is from the Campaign Scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: Margaret Truman cutting the inaugural cake
Scopenote: Margaret Truman cutting the inaugural cake.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Party
Scopenote: Attorney General Tom Clark (foreground, left) chats with Mary Ellen Pendergast (center) and Jacquie Roche at President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Ball at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D.C. All others are unidentified.

title: Performers at President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Performers and others at President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Gala stand backstage. Guy Lombardo is on the left. Xavier Cugat, who is holding a tiny dog, is on the right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman at the Presidential Electors Dinner
Scopenote: Left to right:  Chairman of the Dinner (unidentified), Vice President Alben Barkley, and President Harry S. Truman at the Presidential Electors Dinner.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Truman at the inaugural gala
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves from the stands at the inaugural gala.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Truman and family at the inaugural gala
Scopenote: Left to right:  President Harry S. Truman, Bess, and Margaret Truman at the inaugural gala.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Inaugural Party Attended by James Pendergast and Family
Scopenote: Mr. James Pendergast (third from left) is photographed at an Inaugural party. Pendergast's wife, Kathleen (fourth from left), and daughter, Mary Ellen Pendergast (unknown position), are also present along with two unidentified women. Source: Campaign Scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman delivering the Main Address at Presidential Electors Dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivering the main address at the Presidential Electors Dinner.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Edgar Bergen autographing a program
Scopenote: Edgar Bergen autographing a program at the inaugural gala.   Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Member of Battery D taking a photograph of President Truman
Scopenote: Unidentified member of Battery D taking a photograph of President Harry S. Truman during inauguration festivities.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Musical Performance at President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural Party
Scopenote: One of the bands does a musical performance at President Harry S. Truman's Inaugural gala.

title: Margaret Truman at the Inaugural Gala
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (seated, right) attends the Inaugural Gala for her father, President Harry S. Truman, at the National Guard Armory in Washington, D. C. Captain William Zimmermann appears in military uniform behind Margaret's right shoulder. All others are unidentified. From the Campaign Scrapbook of Harry S. Truman.

title: Democratic National Finance Committee luncheon
Scopenote: Democratic National Finance Committee luncheon,  Mayflower Hotel, Washington, D. C.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Inaugural gala crowd
Scopenote: Inaugural gala guests stand during the playing of the National Anthem. Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Lena Horne performing at inauguration

title: Truman at head table with Battery D during inaugural breakfast

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, right) takes the oath of office from Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson (center, left), during the Inauguration ceremony. This photo came from an album of photos given to members of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery that attended the Inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.

Scopenote: A platoon of District of Columbia Metropolitan Police motorcycle escort move down Pennsylvania Avenue during the 1949 Inaugural Parade. title: The President and Vice President Near the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) waves his hat and Vice President Alben Barkley (right) salutes as they walk outside the White House on Inauguration Day. title: Vice President Alben W. Barkley Taking Oath
Scopenote: Vice President Alben W. Barkley (front row, seventh from the left) takes the oath of office. President Harry S. Truman is in the front row, fifth from the left. Also in the front row, from left to right, are Marian (Mrs. Max) Barkley Truitt, Margaret Truman, and First Lady Bess W. Truman, unidentified man, President Truman, and Chief Justice Fred Vinson. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben W. Barkley's Inauguration

title: Planes Fly Overhead at Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Airplanes fly overhead, signaling the start of the 1949 Inaugural Parade. This photo came from an album of photos given to members of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery that attended the Inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Missouri Float at the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The Missouri float moves past the reviewing stand at the 1949 Inaugural Parade. This photo came from an album of photos given to members of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery that attended the Inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: View of the Capitol Building
Scopenote: This is a view of the Capitol Building in Washington, D.C. This photo came from an album of photos given to members of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery that attended the Inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.

title: President Truman and Vice President Barkley during the 1949 Inauguration parade
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben William Barkley leaving Pennsylvania Avenue and entering 15th Street N.W. during the 1949 Presidential Inauguration parade.  Original photo is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: The Truman and Barkley Families Leaving Blair House for the Inauguration
Scopenote: From left to right, Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman, Margaret Truman, Mrs. Marian Barkley Truitt (Vice President Barkley's daughter), Vice President Alben Barkley, and President Harry S. Truman leaving the Blair House for the Inaugural Ceremonies.  Original photo is from a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Presidential Party Leaving Blair House for the Inaugural Ceremonies
Scopenote: Mrs. Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, Mrs. Max Truitt, daughter of Alben Barkley, Vice President Alben Barkley and President Harry S.  Truman leaving the Blair House for the Inaugural Ceremonies.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Truman Enroute to Capitol for Inauguration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in limousine, enroute to Capitol for inaugural ceremonies - similar to 64-1-44. In back seat of car, left to right:  President Truman, Senator Carl Hayden, and Congressman John McCormack.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Members of Congress lead by Senate Chaplain to their Inaugural seats
Scopenote: Members of Congress led by the Senate Chaplain to their Inaugural seats. Rev. Peter Marshall is at bottom left of photograph (no hat, scarf around neck). Senator Arthur Vandenberg is directly above him. Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: A view of the Inaugural ceremonies at Capitol
Scopenote: A view of the Inaugural ceremonies, with the Capitol in the background.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

Scopenote: Distance view of the Inaugural ceremonies, with the Capitol in the background.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

Scopenote: Aerial view of Jefferson Memorial and Tidal Basin during the time of the inauguration of President Truman.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Aerial view of Washington D. C. during the inauguration
Scopenote: Aerial view of Washington D. C. during the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Airplane flyover signaling the beginning of inaugural parade
Scopenote: Airplane flyover signaling the beginning of the President Harry S. Truman's inaugural parade. Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Zeppelin flying overhead at time of inaugural parade
Scopenote: Zeppelin flying overhead at time of inaugural parade.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley with Battery D and Secret Service agents in inaugural parade.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

Scopenote: Excellent photograph of President Harry S. Truman (left) and Vice President Alben Barkley waving in a car, leaving the inaugural parade route and entering the White House grounds.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

Scopenote: Empty stands, "End of the Inaugural Parade".  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

Scopenote: Kaiser a World War I pigeon, captured from the Germans. He was featured in the inaugural parade.  From an album of photographs of inaugural events.

Scopenote: Aerial view of the inaugural stands on Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

Scopenote: West Point cadets in inaugural parade.   Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Cabinet members leaving the White House
Scopenote: Cabinet members, Donaldson, Barkley, Snyder, Clark and Acheson leaving the White House.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Leaving the White House After a Cabinet Meeting
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet stand outside the White House as they leave following a Cabinet meeting. From left to right: Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Vice President Alben Barkley, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, and Secretary of State Dean Acheson. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Official Cabinet Photograph
Scopenote: Official Cabinet photograph with autographs.  Left to Right:  Krug, Sawyer, Barkley, Tobin, Brannan, Donaldson, Forrestal, Acheson, Truman, Snyder and Clark.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Official Cabinet Photograph
Scopenote: This official Cabinet photograph is signed by all those pictured.  Seated from left to right around the table are: Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer, Vice President Alben Barkley, Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin, Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Secretary of Defense James Forrestal, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, and Attorney General Tom C. Clark. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Leaving the White House after a Cabinet Meeting
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet walk down the sidewalk as they depart from a Cabinet meeting  at the White House. From left to right, Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson, Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder, Vice President Alben Barkley, Attorney General Tom C. Clark, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, and Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan. This photo is from the album "The President and his Cabinet," from John W. Snyder.

title: Cabinet members leaving the White House
Scopenote: Cabinet members leaving the White House.  Left to Right:  Donaldson, Snyder, Barkley, Clark, Acheson and Brannan.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: San Francisco Chinatown victory dinner for the inauguration of President Truman
Scopenote: San Francisco Chinatown victory dinner for the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: San Francisco Chinatown victory dinner for the inauguration of Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: San Francisco Chinatown victory dinner for the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Truman at the Jefferson Jackson Day victory dinner reception
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the Jefferson Jackson Day victory dinner reception.  Left to right:  Senator J. Howard McGrath, Perle Mesta, President Truman, unidentified man.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: The President speaking at the Jefferson Jackson Day dinner
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking at the Jefferson Jackson Day dinner in Washington, D. C. Perle Mesta (third right) is also seated at the head table.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Jefferson-Jackson Victory dinner in Washington, D. C
Scopenote: Jefferson-Jackson Victory dinner in Washington, D. C.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Jefferson-Jackson victory dinner in San Francisco
Scopenote: Democratic Jefferson-Jackson victory dinner at San Francisco, California, after the inauguration of President Truman.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.
Institutional Creator: Graphic Arts Photo Service, New York, NY

title: Jefferson Jackson Day victory dinner huddle with Wilson Wyatt, Harry S. Truman, and Scot Lucas
Scopenote: Jefferson Jackson Day victory dinner huddle, with Wilson Wyatt, President Harry S. Truman, and Senator Scott Lucas.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: Victory party in Chinatown, San Francisco, for inauguration of Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Victory party in Chinatown, San Francisco, showing the 21-gun salute for the inauguration of President Harry S. Truman.  Vice President Alben Barkley is assisted by Albert and Jack Chow.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman Greets General George Marshall
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman welcomes General George Marshall and William Pawley to The Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. From left to right: Admiral William Leahy; Supreme Court Chief Justice Fred Vinson; President Truman; General Marshall; William Pawley.

title: Letter From President Harry S. Truman to William Rigdon
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a letter from President Harry S. Truman to William Rigdon requiring him to take time off to visit Cuba. Lieutenant Commander Rigdon was a member of President Truman's vacation party at Key West, Florida, and select members of the President's party took a day trip to Cuba.

title: Political Cartoon on the Farm Program
Scopenote: This is a political cartoon by Clifford Berryman that appeared in the Washington Evening Star. Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan is sitting behind a desk heaped with mail and saying, "These are the questions and answers to the new administration farm program." Attorney General J. Howard McGrath is standing on the right and is saying, "I know the questions but could I er-er just have a peep at the answers?"

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard USS Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and some of his friends and associates gather for a photograph while on the USS Williamsburg, during President Truman's Fourth of July holiday cruise on the Potomac. From left to right: Governor Mon Wallgren, Senator Clinton Anderson, Clark Clifford, President Truman, George Allen, Attorney General Tom Clark, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, and Oscar Ewing.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Leaving the USS Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in civilian clothes, left) and his daughter Margaret Truman are walking down the gangway leaving the presidential yacht USS Williamsburg. The sailors in the background are unidentified.

title: Sunporch at Shangri-La
Scopenote: The sunporch showing the view out the windows at the Presidential retreat Shangri-La, in Maryland.

title: Presidential Retreat at Shangri-La
Scopenote: This is a view of the path leading to the guest house at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland.

title: Presidential Retreat at Shangri-La
Scopenote: This is a view of the main lodge at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland.

title: President Harry S. Truman in St. Paul, Minnesota
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center foreground) visited St. Paul, Minnesota to help celebrate "Truman Day." Standing in the first row behind him are General Robert Landry and Admiral Robert Dennison. In the second row are an unidentified man (probably a Secret Service agent), General Harry Vaughan, and General Wallace Graham. Behind Vaughan and Graham are Press Secretary Charles Ross and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: Presidential Party in Boca Chica
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party exit the presidential plane, the Independence, upon their arrival at the Boca Chica air base in Key West, Florida. Sailors and United States Navy officers are waiting to greet the President's party. All are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: Truman Family Arrives in Boca Chica, Florida
Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess Truman, Margaret Truman, and President Harry S. Truman are greeted by Captain Cecil Adell as they step off the plane at the Boca Chica airport in Florida. The President and family will continue on to Key West to begin their vacation. Visible in the background, second from the right, is Press Secretary Charles Ross. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Staff at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of staff gather to pose for a picture while on vacation in Key West, Florida. The party is shown on the lawn at Truman's vacation residence, the Little White House, on the naval base. Front row is Miss Margaret Truman. Seated in the second row from left to right: Press Secretary Charles Ross, First Lady Bess Truman, President Truman, John Steelman, and William Hassett. Standing in the back row from left to right: Colonel Cornelius J. Mara, General Harry Vaughan, Matt Connelly, Stanley Woodward, and Admiral Robert Dennison. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman Fishing
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman fish from the boat "Big Wheel" off Key West, Florida, while on vacation. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman Fishing
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman fishing from the boat "Big Wheel" off Key West, Florida while on vacation.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Gift
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) receives a certificate from members of the Grand Lodge of the Free Ancient and Accepted Masons of Florida. The certificate is a resolution from the group, making President Truman an honorary life member and Past Grand Master of the Grand Lodge. President Truman received this honor while on vacation in Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.  From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: Picnic Lunch in Garden
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his family host members of his staff for a picnic lunch on the grounds of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Seated in the circle from left to right: General Harry Vaughan, Press Secretary Charles Ross (mostly obscured), President Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman, Stanley Woodward, Margaret Truman, William Hassett, Matthew Connelly, and two unidentified men. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Members of Grand Lodge
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center in the black, to the left of the man in the light suit) is called upon by the members of the Grand Lodge of Florida Free Ancient and Accepted Masons as he vacations in Key West. The members themselves are unidentified, but they bestowed upon President Truman an honorary life membership and Past Grand Master of the Grand Lodge. From volume 5 of Matt Connelly's scrapbooks.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Honorary Life Membership
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) receives a certificate from members of the Grand Lodge of the Free Ancient and Accepted Masons of Florida. The certificate is a resolution from the group, making President Truman an honorary life member and Past Grand Master of the Grand Lodge. President Truman received this honor while on vacation in Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.  From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: President Harry S. Truman Given Membership
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from the right) meets with a group of Shriners and receives an honorary life membership in the Mahi Temple of Miami. Truman received this while he vacationed in Key West, Florida. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 5.

title: Harry S. Truman and Charlie Ross
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Press Secretary Charlie Ross (right) in a car on the way to the beach while on vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Press Headquarters
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, seated and wearing jacket) attends a press conference of Press Secretary Charles Ross (standing, left) while on vacation at Key West, Florida. President Truman claimed to be serving as a reporter for the Federal Register. All other reporters and journalists are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Poses in Key West With His Party
Scopenote: First row left to right; Philip F. Maguire, Bruce D. Forsyth, George M. Elsey, Joseph G. Feeney, David D. Lloyd, Stephen J. Spingarn. Second row left to right; Clark Clifford, William Hassett, John W. Snyder, President Harry S. Truman, John R. Steelman, Charles Ross, Frank Pace, Jr. Third row left to right; Charles S. Murphy, General Robert Landry, Admiral Robert Dennison, General Harry Vaughan, General Wallace Graham, David Niles, Donald Dawson.

title: John R. Steelman at Key West
Scopenote: Assistant to the President John R. Steelman sits in front of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. He joined President Harry S. Truman on vacation in Key West.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Clark Clifford
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Clark Clifford (right) sit on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.

title: Matt Connelly Reading Letters
Scopenote: Presidential Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly is seated at his desk reading various correspondences. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 6.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Eddie McKim
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Eddie McKim (in checked coat). An airplane can be seen behind them. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Vice President Alben Barkley
Scopenote: Head and shoulders portrait of Vice President Alben Barkley.  Original photograph is in a photo album of inaugural events.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds a Press Conference in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holds a press conference on the lawn of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Standing from left to right: Mr. Phil Regan, Mr. David K. Niles, Mr. Stephen Spingarn, Mr. Stanley Woodward, Mr. Donald S. Dawson, Mr. Matthew J. Connelly, Major General Harry H. Vaughan, Rear Admiral Robert L. Dennison, Mr. William D. Hassett, unidentified, Major General Wallace H. Graham, and Mr. Charles G. Ross. The man writing on his knee next to Mr. Ross is Edwin W. Darby. Identifiable men sitting around President Harry S. Truman (center, in white chair) are Mr. Frank Bourgholtzer (third from left), Mr. Joseph H. Short, Jr. (wearing glasses), Mr. Joseph A. Fox (leaning in, in white suit), Mr. Robert G. Nixon (smoking cigar), Mr. Merriman Smith (partly obscured by Nixon), and Mr. Jack Romagna (in white long-sleeved shirt next to Truman). All others are unidentified.

title: Census Enumerator Interviews the First Family at the Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: Mrs. Eileen Nolte (left), Census Enumerator, interviews President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left), and Margaret Truman (right) on the lawn of the Little White House, Key West, Florida. The Truman family completed their census interview while on vacation in Key West.

title: Census Enumerator Interviews the First Family at the Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: Mrs. Eileen Nolte (left), Census Enumerator, interviews President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left), and Margaret Truman (right) on the lawn of the Little White House, Key West, Florida. The Truman family completed their census interview while on vacation in Key West. See also photo 2012-758 for original negative.

title: Census Enumerator Interviews the First Family at the Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: Mrs. Eileen Nolte (left), Census Enumerator, interviews President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left), and Margaret Truman (right) on the lawn of the Little White House, Key West, Florida. The Truman family completed their census interview while on vacation in Key West.

title: Census Enumerator Interviews the First Family at the Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: Mrs. Eileen Nolte (left), Census Enumerator, interviews President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left), and Margaret Truman (right) on the lawn of the Little White House, Key West, Florida. The Truman family completed their census interview while on vacation in Key West.

title: Census Enumerator Interviews the First Family at the Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: Mrs. Eileen Nolte (left), Census Enumerator, interviews President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left), and Margaret Truman (right) on the lawn of the Little White House, Key West, Florida. The Truman family completed their census interview while on vacation in Key West.

title: Census Enumerator Interviews the First Family at the Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: Mrs. Eileen Nolte (left), Census Enumerator, interviews President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left), and Margaret Truman (right) on the lawn of the Little White House, Key West, Florida. The Truman family completed their census interview while on vacation in Key West.

title: Presidential Party in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and the rest of the presidential party pose for a photograph while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Front row, left to right: John Steelman, First Lady Bess Truman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and William Hassett.  Back row, left to right: Stephen Spingarn, General Robert Landry, Admiral Robert Dennison, Stanley Woodward, Charlie Ross, General Harry Vaughan, General Wallace Graham, and David Niles.

title: Margaret Truman Demonstrates Her Sixty-Second Printing Camera
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (seated, right) demonstrates her sixty-second printing camera while on vacation with her family in Key West, Florida.  From left to right: First Lady Bess W. Truman (seated, left), David Niles, Stephen Spingarn, General Wallace Graham, and William Hassett.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman Boarding the Presidential Plane
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) and President Harry S. Truman (second from left) pose for photographers as they board the United States Air Force Constellation, "Dew Drop" for their return to Washington, D.C. ending the President's four week vacation at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. Alongside the plane is President Truman's valet, Arthur S. Prettyman (second from right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Chicago, Illinois
Scopenote: From left to right, Edward McKim, President Harry S. Truman, and Bill Mox walk in the rail yards in Chicago, Illinois. Truman stopped briefly near Chicago during a train trip west. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Eddie McKim
Scopenote: from left to right, President Harry S. Truman, Edward McKim, and Bill Mox walk along next to a train in a rail yard in Chicago, Illinois.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Eddie McKim
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) stands with Edward McKim (left, in checked coat) and Bill Mox (behind McKim) in Chicago, Illinois. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Chicago, Illinois
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, third from right) shakes hands with friends and admirers during a early morning stop in Chicago, Illinois. Among those present are Edward McKim (foreground, fifth from right in checked coat) and Police Captain Harry Benzin. Others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Aboard the USS Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves while he stands on the deck of the presidential yacht, the USS Williamsburg. With him is his daughter, Margaret Truman.

title: Sesquicentennial Amphitheatre Dedication
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses for photographers with his family and others at the premiere of "Faith of our Fathers" during the dedication of the Sesquicentennial Amphitheatre in Washington's Rock Creek Park. From left to right: Mrs. Mary Shaw Branton; Margaret Truman; Carter Barron, Executive Vice Chairman of the National Capital Sesquicentennial Commission; President Harry S. Truman; and First Lady Bess W. Truman. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 6.

title: President Harry S. Truman Talking With Associate
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and wife Bess (left) talk with an unidentified man while they are attending the dedication of the Sesquicentennial Amphitheater at Rock Creek Park in Washington, D.C. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 6.

Scopenote: This is a view of the main lodge at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland.

Scopenote: Miss America of 1951, Yolande Betbeze (center), meets with Presidential Appointment Secretary Matt Connelly (right). Boykin, M.C. Ala."

title: Miss America 1951 Visits Matthew Connelly
Scopenote: Miss America 1951, Yolanda Betbeze (center), talks with Matt Connelly (right) and Representative Frank Boykin of Alabama. From the Matthew Connelly scrapbooks, Volume  6.

Scopenote: This is a view of the main lodge at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland.
