Scopenote: This is a view of the entryway to the main lodge at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland.

title: Presidential Retreat, Shangri-La
Scopenote: This is a view of the main lodge at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland. The man standing in the clearing next to the car is Commander William Rigdon, United States Navy.

title: Presidential Retreat, Shangri-La
Scopenote: This is a view of the main lodge at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland.

title: Presidential Retreat at Shangri-La
Scopenote: This is a view from the patio at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland.

title: Presidential Retreat at Shangri-La
Scopenote: This is a view of the main lodge at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland.

title: Shangri-La, Presidential Retreat
Scopenote: This is a view of the main lodge at the Presidential retreat, Shangri-La, in Maryland, as seen through the trees around the lodge.

title: Presidential Airplane, "The Independence"
Scopenote: President Truman's airplane, "The Independence"  (an Air Force C-118 aircraft).

title: Photograph of Wake Island
Scopenote: Photograph of Wake Island, where President Harry S. Truman met with General Douglas MacArthur and others regarding the conduct of the Korean War.

title: Photograph of Wake Island
Scopenote: This is the hut on Wake Island where President Harry S. Truman and his military advisors met with General Douglas MacArthur regarding the conduct of the Korean War.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with African American Air Force Sergeant
Scopenote: United States Air Force Staff Sergeant Edward Williams (right) of St. Louis, Missouri, exchanges a handshake with his Commander-in-Chief, President Harry S. Truman (left), at a casual meeting during the President's morning walk. Williams had been a soldier in the Air Force nine years at the time of this photograph. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Visits Honolulu
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) is greeted up his arrival in Honolulu, Hawaii. He stopped briefly in Hawaii en route to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur regarding the Korean War. Also present are Admiral Arthur Radford (center) and Governor Ingram Stainback (foreground, right). All others are unidentified.

title: Building at which Wake Island Conference Occurred
Scopenote: Civil Aeronautics Administration building on Wake Island where President Harry S. Truman met with conference with General Douglas MacArthur.

title: Wake Island Conference House
Scopenote: The building, the home of the Pan American Airways station manager on Wake Island, served as the location for the conference between President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur regarding Communist aggression in the Far East. All the people in the photo are unidentified.

title: General Douglas MacArthur Stands Near Conference House
Scopenote: Military leaders are standing near the building where the Wake Island Conference took place between President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur regarding Communist aggression in the Far East. Standing from left to right: Vice Admiral Arthur W. Radford, General Douglas MacArthur, Secretary of the Army Frank Pace, and General Omar Bradley.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands With Douglas MacArthur
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with General  Douglas MacArthur at their conference at Wake Island on Communist aggression in the far east.

title: President Harry S. Truman Attends Army-Navy Football Game
Scopenote: Surrounded by a crowd of fans, President Harry S. Truman enjoys the Army-Navy football game at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Seated to his left are his wife, Bess Truman, Supreme Court Justice Tom Clark and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. Also present is Averell Harriman (seated, left); General Harry Vaughan (behind President Truman, mostly obscured); and General Robert Landry (behind Bess). All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 6.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Army-Navy Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) meets the captains of the Army and the Navy football teams prior to the start of the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. All others are unidentified.

title: Aerial View of Naval Station, Key West
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of the Naval Air Station at Key West, Florida, where President Harry S. Truman vacationed several times during his presidency. Old Fort Taylor is in the foreground. The number "1" and arrow written on the photo points to the Little White House, the residence where President Truman stayed while at Key West. The number "2" and arrow written on the photo points to Truman Beach.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Former President Herbert Hoover at the White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and former President Herbert Hoover (right) meet in the Oval Office at the White House.  This photo came from the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 7.  This could have been taken February 7, 1951, while former President Hoover was at the White House for a meeting related to the food situation.

title: Administration Building, Naval Base, Key West
Scopenote: This is the Administration Building at the United States Naval Air Station at Key West, Florida. President Harry S. Truman vacationed at the Naval Air Station in Key West eleven times during his presidency.

title: General Wallace Graham
Scopenote: This is a photo General Wallace Graham, President Harry S. Truman's physician, pouring liquid into a glass. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, volume 7.

title: Lunch in the Garden of the Little White House in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his vacation party have lunch in the garden of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Truman Beach
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman has a "bull session" with members of his staff and party that joined him for a vacation to Key West, Florida. From left to right: General Harry Vaughan (wearing sunglasses), General Wallace Graham, President Truman, Averell Harriman, George Elsey, Admiral Robert Dennison, and Charles Murphy (back to camera).

title: Newsmen and Newswomen at a Press Conference in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Unidentified reporters and photographers attend a press conference held in garden of the Little White House in Key West, Florida, during President Harry S. Truman's ninth vacation visit. Standing in the background are Administrative Assistant to the President David Niles (far left, behind photographer), and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (seventh from left).

title: Press Conference in the Garden of the Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated center, in dark shirt with white collar) gives press a conference in the north garden of the Little White House at Key West, Florida. This press conference took place during President Truman's ninth vacation visit to Key West. Standing behind President Truman are select members of his staff that joined him on vacation. From left to right: two unidentified men, Roger Tubby, unidentified man, John Steelman, Charles Murphy, Joseph Feeney, William Hassett, Admiral William Leahy, Press Secretary Joseph Short, Admiral Robert Dennison, and General Robert Landry. All others are unidentified.

title: Residents of the Island Greet President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Residents of Dry Tortugas Island greet President Harry S. Truman (left, back to camera) on his arrival at Fort Jefferson during his vacation trip to the area. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Opening Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman prepares to throw the first ball at the 1951 opening game at Griffith Stadium in Washington. In the first row are, from left to right: two unidentified men, Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley, Vice President Alben Barkley, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Truman, Washington Senators manager Bucky Harris, Senators President Clark Griffith, and New York Yankees manager Casey Stengel. Standing behind and between Griffith and Stengel is United States Supreme Court Justice Fred Vinson. In the second row are Admiral Robert Dennison and General Harry Vaughan (behind Mrs. Barkley), Special Assistant Averell Harriman (behind Mrs. Truman), and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (behind Harris). All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 7.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Opening Day
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman prepares to throw the first ball at the 1951 opening game at Griffith Stadium in Washington. In the first row are, from left to right: two unidentified men, Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley, Vice President Alben Barkley, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Truman, Washington Senators manager Bucky Harris, Senators President Clark Griffith, and New York Yankees manager Casey Stengel. Standing behind and between Griffith and Stengel is United States Supreme Court Justice Fred Vinson. In the second row are Admiral Robert Dennison and General Harry Vaughan (behind Mrs. Barkley), Special Assistant Averell Harriman (behind Mrs. Truman), and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (behind Harris). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Throws Out First Ball For American League
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman throws the first ball at the 1951 opening game of the baseball season at Griffith Stadium in Washington, D.C. In the first row are, from left to right: Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley, Vice President Alben Barkley, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Truman, Washington Senators manager Bucky Harris, Senators President Clark Griffith, and New York Yankees manager Casey Stengel. In the second row are Admiral Robert Dennison and General Harry Vaughan (behind Mrs. Barkley), Special Assistant Averell Harriman (behind Mr. Truman), and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (behind Harris). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Insignia Shield
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and the Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder are presented the official insignia shield of the Treasury's Defense Bond Drive, by the Florists' Telegraph Delivery Association. From left to right: two unidentified men, Secretary Snyder, and President Truman. All others in the background are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, Volume 7.

title: President Harry S. Truman Salutes Colors With Princess Elizabeth
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, right) receives a salute from the members of the armed forces at Washington National Airport upon the arrival of Princess Elizabeth of Great Britain (second from right). Others present include Prince Philip (third from right, standing slightly behind Princess Elizabeth), First Lady Bess W. Truman (left), Margaret Truman (third from left), General Harry Vaughan (behind Prince Philip and Princess Elizabeth), Admiral Robert Dennison (behind President Truman), and General Robert Landry (third row, behind President Truman). Others present include Colonel Cornelius J. Mara (between Mrs. Truman and Miss Truman), Under Secretary of State James Webb (behind and left of Mara), Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin (behind and right of Mara), Deputy Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett (behind Webb), Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (center), and Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman. All others are unidentified.

title: Matt Connelly With Frank McKinney
Scopenote: Presidential Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (left) shakes hands with Frank E. McKinney (right), the chairman of the Democratic National Committee. From the scrapbooks of Matthew Connelly, volume 7.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess, and Margaret Truman in Convertible
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) sits in the back of a convertible with his wife Bess (center) and his daughter Margaret (right) while on vacation in Key West Florida. From the scrapbook of Matt Connelly, volume 7.

title: President Harry S. Truman Goes to the Beach in Key West
Scopenote: From left to right; President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, Captain Cecil C. Adell and General Robert B. Landry walk to the beach during the President's vacation at Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified. See also photo 2015-2334.

title: Margaret Truman and Truman Staff Playing Volleyball
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's staff and vacation party play a game of volleyball while joining President Truman on vacation in Key West, Florida. Margaret Truman is on the near side of the near, standing in front of the pole. All others are unidentified.

title: Harry, Bess, and Margaret Truman in Convertible
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman riding in an open car during their vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: President Harry S. Truman in a Lunch Line with Family and Guests
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is getting his food from the buffet line for his picnic lunch with his family and guests while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Pictured from left to right are: Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess Truman, and President Harry S. Truman. Standing in the background, visible between the two stewards on the left is John Steelman. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Swimming Trunks with General Harry H. Vaughan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is standing outside in swimming trunks with General Harry H. Vaughan (right) near the beach in Key West, Florida. General Vaughan is holding up a pair of swimming trunks. General Vaughan joined President Truman and other members of Mr. Truman's staff on vacation in Key West.

title: President Harry S. Truman Holds Press Conference in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sits in front of a fireplace during a press conference held while he was on vacation in Key West, Florida. Standing beside President Truman is Press Secretary Joseph Short. The reporters and journalists seated around the room are unidentified.

title: Reporters at a Presidential Press Conference at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Reporters quickly exit the room to file stories after a press conference during President Harry S. Truman's vacation trip to Key West, Florida. President Harry S. Truman (standing in front of fireplace, in suit) stops to chat with one of the men. Standing behind President Truman is Press Secretary Joseph Short and Correspondence Secretary William Hassett. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Governor Adlai Stevenson
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from the right) sits with Governor Adlai Stevenson (second from left) and two unidentified men at the Blackstone Hotel in Chicago, Illinois.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Blackstone Hotel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (facing camera, fifth from the right) smiles for a group of photographers during a meeting at the Blackstone Hotel in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Blackstone Hotel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (just to the right of the movie camera) smiles for a group of photographers during a meeting at the Blackstone Hotel in Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Map of Colleges Near the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a map showing the "Institutions of Higher Learning in area surrounding the Harry S. Truman Library."

title: Architect's Conception of the Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a photograph of architect William Boedefelddel's concept drawing of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Institutional Creator: Harkins Commerical Photo Company, Kansas City, MO

title: Architect's Conception of the Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an architect's conception of the Harry S. Truman President Library, by Neild-Somdal Associates and Gentry & Voskamp Architects.

title: President Harry S. Truman at the Blackstone Hotel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles for a group of photographers during a meeting at the Blackstone Hotel in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Architect's Conception of the Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a photograph of an architect's conception of the Harry S. Truman President Library

title: Political Cartoon, "One Buzzard Down"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a political cartoon by Daniel Fitzpatrick of the St. Louis Post-Dispatch, originally published January 3, 1952. In the cartoon, entitled "One Buzzard Down," a buzzard representing "Spoils Politics" lies dead beside a pillar labeled "Internal Revenue Bureau," with the Washington Monument in the background.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Conference on the USS Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with a delegation of officials from Great Britain on board the presidential yacht, the USS Williamsburg. Standing, from left to right: Ambassador Walter S. Gifford, General Omar Nelson Bradley, Sir Oliver Franks, Lord F. A. Cherwell, Lord Hastings Ismay, and W. Averell Harriman. Seated, from left to right: Sir Anthony Eden, Prime Minister Winston Churchill, President Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder, and Secretary of Defense Robert A. Lovett.

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks With Sir Winston Churchill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and Prime Minister Winston Churchill of Great Britain (left) are standing in front of a fireplace mantel on board the USS Williamsburg.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Members of his Staff at Key West
Scopenote: President Truman and other White House staff members congratulate General Robert Landry upon his promotion. This picture was taken while Truman was on vacation in Key West, Florida outside his residence on the naval base. Front row, left to right: Colonel Francis Williams, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry, President Truman, Admiral William Leahy, Admiral Robert Dennison, and Sidney Souers. Back row, from left to right: Irving Perlmeter, Matthew Connelly, unidentified, Charles Murphy, William Hassett, Lieutenant Commander Leo Roberts, Commander William Rigdon, Joseph Fenney, Joseph Short, and Donald Dawson. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Members of his Staff at Key West
Scopenote: President Truman and other White House staff members congratulate General Robert Landry upon his promotion. This picture was taken while Truman was on vacation in Key West, Florida outside his residence on the naval base. Front row, left to right: David Stowe, David Lloyd, Colonel Francis Williams, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry, President Truman, Admiral William Leahy, Admiral Robert Dennison, and Sidney Souers. Back row, from left to right: Irving Perlmeter, Matthew Connelly, unidentified, Charles Murphy, David Bell, William Hassett, Lieutenant Commander Leo Roberts, Commander William Rigdon, Joseph Fenney, Joseph Short, and Donald Dawson. This is a retouched photo; Mr. Bell, Mr. Lloyd, and Mr. Stowe have been cut out of other pictures, inserted into a copy of this photo, and then the photo was photographed again. Mr. Bell, Mr. Lloyd,  and Mr. Stowe are not in other original copies of this picture.

title: President Harry S. Truman Sitting on a Porch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff take part in a humorous commissioning ceremony while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Standing is David Stowe. Seated around the room, from left to right are: David Bell, Admiral William Leahy, President Truman, Roger Tubby, and Admiral Robert Dennison. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: President Harry S. Truman Sitting on a Porch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff take part in a humorous commissioning ceremony while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Standing is David Stowe. Seated around the room, from left to right are: David Bell, Admiral William Leahy, President Truman, Roger Tubby, and Admiral Robert Dennison.

title: Picnic Lunch for White House Staff, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: While on vacation in Key West, Florida, President Harry S. Truman's staff has lunch outside in the yard of the President's vacation home on the naval base.  Seated around the circle (from far side to near side): David Lloyd, Donald Dawson, Admiral William Leahy, William Hassett, General Robert Landry, David Stowe, Joseph Short, Matthew Connelly, Roger Tubby, Admiral Robert Dennison, and David Bell. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: Picnic Lunch at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: While on vacation in Key West, Florida, President Harry S. Truman's staff has lunch outside in the yard of the President's vacation home on the naval base. Seated around the circle (starting from far side): Charles Murphy, Joseph Feeney (partly obscured), David Bell, Admiral Robert Dennison, Roger Tubby, Matthew Connelly, Joseph Short (mostly obscured), David Stowe, General Robert Landry, William Hassett, Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: President Harry S. Truman Having Lunch
Scopenote: While on vacation in Key West, Florida, President Harry S. Truman and members of his party have lunch outside in the yard of his vacation home on the naval base. From lower right around the circle: unidentified naval steward, David Stowe, Joseph Short, Matthew Connelly, Roger Tubby, Admiral Robert Dennison, David Bell, unidentified naval steward (standing), Joseph Feeney, Charles Murphy, unidentified, and President Truman. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Staff
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front row, center) poses for a picture with members of his staff while on vacation in Key West, Florida. The picture is taken on the naval base where the President stayed while on vacation. Seated, left to right: Joseph Feeney, Charles S. Murphy, Admiral William Leahy, President Truman, John Steelman, William D. Hassett, and Roger Tubby. Standing, left to right: David Bell, Donald Dawson, Admiral Robert Dennison, Joseph Short, Matthew Connelly, General Harry Vaughan, General Robert Landry, David Stowe, and David Lloyd. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: Truman Staff Members at a Picnic Lunch
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's staff are having picnic lunch on the lawn of the Little White House, President Truman's vacation retreat at the naval base in Key West, Florida. From left to right: Matthew Connelly, Admiral Robert Dennison, and General Harry Vaughan. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Others at a Baseball Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his staff attending a baseball game between the Washington Senators and the Boston Red Sox. From left to right are: Vice President Alben Barkley; Chief Justice Fred Vinson; Major General Harry Vaughan (behind Vinson); Major General Robert Landry (behind Truman); President Truman; Matthew Connelly (behind Truman and Griffith); Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators; Admiral William D. Leahy; Bucky Harris, manager of Senators; Lou Boudreau, manager of the Red Sox. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: Campaign in Clinton, Massachusetts
Scopenote: Matthew Connelly, President Harry S. Truman's Appointment Secretary, reaches down into the crowd to shake hands with people from the back of the campaign train in Clinton, Massachusetts. He accompanied President Truman during his campaign stops for Adlai Stevenson and John Sparkman. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: President Harry S. Truman on Campaign in Clinton, Massachusetts
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center), Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (left), and Margaret  Truman (right) greet the crowds on the back of a campaign train as stopped in Clinton, Massachusetts. President Truman stopped in Clinton to campaign for Adlai Stevenson and John Sparkman for President. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: President Harry S. Truman Honored at United States Naval Base, Portsmouth
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman  (back to camera, right) is honored at the United States Naval Base in Portsmouth, New Hampshire by Marine Guards.  All others are unidentified. President Truman stopped in Portsmouth during his 1952 presidential campaign trip for Democratic candidates Adlai Stevenson and John Sparkman.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Eugene Donnelly at Battery D Reunion
Scopenote: From left to right, two unidentified men, President Harry S. Truman, and Eugene Donnelly stand near a bust of Truman at the Battery D reunion at the Muehlebach Hotel. The men are members of President Harry S. Truman's artillery unit during World War I.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Eugene Donnelly at Battery D Reunion
Scopenote: Eugene Donnelly (left) and President Harry S. Truman (second from left) sit together at the Battery D reunion at the Muehlebach Hotel. All others are unidentified. The men are members of President Harry S. Truman's World War I unit.

title: Battery D Reunion at the Hotel Muehlebach
Scopenote: Members of Battery D, 129th Field Artillery attend their reunion dinner at the Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri. All are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bust
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands with a bust at the Battery D reunion at the Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Battery D Reunion
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) sits with Eugene Donnelly (second from left), Father Curtis Tiernan (third from right), and other unidentified men at the Battery D reunion at the Muehlebach Hotel. The men are President Harry S. Truman's World War I comrades.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Battery D Reunion
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, sitting right of the standing speaker, attends the reunion of Battery D at the Muehlebach Hotel in Kansas City, Missouri. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Chats with Guests at the Army-Navy Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others enjoy the Army-Navy Football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Front row, left to right: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. In the second row standing between Truman and Margaret Truman is General Robert Dennison, President Truman's Air Force Aide. All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Army-Navy Football Game
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and guests at the Army-Navy football game in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Front row, left to right: unidentified man, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman, President Truman, standing are Margaret Truman, and Admiral William Leahy. Second row: Admiral Robert Dennison (standing, left); and General Robert Landry (second from left). All others are unidentified. From the scrapbooks of Matt Connelly, volume 8.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Arrives
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) carries two suitcases as he walks through a building, with two unidentified men walking beside him and another unidentified man walking behind him and carrying another suitcase.

title: Letter to President Harry Truman from Eleanor Roosevelt
Scopenote: Photograph of a letter to President Harry Truman from former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, resigning as a delegate to the General Assembly of the United Nations.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman in Crowd
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman is surrounded by a crowd of well-wishers upon his return to Independence, Missouri from Washington, D. C. He is at the railroad depot in Independence.

title: Trumans Return to Independence
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) and Bess W. Truman (foreground, left) near the end of their journey from Washington, starting up the walk to their home at 219 Delaware, Independence, Missouri. Mayor Robert Weatherford (background, left) and Mrs. Weatherford are in the background.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Walking with Man
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) walks with Bishop G. Leslie Delapp, Presiding Bishop of the Reorganized Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints (RLDS). The two men are leaving a welcome-home party for the Former President at the Laurel Club dining room at the RLDS (Community of Christ) Auditorium. In the background is Margaret Truman (left) and Mize Peters (right).

title: Portrait of Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Portrait of former President Harry S. Truman. Please credit Portrait by Leo Stern, courtesy Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Portrait of Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Portrait of former President Harry S. Truman. Please credit Portrait by Leo Stern, courtesy Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Throws a Baseball
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman throws the first pitch at a baseball game at the Grandview Stadium in Grandview, Missouri. The two Heart of America Teams playing against each other were the Toedman Cabbies and T.W.A.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Being Filmed
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman is being filmed by Dave Burch for the film "Man from Independence." Former President Truman is walking down the steps of his home in Independence, Missouri.

title: Franklin Delano Roosevelt's Commemorative Coinage
Scopenote: This commemorative coinage was minted during the presidency of Franklin D. Roosevelt. The reverse side of the coin is showing. This coin collection was on display at the Harry S. Truman Library, in Independence, Missouri. The collection was donated to the library by John Snyder, former Secretary of Treasury.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Preparing To Vote
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman prepares to cast his vote in Independence, Missouri. The seated man is unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Voting
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman is walking out of a voting booth after using a voting machine for the first time in Independence, Missouri

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Talking to Two Men
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) is discussing election returns with Randall Jessee (left) and Walt Bodine (right). This conversation is being filmed by the National Broadcasting Systems for the television program "Today". The cameraman is unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman in Omaha, Nebraska
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from left) attends an event with Edward McKim (right). The other two people are unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Preparing for the Today Show
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman is off-set preparing for his appearance on a television show. Vernon Chessman of CBS-TV is attaching a microphone to the former President's tie. They are standing in the front hallway of the Truman home.

title: The Trumans in Their Living Room
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman sit in the living room of their home in Independence, Missouri.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Truman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) and Mrs. Bess Truman sit in the parlor room of their home in Independence, Missouri for an interview. The KMBC-TV camera crews are recording this interview.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Mrs. Bess Truman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) and Mrs. Bess Truman (left) sit on their back porch for an interview on "Person to Person". They were interviewed by their daughter, Margaret, and this would be broadcasted on CBS.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Mrs. Bess Truman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) and Mrs. Bess Truman (left) sit on their back porch in Independence, MO, for an interview on "Person to Person". They were interviewed by their daughter, Margaret, and this would be broadcasted on CBS. The interview was filmed by KMBC-TV.

title: Margaret Truman Interviews President and First Lady Truman
Scopenote: Bess Truman (seated, left) and former President Harry S. Truman (seated, right) are preparing to be interviewed from the study of their home in Independence, Missouri by daughter Margaret in New York, through the Columbia Broadcasting TV. Others are unidentified.

title: View of a Benefit Dinner for the Harry Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (at head table, eleventh from the left) attends a dinner held in his honor as a fundraiser for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library. The dinner was held under the auspices of the Federation of Hellenic Organizations of Illinois and took place at the Palmer House, Chicago, Illinois. All others are unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at His Desk
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sitting at his desk in his office at the Federal Reserve Bank Building in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Inspection of the Construction at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) and an unidentified man (right) examine wood used for the construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Inspection of the Construction at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: An unidentified man (left) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) inspect a boiler during the construction process at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Truman Library Under Construction
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library under construction. This is a view of the front elevation of the Library.

title: Truman Library Under Construction
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library under construction. This is a view of the interior courtyard of the Library.

title: Truman Library Under Construction
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library under construction.

title: Construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Two unidentified men view the construction work taking place on the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Inspection of the Construction at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) and an unidentified man (right) examine wood used for the construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Two unidentified men view the construction work taking place on the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Four unidentified people walk on the grounds of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library as the building is undergoing construction.

title: Truman Library Under Construction
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library under construction. This is a view of the front elevation of the Library.

title: Inspection of the Construction at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: An unidentified man (left) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) examine a pillar during the construction process for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Two unidentified men stand looking at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library under construction.

title: Inspection of the Construction at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) and an unidentified man (right) examine blueprints during the construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Four unidentified people walk on the grounds of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library as the building is undergoing construction.

title: Inspection of the Construction at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: An unidentified man (left) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) examine a pillar during the construction process for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Inspection of the Construction at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: An unidentified man (left) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) inspect the construction of the Presidential Seal during the construction process for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Inspection of the Construction at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) and an unidentified man examine blueprints during the construction process for the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Inspection of the Construction of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library
Scopenote: An unidentified man (left) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) inspect a boiler during the construction process at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Sculptor
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) meets with sculptor Rene Shapshak (left). Shapshak is modeling a clay portrait of Mr. Truman, which will be inducted into the Hall of Fame of the National Museum of Jerusalem. Mr. Lawrence (back center), director of the Jewish Community Relations bureau, is also present.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Escorts Margaret Truman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman escorts his daughter Margaret out of their home in Independence, Missouri, on her wedding day. The man on the right is unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Watches Carolers
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman watches a group of Christmas carolers outside his home at 219 North Delaware Street in Independence, Missouri. All others are unidentified.

title: Carolers Visit the Truman Home
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman watches a group of Christmas carolers outside his home at 219 North Delaware Street in Independence, Missouri. All others are unidentified.

title: Edward Ingram in the Lobby of the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Security guard Edward Ingram in the lobby of the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Child Actors
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands with the children, Jimmy Walsh and Joan Terrace, of the television show "Let's Take a Trip" during a rehearsal at the Harry S. Truman Library. Miss Terrace wears a Native American headdress and holds an enormous key. They stand in front of crates of objects and a mantle, which are being installed before the opening of the Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with the "Let's Take a Trip" Cast
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman plays the piano for the cast of the television show "Let's Take a Trip" during a rehearsal at the Harry S. Truman Library. Show personnel from left to right: unidentified, Joan Terrace, Jimmy Walsh, and host Sonny Fox.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Sonny Fox
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) talks with members of the cast of the television show "Let's Take a Trip" during a rehearsal at the Harry S. Truman Library. The host, Sonny Fox, holds a script while the two children, Jimmy Walsh and Joan Terrace, listen to Mr. Truman. Others in the background are unidentified. They are standing among crates and empty shelves, as the Truman Library prepares to open.

title: Wagon Train in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: A commemorative wagon train begins in Independence, Missouri and will end in Independence, Oregon. The wagon train makes a stop in front of the Jackson County Courthouse in Independence, Missouri. All are unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Starting the Wagon Train
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from right) with group of unknown people and reporters near the Square in Independence, Missouri. It is the start of the commemorative wagon train from Independence, Missouri to Independence, Oregon.

title: Wagon Train in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: A commemorative wagon train begins in Independence, Missouri and will end in Independence, Oregon. The wagons travel down an unidentified street in Independence.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Starting the Wagon Train
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) waving at the start of the commemorative wagon train from Independence, Missouri to Independence, Oregon.

title: Wagon Train from Independence, Missouri to Oregon
Scopenote: An unidentified man loads the commemorative wagon train that traveled from Independence, Missouri to Independence Oregon.

title: Wagon Train is Oregon Bound
Scopenote: Unidentified people get ready to board the commemorative wagon trains in Independence, Missouri, to head towards Independence, Oregon.

title: Wagon Train is Oregon Bound
Scopenote: One of the horse-drawn wagons that were part of a commemorative wagon train heading from Independence, Missouri, to Independence, Oregon makes it way down a street.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Starting the Wagon Train
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (front right) speaks with unknown people and reporters on the Square in Independence, Missouri. It is the start of the commemorative wagon train going from Independence, Missouri, to Independence, Oregon.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Starting the Wagon Train

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Reporters and Photographers
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman poses at the Missouri Pacific train station in Independence, Missouri with journalists from the Independence and Kansas City area.  Standing, left to right: Bill Straeter, J. W. (Bud) Porter, former President Truman, Hurley K. Burgess (Railway Express Managers and friend of Mr. Truman), Sue Gentry, Wes Lyle, and Dick Corliss.  Kneeling, Sammy Feeback and Randall Jessee.  The occasion was a surprise birthday party for the former President given by local reporters and photographers as he and Mrs. Truman prepared to depart for New York and Washington, D. C. to attend a series of 75th birthday celebrations.  Donor: Sammy Feeback.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Receives Gold Key
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) receives a gold key with an inscribed card: "This gold key is presented to Harry S. Truman, for his Memorial Library, in recognition for the selection of Schlage locks as the ultimate in modern convenience and security.  The Schlage Lock Company, San Francisco, May 9, 1957." Also present is a representative of the Schalge Lock Company and Truman Library architect Alonzo Gentry (right).

title: Dedication Memorial for Former President Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: Guests attend a dedication of a memorial to Franklin D. Roosevelt in Roosevelt, New Jersey. This town he created with New Deal funds. Former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt (right, back to camera) can be seen among the guests. Also present were Dore Schary, Governor Richard Hughes, Ben Shahn, and Albert Kastner. All others are unidentified.

title: Portrait of Carlos Romulo

title: Photograph of Painting,  "Last Meeting of Generals Lee and Jackson Before the Battle of Chancellorsville"
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a copy of the painting  "Last Meeting of Generals Lee and Jackson Before the Battle of Chancellorsville." The original painting was painted by E. D. B. Fabrina Julio. This copy was painted by Casimir G. Stapko as a gift for President Harry S. Truman. This painting is in the museum holdings of the Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Henry Talge

title: Foreign Student Greets Former President Harry S. Truman at 79th Birthday Luncheon

title: Guests at Former President Harry S. Truman's 79th Birthday Luncheon

title: Model of the United Nations
Scopenote: This model that symbolizes the United Nations was given to former President Harry S. Truman at his 79th birthday luncheon. The panel on the side facing the camera is a photograph of the American delegation signing the United Nations Charter in San Francisco. President Harry S.  Truman (second from left) looks on the signing. A globe surrounded by the flags of the world sits atop the model on a large wooden stand.

title: Library Staff Members Greet Former President Harry S. Truman on His 79th Birthday
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman Library staff and Mr. Truman's personal staff greet former President Harry S. Truman (seventh from the right) on his 79th birthday at the Harry S. Truman Library. From left to right: Phil Lagerquist; Milton Perry (partly obscured); Frances Schlichenmaier; Harry Clark; five unidentified people; Mr. Truman; two unidentified women; Gene Bailey (partly obscured); unidentified man; Library Director Dr. Philip Brooks.

title: Birthday Cake for Former President Harry S. Truman's 79th Birthday
Scopenote: The birthday cake presented to former President Harry S. Truman on his 79th birthday by the staff of the Truman Library and Mr. Truman's personal staff. The cake is in the shape of the state of Missouri with decorations which include the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers, an American flag, a piano player, and a capitol building.

title: Library Staff Members Greet Former President Harry S. Truman on His 79th Birthday
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman Library staff and Mr. Truman's personal staff greet former President Harry S. Truman (seventh from the right) on his 79th birthday at the Harry S. Truman Library.  From left to right: unidentified guard; Phil Lagerquist; Willie L. Harriford; Milton Perry; Harry Clark; Frances Schlichenmaier; Elizabeth Costin; four unidentified people; Mr. Truman; Eugene Bailey; three unidentified people; Library Director Dr. Philip Brooks.

title: Library Staff Members Greet Former President Harry S. Truman on His 79th Birthday

Scopenote: This is an exhibit case in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library that features items related to Mr. Truman's service in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I.

title: Abraham Baum Presenting Artwork to Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Abraham Baum (left) presents former President Harry S. Truman (right) in his office at the Truman Presidential Library and Museum with two needlework reproductions of Masonic paintings. The work on the left depicts President George Washington as a Mason. The one of the left is a reproduction of the painting "Symbols of Masonry."

Scopenote: Contractor Irwin Fender stands next to a post for a new directional sign for the Harry S. Truman Library located on Noland Road and 43rd Street.

title: Construction of New Directional Sign
Scopenote: R. J. Pataky (left) and Irwin Fender (right) work on the construction of a new directional sign for the Harry S. Truman Library on Noland Road and 43rd Street in Independence, Missouri.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with American Legion Hat
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman holds his American Legion Honorary Past Department Commander hat while standing in his office at the Truman Library.

title: Ken White Visits the Truman Library
Scopenote: Ken White (right), World Champion fisherman, stands with his trophy and shakes hands with Roger Maris (left) and former President Harry S. Truman (center) in Mr. Truman's reception room at the Truman Presidential Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with National Commander's Hat
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman wears his American Legion Honorary Past Department Commander hat while standing in his office at the Truman Library.

title: Ken White with Trophy
Scopenote: Ken White, World Champion fisherman, stands with his trophy in former President Harry S. Truman's reception room at the Truman Presidential Library.

title: Harley Cleveland with Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Harley Cleveland (left) shakes hands with former President Harry S. Truman (right) in Mr. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with American Legion Hat
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman wears his American Legion Honorary Past Department Commander hat while standing in his office at the Truman Library.

title: Ken White Visits the Truman Library
Scopenote: World Champion fisherman Ken White meets with former President Harry S. Truman in Mr. Truman's reception room at the Truman Presidential Library. From left to right: Truman Library Curator Milton Perry, Roger Maris, former President Truman, Ken White, and Truman Library Director Dr. Philip Brooks. The men are all touching Mr. White's trophy.

title: Ken White with Trophy
Scopenote: Ken White, World Champion fisherman, stands with his trophy in former President Harry S. Truman's reception room at the Truman Presidential Library.

title: Ken White Visits the Truman Library
Scopenote: World Champion fisherman Ken White meets with former President Harry S. Truman in Mr. Truman's reception room at the Truman Presidential Library. From left to right: Truman Library Curator Milton Perry, Roger Maris, former President Truman, Ken White, and Truman Library Director Dr. Philip Brooks. The men are looking at Mr. White's trophy.

title: Ken White Visits the Truman Library
Scopenote: World Champion fisherman Ken White meets with former President Harry S. Truman in Mr. Truman's reception room at the Truman Presidential Library. From left to right: Truman Library Curator Milton Perry, Roger Maris, former President Truman, Ken White, and Truman Library Director Dr. Philip Brooks. The men are all touching Mr. White's trophy.

title: Harley Cleveland with Harry S. Truman at the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Harley Cleveland (second from right) visits with former President Harry S. Truman (far right) at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri. Also present is Truman Library Director Dr. Philip Brooks (second from left). The other man is unidentified.

title: Harley Cleveland and Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Harley Cleveland (left) shakes hands with former President Harry S. Truman (right) in Mr. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with American Legion Hat
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman holds his American Legion Honorary Past Department Commander hat while standing in his office at the Truman Library.

title: Governor Matthew E. Welsh Visits the Truman Library
Scopenote: From left to right, former President Harry S. Truman, May Wallace (Mrs. George P. Wallace), Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana, and Mrs. Welsh pose for a group photograph outside Mr. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library. The man on the right is unidentified.

title: Governor Matthew E. Welsh Visits the Truman Library
Scopenote: Governor Matthew Welsh of Indiana (right, back to camera) shakes hands with May Southern Wallace (Mrs. George P. Wallace) during a visit to the Truman Presidential Library. Standing on the left is former President Harry S. Truman. Mrs. Welsh (second from left) is looking on.

title: Governor Matthew Welsh and Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana (foreground, left) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) stand and pose for a photograph in a conference room at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library. Looking on in the background is Mrs. Welsh (left).

title: Governor Matthew Welsh Signing Guest Register
Scopenote: Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana signs the Harry S. Truman Library guest register as Mrs. Welsh looks on. Others are unidentified.

title: Governor Matthew Welsh With Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana and former President Harry S. Truman look a framed object while Mrs. Welsh looks on from the background. They are in a conference room at the Truman Library.

title: Governor Matthew Welsh and Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana and former President Harry S. Truman look a framed certificate in a conference room at the Truman Library. In the background is May Southern Wallace (Mrs. George P. Wallace).

title: Governor Matthew Welsh with Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana (left) stands with and May Southern Wallace (Mrs. George P. Wallace) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) during a visit at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Governor Matthew Welsh Stands with Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana (foreground, left) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) stand and pose for a photograph in a conference room at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library. Looking on in the background are Mrs. Welsh (left) and May Southern Wallace (right).

title: Governor Matthew E. Welsh Visits the Truman Library
Scopenote: From left to right, former President Harry S. Truman, May Wallace (Mrs. George P. Wallace), Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana, and Mrs. Welsh pose for a group photograph outside Mr. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Governor Matthew Welsh With Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Governor Matthew E. Welsh of Indiana and former President Harry S. Truman look a framed object while Mrs. Welsh looks on from the background. They are in a conference room at the Truman Library.

title: The Office of Former President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: This is former President Harry S. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Edward Murrell
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with Edward Murrell (right) in Mr. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: John H. Martino
Scopenote: This is a portrait of John H. Martino, Truman Library employee.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Meets with Two Men
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with Sir Harry Howard (right), the Lord Mayor of Perth, Australia, and an unidentified local man (left). They are in Mr. Truman's office at the Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Meets with Two Men
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with Sir Harry Howard (right), the Lord Mayor of Perth, Australia, and an unidentified local man (left). They are in Mr. Truman's office at the Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with Man
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) is shaking hands with Edward Murrell (right) in his office at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Meets with Two Men
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) meets with Sir Harry Howard (right), the Lord Mayor of Perth, Australia, and an unidentified local man (left). They are in Mr. Truman's office at the Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with Man
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) is shaking hands with Edward Murrell (right) in his office at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Sir Harry Howard at the Truman Library
Scopenote: On a visit from Australia, Sir Harry Howard, Lord Mayor of Perth, Australia (left), receives a tour of the Harry S. Truman Library from Curator Milton Perry (right).

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Meets with Sir Harry Howard
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) meets with Sir Harry Howard (right), Lord Mayor of Perth, Australia in his office at the Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Meets with Two Men
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with Sir Harry Howard (right), the Lord Mayor of Perth, Australia, and an unidentified local man (left). They are in Mr. Truman's office at the Truman Library.

Scopenote: This is a view of the upper stacks area of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Reception Area
Scopenote: This is the North Lobby in the Harry S. Truman Library. In the lobby is a Baldwin Piano.

Scopenote: This is the office of Truman Library Director, Dr. Philip C. Brooks, at the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is the main lobby of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, looking east.

title: Stacks at the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a view of the lower stacks area of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Auditorium of the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: This is the auditorium of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri. On the stage is a Steinway piano, an instrument that former President Harry S. Truman was fond of.

title: Stacks at the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Archivists Philip D. Lagerquist (standing) and Erwin Mueller work in the stacks, in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Garden Room at the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: This is the garden room exhibit space at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is the Presidential Exhibit room of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is the 35th Division Exhibit Room of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is former President Harry S. Truman's reception room at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Staff Office
Scopenote: This is a view of one of the staff offices of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Main Lobby, Truman Library
Scopenote: This is the main lobby of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri. This view is looking east, and part of the Thomas Hart Benton mural can be seen.

title: Exhibit in the President's Exhibit Room
Scopenote: This is a view of one of the exhibit cases in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of one of the exhibit cases on past Presidents in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of a special Christmas exhibit at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of a special Christmas exhibit at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: The Truman White House China is on display in the Garden Room of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of one of the exhibit cases on past Presidents in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Christmas Exhibit, Truman Library
Scopenote: This is a view of a special Christmas exhibit at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Masonic Exhibit
Scopenote: This is a view of an exhibit case at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri, related to Mr. Truman's membership in various Masonic organizations.

title: White House China
Scopenote: The Truman White House China is on display in the Garden Room of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: The flags and Presidential Seal are on display at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of a special Christmas exhibit at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: These flags are on display in the 35th Division Exhibit of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of one of the exhibit cases on the President's role as Commander in Chief in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of one of the exhibit cases on winning World War II in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of one of the exhibit cases on the President's role as Commander in Chief in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: This is a view of one of the exhibit cases on Inaugural ceremonies in the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.

Scopenote: The flags and Presidential Seal are on display at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library in Independence, Missouri.
